Job Description:
The Opportunity:As a ServiceNow Architect, you know how to harness the latest technologies by developing low-code platforms and creating user-friendly solutions for your clients. We’re looking for an experienced ServiceNow Architect like you to support the management of low-code development platforms from vision to production-ready, solving our clients’ most complex challenges.  As an Architect at Booz Allen, you'll lead the design and configuration of a client’s ServiceNow implementation architecture. You'll work with a service management team on developing and configuring ServiceNow applications and solutions to implement system stakeholder requirements. Advise the team in performing hands-on design, development, and modification to extend capabilities offered by the ServiceNow platform. You’ll be a trusted advisor to DoD customers to understand their mission, current architecture and priorities, and security requirements.Use your software support skills for good.  Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have:
10+ years of experience with developing ServiceNow solutions across platform applications
10+ years of experience with architecting, designing, and implementing ServiceNow systems, solutions, and tools across the Platform for DoD or Federal organizations
Experience with Glidescripting, business rules, client scripts, data imports, out of the box config, custom apps, and development methods
Experience with requirements management and Agile development practices
Experience in working with Government clients in the development of ServiceNow implementation strategies and roadmaps for optimal implementation leveraging best practices
Experience with leading development teams providing guidance and mentorship for staff members while sharing experiences
Ability to collaborate with project and proposal teams effectively to incorporate ServiceNow solutions and while articulating high-quality implementation plans
Ability to work with senior leaders and executives to foster positive client relationships
Bachelor’s degree
ServiceNow Certified Master Architect (CMA) or Technical Architect (CTA) certification

Nice If You Have:
Experience with Web development, including technologies, including X-HTML, CSS3, SQL, XML, or Angular and JavaScript, PHP, .NET, or Java
Experience with implementing scripted web services in ServiceNow, jQuery or Prototype libraries, Java, and CMDB or asset integrations in ServiceNow
Knowledge of REST and SOAP web service protocols
Knowledge of SAML, Active Directory, or LDAP
ServiceNow developer Certification, including ITSM, ITOM, Asset Mgt, ITBM, CSM, SecOps, GRC, or HR
ServiceNow Certification, including Certified ServiceNow Master Architect, Certified Application Developer, or Certified System Administrator
DoD 8570 Certification, including Security+ or CSSP
ITILv3 Foundations Certification

Contract: DMDC Enterprise Service Delivery Tools Modernization

Job Description:
Key Role:
Support strategic and operational analysis of CBRN subjects across the entire spectrum of conflict, including competition, crisis, and conflict. Research and conduct analytic rigor to assess CBRN threats, including adversary programs, proliferation, and supply chains. Apply technical expertise to facilitate understanding of complex CBRN issues to enable informed risk analysis and decision support for senior client leadership. Review information from various sources and apply analysis best practices on CBRN military capabilities, threats, requirements, and related subjects. Develop systems that enable conventional, unconventional, and dynamic force tracking for national and theater mission sets. Leverage expertise to inform CBRN equities into cross-government exercise and planning events to enable mission execution. 

Basic Qualifications: 

4+ years of experience in analyzing state or non-state WMD capabilities, proliferation, doctrine and strategy, command and control, and contemporary arms control agreements

Experience with the joint planning process and integrating the military intelligence function into contingency planning and product development

Experience developing deliverables and briefing to a senior level audience and key stakeholders

Knowledge of all-source intelligence processes and procedures, including ICD 203

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree and 4+ years of experience analyzing or assessing military capabilities and force employment, or 10+ years of experience analyzing or assessing military capabilities and force employment in lieu of a degree


Additional Qualifications: 

Experience working at a combatant command, joint staff, or service component command

Knowledge of intelligence databases and software programs for analysis of political-military issues, including Analyst Notebook, Tableau, RMT, Cedalion, Firehawk, HOTR, M3, MIDB, and PALANTIR

Knowledge of foreign disclosure process​

Possession of excellent written and verbal communication skills

Completion of Joint Professional Military Education

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. With the critical decisions made in our government every day, we need an intel analyst like you to do just that. As a counterproliferation analyst, you use your specialized experience and attention to detail to give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills.

As a counterproliferation analyst on our team, you will design, develop, and execute solutions in support of intelligence organizations, missions, or processes. You’ll apply advanced consulting skills or extensive technical expertise, including full industry knowledge. You’ll develop innovative solutions to complex problems, work without considerable direction, and mentor and supervise team members.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

8+ years of experience with intelligence analysis, U.S. government all-source analytic production, or specialized intelligence analysis training

Experience authoring products utilizing ICD 203 and ICD 206 tradecraft standards

Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

Ability to develop high-quality deliverables tailored to senior policymakers or defense stakeholders, including complex written products, ad hoc reports, and formal or informal briefings

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

HS diploma or GED and 12+ years of experience with analysis, or Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of experience with analysis


Nice If You Have:

Experience with all-source intelligence analysis and production for military activities and operations, such as delivery systems, counterproliferation, and counterterrorism

Experience working at a Combatant Command or in a forward-deployed environment

Experience working with special operations forces

Experience in task management or mission management

Knowledge of the intelligence cycle and intelligence planning

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Job Requisition: R0217387 Digital Network Exploitation Analyst, Senior (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you have strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset? Are you looking for an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation's leaders? As a Digital Network Exploitation Analyst, you will use your specialized technical experience to identify and analyze network vulnerabilities and potential access vectors in support of intelligence and cyberspace operations.
 
As an Analyst on our team, you’ll provide expert analytic support against high-value targets while working alongside your client to tackle complex and challenging problems in computer network analysis, network exploitation, digital network intelligence, dataflow, and network mapping. You’ll leverage your knowledge of computer network environments and apply subject matter expertise in various protocol suites to analyze technology vulnerabilities and help promote cutting-edge analysis. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills, share your methodologies with other analysts, and be a part of a team conducting offensive cyberspace operations that are crucial to national security.
 
Join us. The world can't wait.
 
You Have:

6+ years of experience with digital network exploitation and signals intelligence (SIGINT) analysis

Experience analyzing computer networks, protocols, and communications technologies 

Knowledge of telecommunications equipment, network configurations, and data communications 

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

HS diploma or GED

 
Nice If You Have:

Knowledge of dataflow and SIGINT architecture 

Knowledge of processes and tools related to SIGINT discovery analysis 

Knowledge of programming languages, including Python or C++ for scripting and automation 

Bachelor's degree 

Network+, Security+, CEH, CCNA, or SANS Certifications

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Everyone is trying to “harness the cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a cloud computing application architect, you know how to create a cloud-based technical architecture that meets client needs and takes advantage of cloud capabilities. What if you could use your cloud architecture skills to improve security systems to safeguard our nation? We need you to help us develop cloud-based solutions for some of national security's toughest problems. 

You’ll closely collaborate with fellow cloud architects and engineers specializing in AWS to design, develop, test, and deploy cloud solution components. You’ll have the chance to work within a DevOps framework to create and manage container apps and use products like Kubernetes to further the mission. With access to our internal AWS Labs, you’ll have the space and time to explore different ways of solving our client’s problems and partner with stakeholders and your team to deliver the right technical solutions. Whether modernizing legacy computing platforms and applications or creating new ones from scratch, you’ll have the latest tech and brightest teammates at your fingertips. 

Ready to transform National Security with cloud technology? 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 
10+ years of experience with Cloud Architecture
3+ years of experience in the implementation of cloud technologies, including Azure
Experience with CI/CD tools
Experience with Terraform
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Bachelor's degree
Azure Solutions Architect Certification

Nice If You Have:  
Experience managing and optimizing databases on AWS, including RDS and DynamoDB
Experience programming in Python for automation and scripting tasks 
Experience with DevOps practices and methodologies
Ability to design and implement RESTful APIs and work with third-party APIs

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Everyone is trying to “harness the cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a cloud computing application architect, you know how to create a cloud-based technical architecture that meets client needs and takes advantage of cloud capabilities. What if you could use your cloud architecture skills to improve National Security? We need you to help us develop cloud-based solutions for some of National Security's toughest problems. 

On our team, you’ll collaborate with fellow cloud architects and engineers specializing in Oracle to design, develop, test, and deploy cloud solution components. You’ll have the chance to work within a DevOps framework to create and manage container apps and use products like Kubernetes to further the mission. This is an opportunity to use the latest cloud technologies as you look for ways to improve your client’s environment using current cloud capabilities. Your technical expertise will be vital as you work with National Security to inform strategy and design and ensure standards are met throughout the cloud migration process.  

You’ll recommend tools and solutions based on your research of the current environment and knowledge of various on-premises, cloud-based, and hybrid resources. You’ll lead your team as they help the client overcome their most difficult challenges in the cloud. Additionally, you’ll broaden your skill set in areas like cutting-edge enterprise cloud platforms to support your clients as they modernize their IT infrastructure and meet their most challenging missions while developing critical systems for National Security. 

Ready to transform National Security with cloud technology? 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

10+ years of experience with Cloud Architecture

Work collaboratively with a team of researchers, developers, and telecommunications experts. Perform penetration testing, vulnerability research, generate reports and brief findings, assist in the development of prototypes, and contribute to the design of security solutions for mobile telecommunications systems. Leverage comprehension of telecommunications networks, next generation networking concepts, and protocol analysis to aid in vulnerability and security analysis. Apply knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks, methodologies, and skillsets to consult with team members, clients, and leadership on vulnerability projects.

Experience with Linux command line environments  
Experience scanning and analyzing information system vulnerabilities to assess risk to networks, operating systems, web applications, databases, and other components
Experience with network security and vulnerability analysis tools such as Wireshark, Burpsuite, Nessus, NMAP, and native Linux command-line tools
Experience conducting manual exploitation methods  
Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Perl, Bash, or Ruby

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a cyberspace training facilitator, you understand the value of hunt-forward operations, and you know that battles are won in the grey. At Booz Allen, you can use your cyberspace operations experience to create solutions that will be executed on a worldwide stage. We’re looking for an experienced cyber mission specialist like you to apply your knowledge. We need an experienced front-end developer who will use their passion to guide a development team to learn new tools and techniques, identify and implement system improvements, and mentor teammates. This is an opportunity to solve problems in the DoD Cyber industry by collaborating with a development team to build custom SharePoint-based solutions with user centric design. You’ll coordinate with SharePoint designers and developers to create a seamless user experience using jQuery plugins, REST API, SPServices, and custom workflows as well as create supporting documentation for the client's programs and associated portals, to include user guides, business processes, developer guides, and admin guides. Your team will ensure accessibility for all users by developing a front end that functions across browsers, platforms, and devices while meeting accessibility and security requirements.

You’ll support a government client in the development of On-the-Job Training Guides, and Train-the-Trainer documentation that combine elements of various sources of tasks, including Defense Cyberspace Warfare Framework (DCWF), National Initiative for Cybersecurity Education (NICE), and unique operational requirements and standards of the government client. You’ll support the assessment of effectiveness of training, evaluation of training objectives for various functional activities, identifying and tracking observations and lessons learned, and assisting with developing professional development plans for personnel through a custom SharePoint interface.

With mentoring, positive code reviews, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers. Join us as we build systems to change DoD Cyber for the better and impact our nation’s security.

Join us. The world can’t wait.   

You Have:

5+ years of experience with training

Experience with SharePoint solutions

Knowledge of working in an Agile-based Software Development Life Cycle delivery team

Ability to conduct solutions-based technical research

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:

Experience with SharePoint custom solutions development and design

Experience with information and systems administration, database administration, data analysis and visualization, research and development, and similar technical competencies

Experience contributing to the development and maintenance of standards and evaluation tools, such as Joint standards for training, USAF JQS, Navy Personnel Qualification Standards (PQS), JMETs, DCWF, or NICE

Experience supporting a Combatant Command

Experience contributing to substantive content to the development and maintenance of training documentation and guidance, such as training curriculums, Joint cyber training, and certification standards

Possession of excellent detail-oriented and organizational skills

Possession of excellent communications skills

Possession of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact on national security? You understand your customer's environment and how to develop the right solutions for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused engineering solution.

As a Dataflow System Engineer on our team, you have the chance to shape the evolution of mission data governance by leading modernization efforts for the client's enterprise data flow team. Your customer will trust you to provide Tier 1 operations support for customer data flow requests, specify requirements for new data flows, coordinate with data flow service providers, and define processes, business rules, and functional requirements for mission systems that support data flow. You will work closely with customers and stakeholders across a variety of roles and teams to plan and implement dataflows supporting critical cyber missions. On our team, you'll be able to broaden your skill set into areas like cross-domain technologies and concepts, data handling and tagging, and data schema development and validation. Grow your skills by merging system engineering and mission data governance to create modernized processes and systems supporting enterprise data flow for a national security client. Join our team and create the future of mission data governance in national security.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

7+ years of experience working on contracts for the federal government

Experience with data flow, Apache NiFi, or mission systems

Experience defining and applying data tagging and handling requirements

Experience analyzing and defining data schemas and data processing requirements

Experience developing capability level and functional requirements, mission scenarios, use cases, or business processes

Knowledge of data governance concepts such as data provenance, classification, sizing, retention, data sharing, and marking  

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor’s degree in an IT Engineering field and 7+ years of experience with systems engineering, or 12+ years of experience with systems engineering in lieu of a degree

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a defense mission professional, you ask questions others don’t. You understand the nuances of complex situations. You use your skills to think bigger and push further, solving complex problems. We’re looking for an expert like you to create solutions for missions that keep our nation safe.

As a Joint Operation Planner, you’ll bring your military planning expertise to work on projects supporting national defense and military capability development and employment. You’ll analyze available information, develop and test options, write plans and orders, and assess organizational progress to aid in accomplishing the organization's objectives in and through cyberspace. Participate and provide input throughout all planning functions, from translating strategic guidance through concept and plan development to plan assessments and associated functions. You will contribute to the development, revision, and coordination of campaign, support, and contingency plans, including commander’s estimates, base plans, concept plans, and operations plans, and ensure Cyberspace operations are integrated with all appropriate and associated annexes and appendices. You will coordinate and integrate DoD requirements, targets, and priorities into planning and participate in all Joint operation contingency and crisis planning activities as a member of Joint Planning Groups (JPGs) and Operational Planning Teams (OPTs), as needed, to ensure proper representation of applicable guidance and doctrine into planning. You’ll be a trusted advisor to our clients, and we’ll look to you to identify, analyze, and evaluate complex systems, policies, processes, and capabilities related to countering foreign cyberspace threats and bolstering homeland security as part of the joint mission.

You’ll guide the work we do for military cyberspace operations and the solutions we deliver for military missions, cyberspace defense, national security, and strategic and operational planning.
Further your career with us as you help solve complex design, integration, and analytical problems for the Joint Force's cyberspace missions. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

5+ years of experience as a Joint Operation Planner or completion of an advanced planner school, such as School of Advanced Military Studies (SAMS), School of Advanced Warfighting (SAW), School of Advanced Air and Space Studies (SAASS), or Joint Advanced Warfighting School (JAWS)

Knowledge of the Joint Planning Process (JPP), JOPES, and APEX planning formats

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

Bachelor's degree 

Joint Professional Military Education Phase II (JPME II) certification or 4+ additional years of operations planning experience


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with the developing, revising, and coordinating of campaign, support, and contingency plans, including commander’s estimates, base plans, concept plans, and operations plans

Experience with integrating DoD requirements, targets, and priorities into planning and participation in Joint operation contingency and crisis planning activities

Knowledge of subjects relating to the conduct, activities, governance, business practices, or operation of Combatant Commands

Ability to work independently without supervision

Ability to analyze available information, develop and test options, write plans and orders, and assess organizational progress

Possession of excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph


Clearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Critical decisions are made every single day in support of our nation's defense. What if you could use your Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) skills and operational mindset to help protect our nation?

As a Signals Intelligence Operator (SIO), you will use your technical, operational, or military experience to conduct technical SIGINT collection for our client. If you have a strong operational background, analytical skills, and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity for you to use those skills to support our nation's security.

As an SIO on our team, you'll play a critical role in helping our client understand their operational battlespace and the national-level threats in that space. You'll gain an understanding of a multitude of different collection platforms and tools as you help drive complex worldwide operations to develop actionable intelligence against the highest priorities. You'll work with a team where you will share your skills, expertise, and hunger for solutions in a 24/7/365 operations environment.

We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers and use multiple resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Client-specific and on-the-job training is required and provided. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our national interests.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
4+ years of experience in SIGINT collection, analysis, or targeting, ELINT collection or analysis, Electronic Warfare (EW), Cryptologic Linguistics, Radio Operations, or HAM Operations
Knowledge of PTT, 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G, or WiFi technologies
Ability to work as part of a small team
Ability to conduct weekly rotating shift work
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
HS diploma or GED

Nice If You Have:
Experience with ground or aviation SIGINT collection operations
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor’s degree

Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in national security? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer focused engineering solution.  

As a systems engineer on our team, you have the chance to shape Navy Intelligence Systems by leading acquisition systems engineering efforts. Your customer will trust you to not only design and develop these systems, but also evolve them with advanced technology solutions. Join our team and create the future of Intelligence Systems for the US Navy. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Knowledge of Systems Engineering Principles, including Technology Analysis and Assessment, Design Definition, Development of Systems Specification, Systems Analysis, Systems Architecture, Systems or Equipment Integration, Test & Evaluation Criteria, and Logistics Support

Ability to develop system acquisition documentation, including specifications

Ability to effectively communicate and lead a team

TS/SCI clearance 

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Systems and 16+ years of experience with systems engineering, engineering, or procurement for military systems, or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Systems and 10+ years of experience with systems engineering, engineering, or procurement for military systems


Nice If You Have: 

5+ years of experience with PEO C4I, NAVWAR, or US Navy C4I systems

Experience with operational Navy IO/ISR systems

Experience in the military, including Navy

Knowledge of Navy waveforms used in support of Intelligence, Surveillance, Reconnaissance (ISR) and Operational Command systems

Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Systems

Acquisition 101 Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity: Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by quantum information science? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by quantum computing and sensing advances? We have an opportunity for you to use your analytical and experimental skills to improve quantum computing, communications, and sensing capabilities for the U.S. Government. 
  
You’ll work closely with clients to understand their needs and provide direct quantum support. You’ll mentor and learn from teammates, and shape research directions both with clients and through internal investments. Join us as we advance the state-of-the-art of quantum information science.  Join us. The world can’t wait.  You Have: 

Experience leading and managing small to medium sized projects

Knowledge of a wide range of quantum computing hardware, control electronics, and environmental control requirements

Ability to convey complex concepts to a varied audience both written and verbally 

Ability to work collaboratively in a manner that leverages various backgrounds and expertise

Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor's degree in Physics, Mathematics, or Materials Sciences and 9+ years of experience with quantum mechanics or quantum effects, Master's degree in Physics, Mathematics, or Materials Sciences and 6+ years of experience with quantum mechanics or quantum effects, or a Doctorate degree in Physics, Mathematics, or Materials Sciences and 4+ years of experience with quantum mechanics or quantum effects


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with programming languages like C++ and Python

Experience with software version control and containerization

Experience with leading the development of technology business plans and roadmaps, building and managing teams of scientists and engineers to execute against business plans, and managing associated resources, such as hardware and funding


Clearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Job Profile Skills:
Computer Programming

Experimental Research Design

Experimentation

Heterogeneous Computing

Hybrid Computing

Mathematics

Peer-Reviewed Publications

Post-Quantum Cryptography

Prototyping

Quantitative Analytics

Quantitative Research

Quantum Communications

Quantum Computing

Quantum Information

Quantum Information Systems

Quantum Physics

Quantum Sensing 

Research Methodologies

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in national defense and combat weapon system design? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right models for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused engineering solution.

As a systems engineer on our team, you’ll have the chance to assess and evaluate combat weapon systems using computer-based analytical tools, including the Advanced Framework for Simulation, Integration, and Modeling (AFSIM) analytical framework, MATLAB, and additional in-house tools. Your technical expertise will be vital as you evaluate combat weapon system concepts. You’ll directly impact the Department of Defense’s mission by helping to determine what system attributes and operational tactics improve survivability in simulated threat environments. The analyses you perform will help the acquisition community make more informed investment decisions pertaining to future combat systems. You’ll develop your skills in critical thinking, data analytics, and operations analysis while gaining experience in constructive modeling and simulation of combat operations. Join our team and help turn requirements into accomplishments that drive change.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

1+ years of experience using the AFSIM analytical framework for operational analysis

Experience performing analysis of military technologies and integrated defense systems

Experience developing scripts or code for data analysis

Ability to leverage problem-solving to overcome engineering or code development challenges

Ability to distill, summarize, and articulate complex technical insights and findings

Ability to work in a dynamic team environment

Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science


Nice If You Have: 

2+ years of experience using AFSIM for mission modeling

2+ years of experience with data analytics or software development in an academic or professional environment

Experience with the Linux operating environment

Knowledge of U.S. and foreign combat weapon systems, including aircraft and ground-based air defense systems

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

TS/SCI clearance

Master's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics field


Clearance: 
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Job Requisition: R0217570 AI and ML Technical Lead (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an experienced engineer, you know that machine learning is critical to understanding and processing massive datasets. Your ability to conduct statistical analyses on business processes using ML techniques makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused solution. We need your technical knowledge and desire to problem-solve to support artificial intelligence and machine learning initiatives. As a machine learning engineer on our team, you’ll train, test, deploy, and maintain models that learn from data.   

In this role, you’ll own and define the direction of mission-critical solutions by applying best-fit ML algorithms and technologies. You’ll be part of a large community of machine learning engineers across the company and collaborate with other engineers to deliver world-class solutions. Your skills and extensive technical expertise will guide clients as they navigate the landscape of ML algorithms, tools, and frameworks. 

Work with us to solve real-world challenges and define ML strategy.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:

10+ years of experience building enterprise web applications

Experience with AWS, including CloudFormation, CodePipeline, or ECS

Job Requisition: R0205469 Cloud Computing Application Architect, Senior (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
Everyone is trying to “harness the cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a cloud computing application architect, you know how to create a cloud-based technical architecture that meets client needs and takes advantage of cloud capabilities. What if you could use your cloud architecture skills to improve collaboration and project tracking for intelligence and national security missions? We need you to help us develop cloud-based solutions for some of national security’s toughest problems. 

On our team, you’ll provide architectural design and implementation expertise for Atlassian tool suite migration to the cloud. This is an opportunity to use the latest cloud technologies as you look for ways to improve your client’s environment using current cloud capabilities. Your technical expertise will be vital as you work with migration teams and intelligence mission to inform strategy and design and ensure standards are met throughout the cloud migration process.  

You’ll recommend tools and solutions based on your research of the current environment and knowledge of various on-premise, cloud-based, and hybrid resources. You’ll lead your team as they help the client overcome their most difficult challenges in the cloud. Additionally, you’ll broaden your skill set in areas like Atlassian Tools, data migration, infrastructure-as-code (IaC), and DevOps while developing critical systems for intelligence and national security missions.

Ready to transform intelligence and national security missions with cloud technology? 

Join us. The world can’t wait.
  
You Have: 

2+ years of experience with developing enterprise AWS solutions

2+ years of experience with software development tools and methodologies

Experience with data migration

Knowledge of the Atlassian Tool Suite 

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

HS diploma or GED 


Nice If You Have: 

Experience writing scripts using tools such as Python or Bash

Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and tools such as Terraform

Ability to work in development environments such as the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)

Bachelor’s degree

AWS Certification such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Job Requisition: R0216828 Communications, Navigation, and Identification Engineer (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a Communications, Navigation, and Identification (CNI) Engineer, you know that leading-edge fighter aircraft technology and systems are critical to national defense. At Booz Allen, you can use your engineering expertise to develop next-generation defense tools and technology. We need your skills and expertise in communications, navigation, and identification and aviation systems and avionics engineering to develop creative solutions that directly impact the warfighter.

As a CNI systems engineer on our F-35 team, you’ll provide expertise in evaluating new technologies, performing risk assessments, and improving the design of aerospace systems. You’ll orchestrate the development of CNI systems through the full life cycle, from requirements determination through operations. Your experience in technology planning and DoD acquisition processes are key and make you an integral part of delivering a client-focused solution.

In this role, you’ll contribute to the direction of mission-critical solutions by evaluating, improving, and designing leading-edge aerospace technology for the F-35. You’ll work with a community of engineers across the firm and collaborate with clients to deliver world-class solutions for F-35 systems and evaluate new technologies for application in improving designs. Your engineering knowledge will help the Department of Defense expand and improve their capabilities to protect national security and the warfighter.

At Booz Allen, you can use your cyberspace operations experience to create solutions that will be executed on a worldwide stage. We’re looking for an experienced cyber mission specialist like you to apply your knowledge in cryptographic analysis and impact our nation’s security. In this role, you’ll be counted on to understand cyberspace capabilities to evaluate potential weaknesses as well as the effectiveness of mitigations for cyber security solutions. You will leverage cyberspace operations systems to aggregate threat feeds that inform briefings for senior leadership aligned to our nation's security.     This is an opportunity to use your research and analysis abilities to adequately assess and inform operators and senior leadership, and commanders on dynamic adversarial tactics, techniques, and procedures for national security. Your role will be vital in the development of operations plans to support command and control.    If you want to be in the fight–working shoulder to shoulder with our government clients–influencing the most critical global cyber missions, this is the opportunity for you.    Join us. Experience exploiting mobile device operating systems like iOS and Android

Ability to develop methods to diagnose weaknesses in cryptographic algorithms and exploit computer network vulnerabilities

Top Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree

As a data analyst, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a Data Analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills and experience to support training and readiness in support of global crisis response.

As a client-facing Data Analyst on our team, you’ll work with and guide a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, Agile environment. You’ll use your knowledge in analytical exploration and data examination while you manage the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. You will also work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that there’s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need an experienced data engineer like you to help our clients find answers in their big data to impact important missions—from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence.   

As a Data Ingestion Engineer, you have a strong understanding of data integration, transformation, and loading processes, with experience in building and maintaining ETL pipelines. You will work closely with data scientists, frameworks, and other engineering teams to ensure a smooth, end-to-end flow of data from various sources across the enterprise. You’ll implement data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll deploy and develop pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful.  

Here, you’ll work with and guide a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll use your experience in analytical exploration and data examination while you manage the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients.  

Work with us to use big data for good.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:

2+ years of experience as an ETL Engineer, including Fullstack Development

Experience with ETL tools and event-driven architectures, including Kubernetes, Kafka, and Spring Boot, and with Docker and containerization concepts for ETL jobs

Experience in Java programming, Typescript for front-end development, and writing complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and reporting

Experience with data warehousing concepts and platforms, such as Snowflake and Amazon Redshift, and with databases such as Postgres, Solr, Accumulo, or Iceberg

Experience integrating structured and unstructured data from various sources such as APIs, databases, or flat files, and with web services and communication protocols

Experience with version control and CI/CD technologies including Git, Gitlab Pipelines, and Jenkins

Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Shell scripting for automation of ETL tasks

Ability to troubleshoot and optimize ETL processes

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor’s degree

Knowledge of machine learning concepts and their integration with data pipelines

Knowledge of non-functional automation testing tools, including SoapUI or Postman

Knowledge of monitoring and logging frameworks such as Prometheus, Grafana, or Elastic stack

As a data scientist, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data scientist at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors—from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence—we need you to help find the answers in the data. 

On our team, you’ll use your leadership skills and data science expertise to create real-world impact. Job Requisition: R0208846 Defense Acquisition Management Professional, Senior (Open)
Job Description:
Key Role: 
Determine an appropriate acquisition approach for a Defense program or programs, based on the DoD 5000 adaptive acquisition framework. Analyze, assess, and coordinate acquisition program documentation based on selected adaptive acquisition pathways, including an Acquisition Strategy, Acquisition Program Baseline, and Acquisition Decision Memorandums. Leverage expertise in acquisitions for integrated product teams regarding all statutory, regulatory, and policy analysis updates impacting acquisition documentation requirements. Build and maintain relationships with external stakeholders, including the Resource Sponsor, Requirements Officer, and Operational Test Authority to ensure successful program execution and obtain concurrence on an acquisition way ahead. Execute acquisition requirements, including the DoD 5000 series, OMB circulars, Defense Acquisition Guide, and DoD Guide to Planning and Scheduling, as demonstrated by expertise in contents and application of each in the acquisition life cycle across all adaptive acquisition pathways. Analyze the development of acquisition documents, including the Initial Capabilities Document, Capability Development Document, Acquisition Strategy, Acquisition Program Baseline, Program Management Plan, Acquisition Decision Memorandum, Affordability Estimate, Analysis of Alternatives, and Cost Analysis and Requirements Description.

Basic Qualifications: 

5+ years of experience with DoD Acquisition in an acquisition program office, Program Executive Officer’s office, or DoD Acquisition command

Experience with supporting an ACAT, BCAT, SCAT, or DoD adaptive acquisition framework program

Experience with DoD acquisition documentation, including Acquisition Strategies, Acquisition Program Baselines, Acquisition Decision Memorandums, or Milestone Decision Review briefs

Experience with DoDI 5000 series and SECNAVINST 5000 policies and documents

Experience with using Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree


Additional Qualifications: 

Experience with a Navy acquisition program office or program management

Experience with Urgent Capability, Middle Tier, Software acquisition pathways, or Defense Business Systems

Experience with Risk Management

Experience with Joint Capabilities Integration and Development System (JCIDS)

Experience with taking a program to a Milestone or Production decision

Experience with Integrated Master Schedule and Microsoft Project

Knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and DFARS

Ability to self-start and multitask in a fast-paced environment, and prioritize multiple tasks with minimal supervision

Job Posting: Digital and Model-Based Systems Engineer, Senior
Job Requisition: R0215292 Digital and Model-Based Systems Engineer, Senior (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in Digital Engineering (DE) and Unmanned Maritime Systems? You have the drive to understand your customer's environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused engineering solution.

As a Digital and Model Based Systems Engineer, you will support the implementation of a DE strategy for our NAVSEA customer. You will work closely with working group leads, shipbuilders, and other program stakeholders to accomplish several tasks. You will support the development of a DE environment and federated model framework consisting of model-based systems engineering (MBSE) and MBE models, digital requirements, digital threads, various modeling and simulation tools, and modeling standards and methods. Additionally, you will support the implementation of authoritative sources of truth concepts, including a digital artifacts structure, access and CM policies, PLM tool, and zero-trust architecture. You will also support the establishment of common engineering processes, policies, and tools across the program.

You will support customer pilot projects for the integration of different model types via digital threads, enhancing the requirements development process, and ensuring traceability of models, requirements, digital documents, and data across the acquisition lifecycle. You will also be involved in developing reference architecture models, MBSE best practices across the program, conducting tool trade studies, and developing RDM process documents, training plans, Model Development Plans, and Model Management Plans. Furthermore, you will support the assessment of customer DE capability maturity and capability gaps, extract lessons learned, and develop metrics from each successive phase of the DE implementation. Finally, you will brainstorm possible solutions to DE implementation challenges with the program stakeholders. Join our team and help to turn requirements into actions that drive and deliver digital innovation for the US Navy.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience with Systems Engineering and Integration, Model-Based System Engineering (MBSE), and using digital engineering tools in support of DoD acquisition programs and government clients  

5+ years of experience architecting solutions from user requirements and use cases to be applied across a systems engineering lifecycle

5+ years of experience using the Magic Draw or Cameo suite of modeling tools in a DoD Systems Engineering capacity with the practical application of SysML and UAF or DoDAF   

2+ years of experience using PLM, RDM, and Digital Thread Management tools

Experience in a customer-facing role, including technical writing for customer-deliverable documents

Ability to use MBSE tools and processes to create and manage tailored MBSE artifacts that capture analysis and the resulting engineering decisions and trades made during acquisition and development

Ability to work eﬀectively in a multi-disciplinary, dynamic team environment, including internal staff, external contractors, and government clients to increase the use of MBSE for client acquisitions programs

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree in Systems Engineering or Electrical Engineering


Nice If You Have:

Experience establishing DE tools in a cloud environment

Experience establishing authoritative knowledge sources

Experience with scripting languages, such as the Velocity Template Language or other

Experience executing project Digital Transformation, including implementing DE practices where none existed prior

Experience with the overall DoD acquisition lifecycle and the DoD or DON DE Strategy

Knowledge of using system models during government engineering reviews

Knowledge of DoDD 5000.01, DoDI 5000.02, and DoDI 5000.97 and the System Development Life Cycle, including system engineering disciplines, configuration management, risk management, cybersecurity, and cyber certification processes

Knowledge of modular open systems approach (MOSA) design principles and technologies, DoD architecture standards and framework, and Agile systems engineering methods and tools 

Master's degree in Systems Engineering or Electrical Engineering 

INCOSE Certified Systems Engineering Professional (CSEP) Certification or Object Management Group (OMG) Certified System Modeling Language Professional (OCSMP) Model Builder Level 2 Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As an embedded software engineer, you know how to create and maintain crucial pieces of software. You use your knowledge to write and optimize code that creates a bridge between pieces of software, allowing them to communicate. We’re looking for an embedded software engineer like you to develop technology for our clients’ most important mission-forward challenges.  

As an embedded software engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll support the development of systems, sites, and tools for our clients. Using the latest tools and technology, you’ll write, test, and edit code in support of the team’s overall results. You’ll strengthen your skills as you develop and reverse engineer software that supports hardware functionality on a wide range of devices, as well as configure solutions based on the platform being used. You’ll partner with team leadership to troubleshoot and correct operational issues, as well as with cybersecurity specialists to ensure that the software you’re creating is secure.

Work with us to expand your tech skills and make a meaningful difference.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
Experience with programming for embedded Linux, including user-space and kernel-mode software in C
Experience with low-level development, including interrupt handlers, device drivers, controlling peripherals, and reading and writing Flash memory
Experience with porting the Linux kernel to other hardware platforms, including ARM-based platforms
Experience with the creation of Linux packages, including OpenWrt, LEDE, and RPM packages for Fedora and Red Hat
Experience with standing up cross-compilers and building environments for bootstrapping a cross-development environment
Experience with Automake and Autoconf suites
Knowledge of GNU Make
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Bachelor's degree

2+ years of experience with embedded software languages and products, including Java, JavaScript, Python, Reverse Engineering, Embedded Platforms, Android iOS, Swift, Wind River VxWorks, IDA Pro, OllyDbg, or Gdb Debugger
Ability to acquire client requirements and resolve workflow problems through automation optimization
Ability to work with automated testing tools to perform testing and maintenance

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you looking to put your problem-solving prowess to the test in a rapidly evolving systems security research and development environment? You know that embedded application developers, reverse engineers, and vulnerability analysts all play key roles in the capability development lifecycle. As an embedded developer, you’ll have the opportunity to use skills in C/C++ and assembly language, scripting language, debugging, computer architectures, and networking protocols to support our government intelligence clients. We’re looking for someone like you to have a direct impact on the nation’s security.

On our team, you’ll be involved in the full lifecycle of software projects, technical capabilities, and product design. Working on an agile team of experts, you’ll perform reverse engineering and vulnerability analysis of software problems. You’ll inform operational parameters for complex systems, as well as leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to influence the delivery of your work. You’ll determine what the art of the possible is – what can be done – and then you’ll bring it to life for your clients.

Are you ready to help us combat the most advanced adversaries?

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 
6+ years of experience with Software development using C, C/C++, or proprietary languages
4+ years of experience with embedded platforms such as Linux, Unix, Android, and VxWorks
Experience with configuration, administration, and development with Virtual Environments such as VMWare/ESXi, Open Stack, Open vSwitch, and QEMU
Experience with development on embedded platforms such as Linux, Unix, Android, and VxWorks
Experience with Software Reverse Engineering or debugging tools, such as IDAPro, OllyDbg, or gdb
Experience with assembly languages development or reversing
Knowledge of low level systems programming concepts
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:
Experience with vulnerability analysis and exploit development
Experience with Python
Experience with Assembly
Experience with memory safe low level programming, such as Rust
Knowledge of telecommunications

Job Profile: Software Engineer - Back End, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As an Enterprise Software Engineer, you know that a good site or system needs the right combination of clean code, APIs, analytics, and infrastructure to develop a user-focused solution. We’re looking for a back-end developer with the software engineering skills it takes to help identify potential risks, contribute to solution development, and create efficient and effective systems for our clients. 

As an Enterprise Software Engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll use the latest architectural approaches and open-source frameworks and tools to help deliver solutions. Using your software engineering knowledge, you’ll work with and learn from the development team to create custom tools, systems, and sites with consistent performance and scalability. 

In this role, you’ll make a mission-forward impact as you sharpen your skillset and grow your career. Work with us as we shape systems for the better.  

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience using Java to build enterprise products and applications

Experience with Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) software patterns to ingest large and complex datasets

Experience with Git and GitLab CI/CD

Knowledge of streaming analytic platforms like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or Spark

Knowledge of common Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIP) and how to apply them  

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of experience in software engineering or 7+ years of experience in software engineering in lieu of a degree 


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with graph databases, such as Neo4j

Experience with production CNO capabilities and operations 

Experience building real-time data processing applications using streaming libraries like Kafka Streams

Experience modeling data and relationships in graph databases

Experience with networking concepts, protocols, and analysis, including routers or switches

Knowledge of SIGINT collection and analysis systems

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an electronic warfare (EW) and countermeasures (CM) engineer, you know that leading-edge fighter aircraft technology and systems are critical to national defense. At Booz Allen, you can use your engineering expertise to develop next-generation defense tools and technology. We need your skills and expertise in aviation systems and avionics engineering to develop creative solutions that directly impact the warfighter.

You’ll provide expertise in evaluating new technologies, performing risk assessments, and improving the design of aerospace systems. You’ll orchestrate the development of EW systems through the full lifecycle, from requirements determination through operations. Your experience in technology planning and DoD acquisition processes are key and make you an integral part of delivering a client-focused solution.

In this role, you’ll contribute to the direction of mission-critical solutions by evaluating, improving, and designing leading-edge aerospace technology for the F-35. You’ll work with a community of engineers across the company, collaborate with clients to deliver world-class solutions for F-35 systems, and evaluate new technologies for application in improving designs. Your engineering knowledge will help the Department of Defense expand and improve their capabilities to protect national security and the warfighter.

If you desire to solve real-world challenges and lead mission-critical engineering for the F-35, there’s a place for you here. At Booz Allen, you’ll make a difference with us, and, in return, we’ll invest in your future.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

9+ years of experience in a lead electronic warfare engineering or technical position

3+ years of experience in support of a 4th or 5th Generation U.S. strike or fighter aircraft

Experience with DoD acquisition processes, system engineering practices, and technical oversight

Ability to independently think, plan, and work at both a tactical and strategic level

Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Systems Engineering


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with EW and CM acquisition

Experience with Test and Evaluation of EW systems

Knowledge of Special Access Programs

Possession of excellent organizational and project management skills

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Top Secret clearance

Master’s degree in Engineering

Level I Acquisition Professional in Engineering Certification

Job Description:
Key Role:
Identify fire-related risks, determine ways to reduce the risks, and design ways to safeguard against the wrath of fire. Analyze, formulate, and recommend facility fire protection requirements, design, space criteria, and usage through space utilization studies and forecasts. Recommend systems to mitigate, detect, control, or suppress a fire. Lead analyses and solution development for facility planning and management, ensuring the protection of both people and the built or natural environment from fire hazards. Analyze fire hazards, mitigate fire through the design and construction of buildings, examine building uses and industrial processes, and design, install, and maintain fire detection, suppression, and communication systems. 

Basic Qualifications: 

3+ years of experience working in a professional environment

Knowledge of risks and safeguards that prevent, control, and mitigate the effects of fires

Knowledge of structures, mechanical systems, risk control and management, fire dynamics, occupant movement, and environmental protection

Knowledge of the International Building Code (IBC), Unified Facilities Criteria (UFC), National Fire Protection Agency (NFPA), American National Standards Institute (ANSI), American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE), and industry-standard fire protection

Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree

Professional Engineering Certification

Experience with Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) construction drawing sets

Knowledge of design engineering of specialized systems, including wet systems, dry systems, pre-action systems, open and closed deluge systems, high-speed deluge systems, ultra-high speed deluge systems, mass notification, heat detection, smoke detection, beam detection, and fire alarms

Ability to support facility design services for repair projects or facility operations support

Master’s degree in Engineering

National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies (NICET) Certification

Job Posting: Foreign Military Sales Systems Engineer, Senior
Job Requisition: R0213001 Foreign Military Sales Systems Engineer, Senior (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in modernizing Positioning, Navigation, and Timing (PNT) systems and bringing them to our allies through Foreign Military Sales (FMS)? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer focused engineering solution.

As a systems engineer on our team, you have the chance to support the design and implementation of ground-based User Equipment (UE) PNT capabilities to the nation’s warfighters and our allies. Your technical expertise will be vital as you evaluate and modernize Global Positioning Systems (GPS) UE and help to integrate it with our allies. You will perform Receiver Handling and Integration Reviews (RHIRs) and site security surveys. You’ll coordinate the development and implementation of security cooperation and assistance in support of the program office, including planning, communication, outreach, and foreign customer support services.

You’ll build your skills in developing and acquiring GPS UE systems while gaining experience with delivering sustained, reliable GPS capabilities. Expand your career by merging GPS UE development and acquisition to develop client solutions, assess technical designs, and test programs. Join our team and help turn requirements into accomplishments that drive change.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

8+ years of experience in the specification and evaluation of space receivers, including the development of top-level architectures for advanced systems and preparation or review of Technical Requirements Documents, Interface Control Documents, Test Plans or Procedures, and Test Reports

Experience with laboratory and field testing of prototype and operational military systems, including those incorporating GPS or other navigation capabilities such as development and evaluation of Test Plans or Procedures, Test Reports, and on-site test support

Experience in the application of adaptive signal processing techniques for enhancement of military systems performance in stressed signal environments such as jamming and spoofing

Experience working with foreign clients and export control, including International Traffic in Arms Regulation (ITAR) issues

Experience analyzing and assessing international security cooperation policy

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree in Engineering


Nice If You Have:

8+ years of experience in the specification and evaluation of GPS UE, including the development of top-level architectures for NAVWAR advanced technology-based systems and preparation or review of Technical Requirements Documents, Interface Control Documents, Test Plans or Procedures, and Test Reports

Experience with DoD program budgets and Comprehensive Cost and Requirement System (CCaR) inputs

Knowledge of Military GPS UE and Protected Positioning Service (PPS) signals

Knowledge of GPS PPS Security Policies, specifically as they relate to FMS

Ability to work with foreign nations, including their developers and integrators, to assess conformance to U.S. GPS PPS Security Policy such as Facility Security, Third-Party Transfers, Demilitarization, Inventory Control, and Accountability

Possession of excellent problem-solving, research, and analysis skills

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills

TS/SCI clearance

Master’s degree in Engineering or a related field

Job Posting: Information Security and RMF Analyst, Mid
Job Requisition: R0215140 Information Security and RMF Analyst, Mid (Open)
Job Profile: Information Security Risk Specialist, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to government agencies. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is an information systems security specialist like you who will break down complex threats into manageable plans of action. 

As an information systems security specialist on our team, you’ll use your experience to work with the U.S. Navy to discover their cyber risks, understand applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You’ll review technical, environmental, and personnel details from engineers to assess the entire threat landscape. You’ll then guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, whitepapers, and milestones.

You’ll work with your client to translate security concepts, so they can make the best decisions to secure their critical infrastructure. This is your opportunity to act as an information security subject matter expert while broadening your skills in cloud security.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 
3+ years of experience in cybersecurity, engineering, Test and Evaluation (T&E), Assessment and Authorization (A&A), or Certification or Accreditation (C&A)
Experience working with Information Assurance tools such as the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) or Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS)
​Knowledge of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) process
Knowledge of security policies and guidance documents to assist with the preparation and maintenance of process artifacts and traceability documents purposed for compliance with Authority to Operate (ATO) requirements
Ability to evaluate security solutions to ensure they meet security requirements for processing classified information
Ability to supervise and maintain the operational security posture for an information system or program
Secret clearance
HS diploma or GED
CompTIA Security+, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP), or Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP) Certification

Nice If You Have: 
Experience with both Windows and RHEL operating systems
Experience with AWS Solutions such as RDS, EC2, EBS, S3, IAM, Security Hub, or CloudFormation
Experience with DoD or Navy systems, including STIGs and other compliance requirements
Microsoft Certifications such as Microsoft Certified Application Developer (MCAD) or Microsoft Certified Database Administrator (MCDBA) Certification
Red Hat Certification Program (RHCP) Certifications
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Certification
Technology-based Oracle Certified Associate-level Certification
VMware Certified Technical Associate - Data Center Virtualization Certification
Citrix Certified Administrator Certification
Cloud Certifications such as AWS Architect, Developer, and SysOps Associate Certifications

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
We’re looking for an Information System Security Officer (ISSO) responsible for assessing and requesting client authorization for firm-managed classified endpoints, servers, network, and security appliances. This involves applying evolving U.S. Government cybersecurity policy and guidance.

The ISSO ensures system, network, and security appliance auditing, virus scanning, and hardware and software configuration management requirements are executed as defined in client-approved system assessment documentation and policy. Additionally, the ISSO monitors the activities of program system administrators to ensure all relevant security procedures are followed. The role also includes documenting clear and concise compliance criteria and test cases required to validate compliance with an evolving baseline of cybersecurity requirements and guidance from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), the Intelligence Community, and the DoD.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
Experience applying security systems concepts, requirements, design development, implementation, and integration to information systems
Knowledge of the Risk Management Framework (RMF), performing system assessment and authorization through a Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) tool
Knowledge of risk mitigation and selecting and designing appropriate security controls for implementation
Knowledge of incident response and data loss prevention, detection, and response
Knowledge of the NIST and Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) requirements for monitoring and reporting
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
HS diploma or GED
DoD 8570 IAM II Certification

Nice If You Have:
Experience executing the analysis, design, and implementation of enterprise cybersecurity solutions
Experience maintaining vulnerability scanning tool compliance and patch management, including ensuring IT staff pushes patches to all systems, maintains compliance with directives, manages changes to the system, and assesses the security impact of the changes
Experience engineering and implementing security-based solutions to further automate and improve the comprehensive security posture of systems and their supporting infrastructure
Possession of excellent written and verbal communication skills
DoD 8570 Certification such as CISSP, CISSP-ISSAP, or CISSP-ISSEP Certification

Supervisory Organization: Supervisory Organization (Jennifer Edmonds | Jennifer Walsh Edmonds (506033))
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to Department of Defense (DoD) agencies and related components. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) like you who will break down complex threats into manageable plans of action. 

As an ISSO on our team, you will use your experience to work with government stakeholders and a cloud-based application and platform development team to identify cyber risks, understand applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You’ll review technical, environmental, and personnel details from security engineers, platform and application developers, and enterprise architects to assess the entire threat landscape. You will coordinate with product delivery teams to ensure their products meet DoD cybersecurity standards and support a larger cyber team to collectively guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, documentation, and milestones.

You will work with your client to translate security concepts, so they can make the best decisions to secure cloud infrastructure, artificial intelligence (AI) solutions, containerized applications, CI/CD application pipelines, and sensitive data repositories. You will conduct risk assessments, considering data confidentiality, integrity, and availability. You will be involved in organized Incident Response actions such as consulting, guiding, and reporting back to key stakeholders. You will support the team in meeting authorization timelines and coordinating communications with external entities in support of that objective.

This is your opportunity to act as an information security subject matter expert while broadening your skills in AWS, AI or ML, containerization, CI/CD, Agile development, DevSecOps, risk management, and data security. Work with us as we protect the DoD's critical analytic capabilities.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 
5+ years of experience implementing risk management methodologies contained in best practice documentation such as NIST SP 800-30, SP 800-53, SP 800-128, SP 800-160, SP 800-171, or CIS benchmarks, in support of system security configurations, practices, and oversight
3+ years of experience providing cybersecurity leadership in an ISSO capacity, interfacing with internal and external SMEs such as PMs, Cyber Assessors, and AOs
Experience with control implementations associated with RMF, FedRAMP, ICD 503, and DoD Information Levels, including applying them to the design and implementation of IT solutions to achieve system authorizations
Experience implementing and maintaining security controls within AWS cloud, containerized, CI/CD pipeline, and Agile development environments
Experience developing and reviewing ATO authorization packages in Xacta or eMASS
Experience analyzing compliance and vulnerability scan results and implementing appropriate mitigations
Experience performing audit log reviews to detect anomalous behavior in information systems and networks and overseeing continuous monitoring activities
Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam
Bachelor’s degree
CGRC/CAP, CASP+, CCSP, Cloud+, SSCP, Security+, or GSEC certification

Nice If You Have: 
Experience with DoD security technical implementation guides (STIGs), checklists, and testing tools, including STIG Viewer, SCAP, and ACAS scanning tools
Experience with cyber related tools such as Ansible, Terraform, Splunk, or STIG Viewer
Ability to work through challenging security requirements to maintain compliance
Possession of excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills
Possession of excellent organizational skills
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Bachelor’s degree in IT, Cybersecurity, Data Science, Information Systems, or CS
DoD 8570 IAT III or IAM III level Certification such as CISSP Certification
AWS Solutions Architect or Certified Security - Specialty Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you want to develop training that will transform national security? As an Instructional Designer, you know that even the best tools and processes can’t have an impact without the right education. Constructing an interactive course that teaches critical information and tradecraft requires a real passion for understanding the needs of your customer. We have an opportunity for an Instructional Designer who is committed to solving some of the toughest challenges in national security by crafting effective training.

On our team, you’ll work with SMEs, instructors, and learning technologist to capture your customer’s training needs and advise them on the right learning solution to help them accomplish their mission. Putting the learner at the center of the training experience, you’ll design creative learning solutions in a collaborative team environment. You’ll build training material with multimedia specialists, graphic artists, instructors and technical SMEs, following the instructional design methodologies.

You’ll use your technical skills, creativity, and experience to come up with new ideas to develop an engaging, interactive learning experience on screen or in a classroom. You’ll recommend cutting-edge learning solutions and strategies, including blended learning and gamification to build a successful learning environment. You know communication is key, so you’ll meet with SMEs, instructors, and product designers. throughout the process to discuss learning material and incorporate feedback. To ensure your solution is hitting the mark, you’ll collect and analyze results using evaluation methodologies, such as the Kirkpatrick Model then fine-tune your training for maximum impact. You’ll be able to hone your leadership skills as you share your expertise through leadership and mentoring. As a member of the learning team, you’ll identify new opportunities to build solutions to your customer’s learning needs. This is a chance to use your deep understanding of training methodologies to shape a creative learning experience that will engage students.

Work with us as we improve national security through learner-centered instructional design creative innovative learning solutions in a collaborative environment.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience in a professional work environment performing instructional design tasks using adult learning methodologies

Experience designing instructor led and web-based training

Experience applying accessibility and usability standards to adult learning solutions

Ability to analyze various sources of course content, including policies and regulations to develop adult learning solutions

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor's degree in Instructional Design
