Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As an Integrated Master Scheduler, you know the complexities of supporting a portfolio from inception to completion. Many programs require a significant investment of limited resources, and it’s imperative to keep the project on a productive path. That’s why we need you, an experienced Integrated Master Scheduler who can help ensure success through careful analysis and effective communication. 

We are looking for a qualified and experienced integrated master scheduler to support the Department of Defense (DoD) in planning, executing, and monitoring complex projects and programs. You will work closely with project managers, stakeholders, and contractors to develop and maintain integrated master schedules (IMS) that align with the DoD's strategic objectives and requirements. You will also provide schedule analysis, risk assessment, performance measurement, and reporting to ensure timely and successful delivery of the project outcomes.

On our team, you’ll help execute and monitor strategic and tactical plans using resources like Microsoft Project Professional, Project Web App, and Milestones Professional, and regular interactions with project analysts, business analysts, cross-functional SMEs, vendors, and portfolio leaders. The real impact of project management and integrated project controls comes from communication to ensure the program achieves its goals and meets our quality standards. At Booz Allen, we recognize that we must continuously grow as a team to bring the best support to our clients, so here you’ll have all the resources to succeed.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

3+ years of experience building and managing program schedules or project schedules using the Critical Path Method (CPM) within the DoD

Experience using scheduling software, including Microsoft Project, Microsoft Project Online, or Primavera P6

Ability to assess schedules and project control data critically and communicate schedule status, updates, and changes to stakeholders, including project leadership and clients 

Ability to manage multiple projects, including planning and organization, data gathering and analysis, decision-making, and problem solving

Ability to create and present executive-level reports, presentations, and deliverables that reflect risks, opportunities, and status to communicate effectively to key stakeholders

TS/SCI clearance

Job Description:
Key Role:
Maintain responsibility for all Information Systems Security Engineer (ISSE) duties in support of Department of Defense (DoD) Risk Management Framework (RMF) and Intelligence Community Directive (ICD) 503. Leverage knowledge of National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication 800-53 security controls and the Committee on National Security Systems Instruction 1253. Apply systems security engineering or architecture principles in support of the DoD RMF such as the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of information system components. Select, tailor, and implement NIST SP 800-53 security controls in support of RMF Assessment and Authorization (A&A) requirements. Develop layered protections and establish cybersecurity Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) or guidelines in support of security engineering practices for the organization’s authorization boundary. Understand and apply system development lifecycle principles, including Agile or Waterfall, and perform duties, including delineating physical and logical security boundaries, ensuring that software developers are trained on how to build secure software, running security vulnerability scans, specifically with the DoD’s Assured Compliance and Assessment Solution (ACAS) while generating and interpreting vulnerability scans, implementing Security Technical Implementation Guidelines (STIGs) and CIS Benchmarks, and other duties associated with RMF Continuous Monitoring, such as remediating or mitigating findings and vulnerabilities on system POA&Ms.

5+ years of experience as an Information Systems Security Engineer

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
We are seeking an innovative and highly motivated Systems Engineer to join a dynamic MILSATCOM team within the U.S. Space Force (USSF). As a key member of our team, you will play a critical role in sustaining a diverse portfolio of strategic MILSATCOM space systems and infrastructure, directly impacting the combat readiness of our space warfighters. This mid-level opportunity is ideal for a self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, small-team environment and is passionate about tackling the challenges of complex, space-based telecommunication systems.

In this role, you will leverage your systems engineering and analysis expertise to support legacy space systems, including Air Force Command Post Terminal (AFCPT), Family of Beyond Line‐of‐Sight Terminal (FAB‐T), and Milstar Messaging System (MMS). You will provide expert advice and engineering consultation to our government customer, collaborate with various stakeholders, including the joint space warfighting community, and contribute to all aspects of system sustainment, from requirements development and technical solution generation to fielding and performance analysis. If you are a driven problem-solver with a passion for space systems and a desire to make a real-world impact, we encourage you to apply!

What You'll Work On:

Provide systems engineering and analysis expertise for legacy space systems such as AFCPT, FAB-T, and MMS.

Support sustainment tasks through established space systems engineering processes and procedures.

Engage with the joint space warfighting community and collaborate on sustainment activities.

Evaluate technical performance metrics and conduct trend analysis for NC3 systems.

Assist in technology readiness assessments and identify risks with proposed technologies.


Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

5+ years of experience with systems engineering

5+ years of experience working with military or DoD civilian clients

Knowledge of MILSATCOM and DoD mission system sustainment

Knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 products

Ability to read and interpret blueprints, line drawings, and schematics

Ability to produce technical Statement of Works (SOW), Bill of Materials, test plans, and procedures

Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science


Nice If You Have: 

2+ years of experience with Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) concepts and tools

Experience working in a multi-contractor environment

Knowledge of contracts development in support of SSC or CGM programmatics

TS/SCI clearance

Master’s degree in Engineering with specialization in Communications Systems

International Council on Systems Engineering (INCOSE) Certified Systems Engineering Professional (CSEP) Certification or higher

Project Management Institute (PMI) Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification

Job Posting: Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor, Mid
Job Requisition: R0217661 Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor, Mid (Open)
Job Profile: Information Security Risk Specialist, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to government agencies and military organizations. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you. We need your knowledge as an information security risk specialist to help break down complex threats into manageable plans of action.    

You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure their mission-critical infrastructure. This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills.

As a Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor on our team, you will work with the DoD and other federal government organizations to discover their cyber risks, comprehend applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You will get technical, environmental, and personnel details from Security Professionals and Leaders, Systems Administrators, Network Administrators and Engineers, IAMs, and ISSOs to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you will help your team to guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, white papers, and milestones. You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure the client's information systems and assets and ensure enclaves possess the necessary security measures to ensure their availability, protection, integrity, authentication, confidentiality, and non-repudiation, including monitoring, detection, discovery, and reaction capabilities of internal and external adversaries and ensure a trained and effective IA workforce.

This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills in conducting reviews of enterprises, enclaves, networks, systems and applications, certification and accreditation support, independent evaluation based on national and DoD-level Cybersecurity and IA and Cybersecurity Service requirements, and the procedures and practices as they are implemented by the combatant commands and supporting organizations and agencies, to ensure their adequacy to provide a measurement and training tool to determine the defending force’s readiness and provide a basis for planning and programming needed improvements. Join us as we protect our military’s communications systems and our nation’s cyber infrastructure.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience with network devices, appliances, firewalls, routers, and various versions of UNIX or LINUX operating systems on information systems (IS), including workstations, servers, laptops, and network devices

Knowledge of DoD STIGs and RMF assessment tools

Ability to consolidate, create, and brief findings based on analysis

Ability to travel up to 85% of the time to CONUS and OCONUS locations

Ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED

DoD 8570 IAT Level II Certification


Nice If You Have: 

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree

Completion of Security Scanning Course, including Walk-through Training, Onsite Shadowing, Checkride, or eMASS Course

DoD 8570 IAT Level III Certification

Assessor Program (ACP), UNIX, or Network Vulnerability Assessments Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable the Navy and Marine Corps to achieve their missions, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and software, requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, a network engineer who knows how to develop and maintain the exact network the Navy and Marine Corps needs. 

As a Network Engineer on our team, you’ll use your skills in network design, architecture, and network administration, alongside overall system architecture and aircraft knowledge, to help support the nation’s defense and respond to evolving adversaries. You’ll develop program-wide infrastructure, maintain existing networks, and analyze existing systems and networks for future upgrades and increase security, reliability, and availability for mission-critical network systems.

You’ll apply your knowledge in routing and switching, network design and architecture, and system architecture as you join our team of problem-solvers to help the DoD deploy new capabilities for a mission-critical platform.

Grow your career with us as we help our team provide stable and reliable communications to our aircraft platform and those that use it. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Experience with Cisco network switches, routers, and firewalls

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to share your experience in designing, developing, and implementing innovative network security solutions to support our country and protect our nation? As a Network Engineer, you will be responsible for the enterprise deployment of IT and cyber tools with a focus on FireEye Infrastructure tools, such as MVX, NX, HX, PX, IA, AX, and IAS PCAP. We need your experience to oversee the development and implementation of network security solutions to deliver deep observability into all network traffic and improve the enterprise security posture.

On our team, you’ll supervise a team as they troubleshoot and analyze complex challenges for customers using your knowledge of Mandiant and FireEye solutions working collaboratively in a DevOps environment employing Agile development techniques. You’ll manage the research of new technologies and market trends to further develop and refine security solutions.

In this role, you'll closely impact mission success, protecting data and networks from malicious payloads and actors. With mentoring, challenging hands-on problem-solving, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers.

Work with us as we secure and protect our Nation's most sensitive capabilities.

What You’ll Work On: 

Develop relationships quickly and easily with other teams, communicating the complexities of security with a wide variety of audiences, including senior management. 

Implement infrastructure and cyber security controls, including enhanced detection and vulnerability capabilities and improved event correlation in large enterprises.  

Perform risk and vulnerability assessments in network, system, and application areas; leverage big data analytics and traditional security event types to identify advanced threats or indicators of compromise.

Experience with architecting and designing IP networks, including developing and documenting network topologies

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
To transform in today’s evolving digital world, organizations must harness data to resolve emerging problems at scale. As a business intelligence analyst, you thrive on using your critical-thinking skills to dig deep into complex data and mining solutions, and you know how to apply your business and technical experience to develop analytical processes, tools, and applications. If you’re ready to grow your skills and industry knowledge to develop solutions for our Department of Defense (DoD) clients, there’s a place for you at Booz Allen. You’ll help introduce and recommend new ideas that deliver deep visibility and insights while being part of a supportive team that roots you on.

What You’ll Do:
As a business intelligence analyst on our team, you’ll:
Use business intelligence data for predictive analytics and facilitate the implementation of new tools such as Power BI, Power Automate, and PowerApps.

Analyze and process data, while contributing to the development of models and report templates and developing dynamic, data-driven solutions using Power BI, SQL, and other relevant technologies.
Recommend and implement appropriate performance measures to be produced, including lifts, efficiencies, confidence intervals, and other statistical metrics.
Provide guidance to clients and fellow team members.
Provide business clients with detailed, actionable reports documenting the findings from data processing and data analysis for manpower, logistics, and business systems and external customers across the enterprise.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

3+ years of experience developing dashboards in Power BI from start to finish, including integrating multiple data sources

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a defense acquisition professional, you are familiar with the Defense Acquisition System (DAS) processes for identifying requirements, program planning and resources or assisting with budget allocation, and acquiring and delivering innovative and effective capabilities and solutions to the warfighter.

We’re looking for someone like you to be a liaison to the government. As a federal acquisition management professional at Booz Allen, you’ll work closely with our defense clients in support of the warfighter, aiding in the acquisition of all they need for optimal end strength and ensuring that their mission is our mission. On our team, you will serve as a Program Analyst, providing day-to-day program management and action officer support for a Navy client. This position is located in Washington, DC.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

5+ years experience supporting a DoD Major Defense Acquisition Program or Major System program with program strategy and resources oversight, schedules, program health assessment, milestone and phase decision reviews, program information, and reporting requirements

Experience preparing and managing Flag, senior executive, and congressional-level briefs, correspondence, and reports

Experience writing, editing, and reviewing acquisition documents, program review briefs, program reports, audits, congressional and media inquiries, and other written materials for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with applicable statutory and regulatory requirements and guidance such as Acquisition Strategy, Acquisition Program Baseline, Acquisition Decision Memorandum, Product Support Strategy, MS or Gate Program Review Brief, DAES Report, Modernized Selected Acquisition Report, Investment Program Funding and Quantities Chart or Spruill Chart, Independent Cost Estimate, and Cost Analysis Requirements Description

Experience with AAF acquisition pathway determination, implementation of a single or use of multiple pathways, or transition across acquisition pathways

Experience with Microsoft Office 365 suite applications

Knowledge of the DoD resources allocation process and activities, including PPBE, POM, BES, PB, PDM, or Reclama, congressional enchantment authorization or appropriation, and program execution

Knowledge of federal laws, executive authorities, and DoD and DoN issuances, regulations, guidance, and standards

Knowledge of contract management lifecycle, contracting strategy types, contract types, contract section structure, and fee structures

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with Naval Sea Systems Command

Experience with DoD and DoN authoritative system of record, including DAVE, RDAIS, Advana, Jupiter, NEPS, PBIS, PIEE, ASSIST, and AAFDID

Experience with task management systems such as CATSM or ETMS2

Experience with AAF Pathway and functional policies, guidance, and manuals, including DoDI 5000.02, DoDI 5000.85, DoDI 5000.87, and SECNAV Instruction 5000.2G

Experience with Modular Open Systems Approach (MOSA)

Experience with Microsoft Power Apps

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Possession of excellent attention to detail

Possession of excellent analytical, problem-solving, research, and organizational skills


Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to support pre- and post-award Department of Defense (DoD) contracts? Do you know both sides of the acquisition and contract lifecycle? Can you develop innovative solutions to complex problems? As a Program Integrator, you’ll work closely with our DoD clients in support of the warfighter, aiding in the acquisition of capability to meet mission objectives, ensuring our client’s mission is our mission. We’re looking for someone like you to lead a team of experts and be a liaison to the Government client. 

This is an opportunity to work with Booz Allen colleagues and government clients from various DoD and other government agencies to architect and plan large-scale space and ground system acquisition programs. You’ll help the DoD manage technical projects, including performance, cost, schedule, and risk. You’ll provide acquisition expertise regarding contract alignments across segment developers to ensure successful systems integration. You’ll develop Requests for Information (RFI), and Requests for Proposals (RFPs). You’ll participate in source selections and perform technical evaluations of offers or proposals. You’ll prepare, process, and review various acquisition documents to ensure compliance with established processes and policies prior to coordination. You’ll provide acquisition knowledge and counsel to the program office. From building and maintaining relationships with external stakeholders to obtaining concurrence, you’ll lead meaningful acquisition support. Are you ready to deliver the capability that defends our nation? 

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have: 

10+ years of experience with DoD acquisition planning, program management, and business operations

10+ years of experience with project management and leadership

Experience with the development and execution of DoD acquisition strategies

Experience with the development of RFIs and RFPs

Experience with source selections and technical evaluations

Experience with U.S. Space Force systems and organizations 

Ability to interface with internal and external clients and stakeholders

Ability to facilitate and contribute to cross-functional team meetings and collaborate in professional environments

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with space and ground technologies and systems

Experience with the GPS mission areas, including Space, Ground, or User Equipment 

Experience with analyzing program-level and enterprise-level integrated master schedules

Possession of excellent interpersonal skills

Master's degree

Acquisition Professional Development Program (APDP) Program Management Level I or higher Certification or Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification

Job Description:
Key Role:
Support the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) with creating, managing, and transitioning cutting-edge research and technology developments utilizing deep expertise in RF design as a technical consultant. Work with DARPA research program managers to assess the technical feasibility of emerging research and identify areas where strategic investment could have transformative impact to defense technologies. Produce and present findings and recommendations to a team of colleagues and clients, assist with technical program management and program development, and brief materials out for government Research and Development (R&D) efforts. Work with world-class scientists in driving forward groundbreaking research efforts that aim to leverage RF challenges to address critical EW programs for the DoD. Maintain and leverage technical expertise and relationships in serving clients. This position is located in Arlington, VA.

2+ years of experience authoring technical papers, reports, or program plans for technical and non-technical audiences 
Top Secret clearance
Master’s degree in a Mathematics, Physics, or Electrical Engineering field

Experience with defense R&D
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Possession of excellent organization and client service skills 
TS/SCI clearance
Doctorate degree in CEM, Physics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field

Job Requisition: R0207245 Scientific Support Biologist and Expert (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity: Threats to our military are regularly evolving and becoming more complex. What if you could apply your proficiency to weaken these developing threats and contribute to the security of our country’s dynamic military resources? With all the information accessible today, it takes a capable specialist to know how to collect, organize, and present data concisely to clients. If you have professional or military experience in analysis, along with a can-do mindset, we have an opportunity for you to use those skills to help enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of senior government and military decisionmakers and planners, and support real-world missions in a dynamic, client environment.
As a Biologist on our team, you will conduct all-source analysis of foreign doctrine, strategy, plans, policies, objectives, goals, intentions, command authorities, force structures, and resources relating to current, emerging, and future bio programs and capabilities. Analysis may include, but is not limited to, infectious disease risks, foreign medical countermeasures programs, biosafety and biosecurity, and chemical and radiation health threats.

You will be part of a unique multi-discipline team, assisting partners to fuse operations and intelligence information to enhance government efforts against emerging threats and counterproliferation efforts. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our nation’s leaders.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

12+ years of experience with biological threats analysis and vulnerabilities to biological programs, including logistics and security research, development, and testing

Experience reviewing analytical products for cogent arguments, tradecraft standards, and adequate support

Experience with in-depth analysis of analytic operations and knowledge management issues across organizational and IC boundaries and clearly articulating key findings

Knowledge of biological threat programs analysis, including national and military doctrine, strategy, plans, policies, intentions, command force structures, and resources for emerging and future threat programs

Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative analytic methodologies and developments in fields that affect tradecraft methodology, including academia

Ability to define comprehensive, new, or unique research approaches that enable rigorous assessments to address and contribute to high-level tasks

Ability to work independently and with minimal oversight

TS/SCI clearance

Master's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) field


Nice to have:
Master’s degree in biology, Molecular or Microbiology, Public Health, Immunology, Virology, Biotechnology, or Biodefense
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Job Description:
Key Role: 
Administer U.S. government security policies and procedures in managing classified contract programs as a Contractor Special Security Officer (CSSO). Oversee the day-to-day operations of a Sensitive Compartmented Information Facility (SCIF), including maintaining the structural integrity of the SCIF, managing and monitoring all access, and administering security education. Exhibit flexibility, set priorities, and manage customer expectations in a sometimes fast-paced environment. Provide support in clearance processing, visit certifications, document control, and physical security, including alarm response for controlled areas associated with both collateral and SCI security programs. Make sound decisions, take independent action, analyze problems, and provide focused solutions. Interact with internal and external customers or government security officials to perform security duties. Address routine personnel security matters with employees regarding issues. Report preparation and program security access briefing duties as required.

Basic Qualifications: 

2+ years of experience in Industrial Security

Experience as a CSSO or ACSSO

Experience in database functions, including DISS, eQIP, or PeopleSoft

Knowledge of the NISPOM Rule, DCIDs or ICDs, SCI, COMSEC, and government security directives

Knowledge of clearance processing, doc control, physical security, including closed areas and SCIFs, Automated Information System security, and SATE

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

HS diploma or GED

Completion of DSS Academy FSO Course or CSSO Training


Additional Qualifications: 

Knowledge of security disciplines such as Information, Physical, and COMSEC, and their relationship to PERSEC

Ability to effectively communicate information to various audiences

Ability to work in a team

Possession of excellent organizational skills

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Completion of DSS, Personnel Security Management, and Introduction to DoD Personnel Security Adjudication Courses

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a Software and Data Engineer, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, quantum computing, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. If you care about moving a mission forward as much as advancing the fields of data science and software engineering, this is the opportunity for you. Your deep data and systems architecture expertise, coupled with an original approach to your work, will help clients and stakeholders make sense of their data and encourage actionable results. We’re looking for someone like you to lead complex data exploration and analytics projects through your experience with Python and C++, discrete event simulators, and high-performance computing architectures for the national security industry.

As a Software and Data Engineer on our Strategic Innovation team, you’ll learn and apply innovative software engineering and architecture design methodologies to make a real-world impact on national security. You’ll grow your skills in data science, systems architecture design, and emerging computing infrastructures and shape the future of analytics through a variety of means.

We’ll keep you sharp and moving forward in your career, with access to Booz Allen courses and certifications, and opportunities to publish or present at conferences. Leveraging your expertise, you’ll guide a team that serves critical missions from end to end.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

Experience with C++ and Python, including developing, running, testing, and debugging scripts and software

Experience with software version control and containerization

Experience with developing simple data queries for existing or proposed databases or data repositories

Experience with UNIX and Linux, including basic commands and Shell scripting

Experience with stakeholder engagement, determining user requirements to derive software and data architecture design and performance requirements

Ability to discuss complex topics to broad technical and nontechnical audiences both individually and in group settings

Ability to learn new topics, tools, and capabilities, and integrate new findings into existing models and architectures

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor's degree and 9+ years of experience with software, data engineering, or computer systems architecture, Master's degree and 6+ years of experience with software, data engineering, or computer systems architecture, or Doctorate degree and 4+ years of experience with software, data engineering, or computer systems architecture


Nice If You Have:  

14+ years of experience as a software engineer

Experience with building or using a discrete event simulator

Experience with software for control logic or low-level programming on novel hardware architectures, including custom FPGAs, ASICs, GPUs, Quantum Systems, Digital to Analog Converters, or Analog to Digital Converters

Possession of excellent verbal and written communications skills


Clearance:  
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Cloud Based Services

High Performance Computing (HPC)

Machine Learning

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As an embedded software engineer, you know how to create and maintain crucial pieces of software. You use your knowledge to write and optimize code that creates a bridge between pieces of software, allowing them to communicate. We’re looking for an embedded software engineer like you to develop technology for our clients’ most important mission-forward challenges.  

As an embedded software engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll support the development of systems, sites, and tools for our clients. Using the latest tools and technology, you’ll write, test, and edit code in support of the team’s overall results. You’ll strengthen your skills as you develop and reverse engineer software that supports hardware functionality on a wide range of devices, as well as configure solutions based on the platform being used. You’ll partner with team leadership to troubleshoot and correct operational issues, as well as with cybersecurity specialists to ensure that the software you’re creating is secure.  

Work with us to expand your tech skills and make a meaningful difference. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:

6+ years of experience in programming

Experience with Unix and Linux development

Experience with C or C++ development

Experience with Python development

Experience with Subversion

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have:

Experience with Mobile technologies

Experience with Networking tools

As a full stack developer, you can resolve a problem with a complete end-to-end solution in a fast, agile environment. If you’re looking for the chance to not just develop software, but to create a system that will make a difference, we need you on our team. We’re looking for an experienced developer like you with the skills needed to develop software and systems from vision to production ready. 

This role is more than just coding. As a senior full stack developer at Booz Allen, you’ll use your passion to master new tools and techniques and identify needed system improvements. You’ll help clients overcome their most difficult challenges using the latest architectural approaches, tools, and technologies. You’ll make sure the solution developed by the team considers the architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements.  

Work with us as we shape systems for the better.  

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience designing, modifying, developing, writing, and implementing software programming applications using agile methods  

Experience in software development with basic programming languages, technologies, tools, or web development stacks  

Experience with Java, Python, C#, C, C++, .NET, JavaScript, React, or NodeJS 

Experience with Agile methodology, extreme programming, software engineering, product management, and software products 

Experience writing source code for new applications or generating and enhancing code samples for existing applications 

Experience using back-end and front-end languages to develop complete solutions to complex problems within a collaborative, cross-functional team  

Ability to apply and explain the use of common data structures and algorithms

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of experience in software engineering, or 8+ years of experience in software engineering in lieu of a degree


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with Special Operations

Experience acquiring client requirements and resolving workflow problems through automation optimization 

Ability to work with automated testing tools to perform testing and maintenance 

Master’s degree

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As an embedded software engineer, you know how to create and maintain crucial pieces of software. You use your knowledge to write and optimize code that creates a bridge between pieces of software, allowing them to communicate. We’re looking for an experienced embedded software engineer like you to develop technology for our clients’ most important mission-forward challenges.

As a senior embedded software engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll support the development of systems, sites, and tools for our clients. Using the latest tools and technology, you’ll write, test, and edit code in support of the team’s overall results. You’ll expand your skills as you develop and reverse engineer software that supports hardware functionality on a wide range of devices, as well as configure solutions based on the platform being used. You’ll work with other team leaders to troubleshoot and correct operational issues, as well as with cybersecurity specialists to ensure that the software you’re creating is secure.  

Work with us to further your tech career and make a meaningful difference. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

8+ years of experience as a Software Engineer

Experience in all phases of software design, development, and documentation

Experience with C, C++, or Rust

Experience debugging and troubleshooting embedded software using tools such as gdb

Experience in the development of preliminary designs, performing tests, commenting or remarking code, and debugging

Experience in leading and mentoring junior software engineers

Experience in serving as coordinator and planner for large and complex projects 

TS/SCI clearance 

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electric Engineering

Experience using back-end and front-end languages to develop complete solutions

Integrate Combatant Command and Space Service Component requirements with current and future space research, development, and procurement programs. Provide subject matter expertise in support of the Space and Joint mission areas. Provide expert support organizing, training, and equipping functions, including Joint Capabilities Integration and Development System (JCIDS) activities, Analyses of Alternatives (AoAs), Concept of Operation (CONOPs), and Defense Acquisitions. Integrate with stakeholders to develop innovative solutions for operational and strategic changes. Prepare and deliver reports and briefings to clients and senior leaders. Leverage knowledge of operations and defense acquisition processes to support government acquisitions and integrate space warfighter requirements. Provide supervisory and thought leadership to teams supporting space missions.

10+ years of experience within DoD Space Operations

Knowledge of the DoD requirements and acquisition processes

Ability to research, develop, organize, and present materials for senior company and DoD leadership

Master’s degree

15+ years of experience within DoD Space Operations

Experience serving in a leadership position on a Joint or Service Staff

Experience with using analytical tools to display the impacts of capability tradeoffs and impacts on potential alternatives such as CAMEO or DAF DEE

Experience with performing risk analyses and proposing risk mitigations

Experience with Joint Exercises

Experience with technical writing

Advanced Military Studies Graduate, such as SAMS or JAWS

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big-picture thinking to make an impact in the DoD? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused engineering solution.

As an engineer on our team, you’ll work with Booz Allen colleagues and the client to develop, rapidly deploy, and integrate the next generation of resilient space, ground, and user capabilities across the Space Systems Command Enterprise to deter attacks and provide critical information to our warfighters to defeat our enemies in battle. Your customer will trust you to not only test, analyze, evaluate, validate, and verify these systems, but also to use your ingenuity and broad knowledge of potential sources of new technologies and concepts such as applicable national labs, prototypes, and products from SBIR activities and other commercial IR&D efforts, to identify areas requiring mitigation up front to plan, develop, mature, and on-ramp technologies for use in future missions. You will support senior clients on budgetary and investment prioritizations. You will also collaborate with DoD Science and Technology (S&T) organizations to unearth future concepts and create enterprise roadmaps to capture, analyze, and communicate technology transition plans. Grow your skills by merging innovative engineering methodologies and cross-disciplinary coordination to create tomorrow’s solutions. Join our team and be a part of the transformation to meet growing threats. 

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have: 

3+ years of experience with systems engineering on large-scale space, ground, software, or hardware systems, or Major Defense Acquisition Programs

Experience developing, deploying, and troubleshooting software in a containerized environment

Experience writing and utilizing complex test tools, including automation

Experience supporting overall engineering integration of Systems Engineering and Integration efforts for the Satellite Control Network, DoD, government agencies, or commercial programs

Experience performing systems engineering in space or aerospace concepts and alternative design, architectural analysis, modeling and simulation, enterprise strategic planning, or digital engineering methodologies

Experience with cloud computing platforms, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), defining networking and infrastructure deployments, and scripting in frameworks, including pytest, Cypress, or Selenium

Knowledge of Linux, C++, Python, Perl, and Java

Top Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree


Nice If You Have: 

Experience defining machine learning (ML) models to feed artificial intelligence (AI) applications, especially in image processing

Experience with Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) principles and tools such as MagicDraw, Cameo, or SysML

Knowledge of Agile methodologies and using Jira and Confluence

Ability to proactively find and fill gaps in emerging technologies being developed by multiple 3rd parties as a software integrator

Ability to demonstrate a dynamic work ethic and be highly motivated to contribute to the DoD mission

Possession of excellent interpersonal, and verbal and written communication skills

TS/SCI clearance

Master’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics

Security+, Network+, Kubernetes K8, or equivalent Technologies Certifications

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an expert in defense missions, your unique background inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive defense industry knowledge and advisory skills to solve some of our clients’ most complex problems and find solutions that keep our nation safe.

As a Surface Warfare Analyst, you’ll bring your full range of knowledge and experience in leadership, integration of shipboard systems, operational and tactical maritime warfare, command and control, ship maintenance and modernization, Navy training systems, installation management, and managing people, policy analysis, training, logistics, and shipboard material readiness to work alongside thought leaders in consulting, analytics, and digital solutions to improve surface ship readiness. You’ll use your skills and expertise to analyze problems, develop solutions, and work with Navy leaders to improve surface warfare. Work with us to help prepare Navy surface forces and staffs for deployment and success in their operational missions. Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to share your experience in Cross Domain Solutions to safeguard our nation? As a systems security and network security engineer, you will be responsible for the development, engineering, and administration of the system, sub-systems, and services of a network infrastructure which includes an Access Cross Domain Solution, Transfer Cross Domain Solution, and an isolated Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO) environment. We need your experience to lead the development and implementation of security solutions that will change the world. 

On our team, you’ll troubleshoot and analyze complex challenges for customers using your knowledge of network and security devices, and applications. You’ll use your curiosity for technology and market trends to further research and develop security solutions.

In this role, you’ll closely impact Navy and Marine Corps by configuring and maintaining the security devices required to keep classified data safe. With mentoring, challenging hands-on problem-solving, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers.  

Work with us as we secure and protect USMC data. 

What You’ll Work On: 
Develop relationships quickly and easily with other teams, communicating the complexities of security with a wide variety of audiences, including senior management. 
Implement infrastructure and cyber security controls, including enhanced detection and vulnerability capabilities and improved event correlation in large enterprises.  
Perform risk and vulnerability assessments in network, system, and application areas. Leverage big data analytics and traditional security event types to identify advanced threats or indicators of compromise. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:   
5+ years of experience designing, integrating, and configuring enterprise architecture with Linux and Windows, and Virtual Environments
Experience designing and maintaining Microsoft Active Directory and Exchange environments
Knowledge of VMWare Horizon Virtual Desktop Infrastructure and Infrastructure set up
Top Secret clearance
HS diploma or GED
CompTIA Security+ or IAT Level II certification

Nice If You Have:   
Experience with multi-level security systems, Access Cross Domain Solutions, and Transfer Cross Domain Solutions
Experience with accrediting cross domain solutions, including access and transfer, and coordinating with NCDSMO and DoD CDS office
Experience with design, installation, configuration, testing, management, and troubleshooting of software and hardware of the systems and services of the DCO environment
Experience developing and maintaining System Design Document, System Configuration Guide, System Administration Guide, Testing Manuals, Backup and Disaster Recovery Guide, and Training Manuals
Experience developing and maintaining test plans, test cases, and procedures to meet requirements
Knowledge of Raise-The-Bar requirements implemented by NCDSMO
Knowledge of XML formatting and XML schema development

Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact for the US Navy? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer focused engineering solution.  

As a systems engineer on our team, you have the chance to shape Landing Craft Air Cushion (LCAC) and Ship to Shore Connector (SSC) Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Navigation (C4N) solutions for the US Navy. This will include developing analysis of alternatives, supporting Technical Data Package (TDP) development, including Engineering Change Proposals, and developing solutions to emergent engineering issues through prototype and development. Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Requisition: R0211438 Systems Test and Evaluation Engineer (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you want to build and help procure and deliver the most advanced strategic military communications systems? Do you want to provide creative and resilient solutions to ensure success of a critical national security mission? If this sounds like you, come join Booz Allen’s Strategic SATCOM team to work on a top-priority space program.

On our team, you will work will Booz Allen colleagues, other support contractors, and U.S. Space Force personnel to develop and deploy the next generation of strategic military satellite communications capabilities. Your client will trust you to assist in the development of Test and Evaluation (T&E) strategies for a space system ground segment software program. You will work with ground segment integrated product teams to develop test strategies, support document development, and execute and monitor test activities for the ground segment. You will assist with key T&E processes and meetings, including interactions with other segments and the Integrated Test Force. Your expertise and innovative thinking will be critical to ensuring capabilities are delivered to meet the threat. Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable Navy Enterprise Networks to achieve their missions, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and software, requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, a seasoned network engineer who knows how to develop the exact network Navy Enterprise Networks needs. 

As the lead network engineer for our team, you’ll use your experience in network design and architecture to support the nation’s defense and respond to evolving adversaries. You’ll upgrade or develop enterprise-wide infrastructure, troubleshoot and resolve complex network issues, analyze current working infrastructures, and increase security, reliability, and availability for mission-critical network systems.  

Your knowledge of DoD Enterprise Network Design and Architecture will come in handy as you optimize client operations and modernization. Using your experience in software and hardware firewalls, Cisco hardware, firewalls, cloud migration, optical infrastructure networking, virtual routing and forwarding, you’ll serve as a trusted advisor to clients on mission-critical projects. Using your technical curiosity and knowledge of industry standards, you’ll make an impact on national security missions.  

Advance your career with us as we help develop the next generation network for Navy Enterprise Networks.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:

3+ years of experience as a Senior Network Engineer deploying new network capabilities

3+ years of experience as a Senior Network Engineer delivering systems engineering artifacts, including L2/L3 Network Diagrams, L1 Cabling Diagrams, Network Installation Guides, and Analysis of Alternatives (AoA)  

3+ years of experience with writing detailed functional systems requirements with measurable "pass" criteria

3+ years of experience with applying and mitigating Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs)

1+ years of experience with designing or deploying multicast networks

Knowledge of networking protocols, including the TCP/IP stack

Ability to be a self-starter and organize own work to meet project goals and deadlines

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree or 7+ years of experience with network engineering in lieu of a degree

Ability to obtain DoD 8570 IAT II Cisco CCNA certification and Security+ certification before start date


Nice If You Have:

3+ years of experience with virtualized network development environments, such as GNS3 or EVE-NG

Experience with Airborne or Navy Tactical Networks, such as ADNS, UCLASS, MQ-25A, or STACC

Experience with configuration of OSPF, PIM, IGMP, VRRP, and IPSec

Experience with network scripting, including TCL and Python

Experience with automated provisioning, configuration and management using Ansible

Experience with the YANG data model and with the NETCONF and RESTCONF network management protocol

Ability to perform in a heavy customer facing role

Possession of strong verbal and written communication skills

Cisco CCNP or CCIE certification

Operate within a converged Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC), conducting escalated triage and incident response across both information technology (IT) and operational technology (OT) environments. Handle complex security events requiring advanced analysis and decision-making, ensuring that threats are effectively contained and remediated within hybrid systems. Serve as a technical expert during critical incidents, collaborating with IT and OT teams to address interconnected risks and vulnerabilities. Mentor and support junior CSOC analysts by providing training, sharing expertise, and reviewing their work to enhance team capabilities and performance. Contribute to developing and refining detection and response playbooks tailored to the unique requirements of IT and OT environments. Continuously monitor and analyze emerging threats to strengthen the CSOC’s detection and response strategies, leveraging frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK. Maintain detailed documentation of incidents and remediation efforts to support compliance and post-incident reviews, ensuring alignment with IT and OT regulatory standards.

Experience with IT and OT regulatory standards and compliance requirements related to incident management

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you searching for a position where you can use your logistics analysis skills to make a difference? With the level of complexity of the F-35 program, we need a skilled Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Introduction to Service Analyst to support the activation of aircraft facilities and keep the program on the path to success. That’s why we need you, an experienced FMS F-35 Introduction to Service Analyst who can ensure success through management, careful analysis, and effective communication.

We have an opportunity for an FMS F-35 Introduction to Service Analyst to join our team as we support our client’s international initiatives to acquire, deliver, and sustain a fully capable, interoperable, and operationally dominant international FMS nation's F-35 program. In this role, you’ll directly support the logistic and sustainment manager, program manager, and site activation director by leading the planning and presentations for site activation meetings, logistics readiness reviews, and key integrated logistic support engagements. You’ll also serve in a lead role alongside program leadership to drive and achieve logistics support objectives, including life cycle support, site surveys, activation planning, contract requirements, working groups, facility design, and interfacing with the client.

We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. This is a chance to directly impact DoD initiatives while learning how to develop program strategy and eliminate risks across projects. Join us and help make sure our program stays on time and within budget as we improve the capability and interoperability of an international F-35 program.

Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

10+ years of experience working with DoD projects

Experience with international agreements and projects

Experience with acquisition logistics

Knowledge of the principles, policies, and practices of aircraft system acquisition to plan, organize, and coordinate critical aspects of the deployment of aircraft systems, subsystems, and equipment

Knowledge of federal laws and DoD regulations dealing with acquisition, logistics, and foreign military sales

Ability to interpret complex numerical and written data to determine analysis

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. With the critical decisions made in our government every day, we need an intel analyst like you to do just that. As a GEOINT Collection Manager, you use your specialized technical, regional, and functional experience and your attention to detail to develop comprehensive multi-intelligence, multi-source strategies to give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, inform our client and our nation’s leaders. 

As an intelligence analyst on our team, you’ll help your client understand complex and unusual intelligence problems. Using your understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, develop effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources in support of the GEOINT Enterprise. You’ll validate information and apply client tradecraft as you build assessments for end-to-end collection performance and GEOINT systems performance data. As the authority on your tradecraft your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations on a full range of issues and challenges, often under pressure.  

This is a chance to grow your technical expertise, develop new skills, learn software modeling tools, and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools.  

Work with us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our clients, warfighters, nation’s leaders, and the Intelligence Community.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience utilizing GEOINT collection management information systems

Knowledge of the GEOINT Community, their focus areas, and their collection management structures, including NSG tools, and DoD and IC collaborative tools designed to assist in GEOINT collection, production, and visualization

Knowledge of GEOINT tasking and collection processes and protocols and of GEOINT databases, such as NPAT, GIMS Research, WEB BVI, CRATE, JEMA, or FGDB

Knowledge of national, commercial, and airborne GEOINT sensors and capabilities

Knowledge of multi-INT sources, imaging and non-imaging sensors, and capabilities and limitations of source phenomenology

Ability to discover and implement process improvements

Ability to collaborate with analysts to deconstruct problems and develop effective collection approaches and solutions

Ability to liaise with partners across the IC and DoD to innovate and enable intelligence integration

TS/SCI clearance

HS diploma or GED 


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with throughput integration and dissemination-related activities with COCOM or Service-level exercises

Knowledge of DoD and IC databases and services

Bachelor’s degree preferred; Master’s degree a plus

GEOINT Professional Certification – Fundamentals (F)

GEOINT Professional Certification – Collections (C)

Job Requisition: R0217776 Information System Security Engineer, Mid (Open)
Job Profile: Systems Security & Network Security Engineer, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you looking for an opportunity to advance your experience in Cyber Network Security and Risk Management Framework that will help secure the Navy's cybersecurity posture? As a systems security and network security engineer, you can identify the tools needed to assess vulnerabilities and recommend the best solution and security strategy. We need your experience to develop and implement security solutions that will protect the Navy's infrastructure. On our team, you’ll troubleshoot and analyze complex challenges for customers using your knowledge of network and security devices and applications. You’ll use your curiosity for technology and market trends to further research and develop security solutions. Using your experience in SCAP and ACAS, you’ll help assess security threats and implement infrastructure controls.  In this role, you’ll closely impact the Navy's cyber mission by securing the Navy's cyber infrastructure. With mentoring, challenging hands-on problem-solving, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers.  Work with us as we secure and protect the Navy for the better.  

What You’ll Work On: 

Develop relationships quickly and easily with other teams, communicating the complexities of security with a wide variety of audiences, including senior management. 

Implement infrastructure and cybersecurity controls, including enhanced detection and vulnerability capabilities and improved event correlation in large enterprises.  

Perform risk and vulnerability assessments in network, system, and application areas.

Leverage big data analytics and traditional security event types to identify advanced threats or indicators of compromise. 


Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:

3+ years of experience in cybersecurity, Engineering, Test, and Evaluation (T&E), or Assessment & Authorization (A&A)

Experience working with Information Assurance tools such as Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) or Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS)

Knowledge of the Risk Management Framework (RMF)

Knowledge of security policies and guidance documents to assist with the preparation and maintenance of process artifacts and traceability documents purposed for compliance with Authority to Operate (ATO) requirements

Ability to evaluate security solutions to ensure they meet security requirements for processing up to classified information and supervise or maintain the operational security posture for an information system or program

Top Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED

IAT Level II Certification such as CompTIA Security+ Certification


Nice If You Have:   

5+ years of experience in cybersecurity, Engineering, Test, and Evaluation (T&E), or Assessment & Authorization (A&A) 

Knowledge of SCAP and Information Assurance Tools such as SCC and EvaluateSTIG

Knowledge of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7 and 8 and Windows Server 2012R2 and Server 2019

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a defense mission professional, you ask questions others don’t. You understand the nuances of complex situations. You use your skills to think bigger and push further, solving complex problems. We’re looking for an expert like you to drive solutions for missions that keep our nation safe.

As a Joint Operation Planner, you’ll bring your military planning expertise to coordinate and lead work on projects supporting national defense and military capability development and employment. You’ll analyze available information, develop and test options, write plans and orders, and assess organizational progress to aid in accomplishing the organizations objectives in and through cyberspace. You’ll participate and provide input throughout all planning functions, from translating strategic guidance through concept and plan development to plan assessments and associated functions. You will contribute to the development, revision, and coordination of campaign, support, and contingency plans, including commander’s estimates, base plans, concept plans, and operations plans, and ensure cyberspace operations are integrated with all appropriate and associated annexes and appendices. You will coordinate and integrate DoD requirements, targets, and priorities into planning and participate in all Joint operation contingency and crisis planning activities as a facilitator and lead member of Joint Planning Groups (JPGs) and Operational Planning Teams (OPTs), as needed, to ensure proper representation of applicable guidance and doctrine into planning. You’ll be a senior trusted advisor to our clients, and we’ll look to you to identify, analyze, and evaluate complex systems, policies, processes, and capabilities related to countering foreign cyberspace threats and bolstering homeland security as part of the joint mission.

You’ll oversee the work we do for military cyberspace operations and the solutions we deliver for military missions, cyberspace defense, national security, and strategic and operational planning.

Further your career with us as you help solve complex design, integration, and analytical problems for the Joint Force's cyberspace missions.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

15+ years of experience as a Joint Operation Planner   

Knowledge of the Joint Planning Process (JPP), Joint Operation Planning and Execution System (JOPES), and Adaptive Planning and Execution Enterprise (APEX) planning formats and guidance

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam  

Master’s degree from the School of Advanced Military Studies (SAMS), School of Advanced Warfighting (SAW), School of Advanced Air and Space Studies (SAASS), Joint Advanced Warfighting School (JAWS), or Joint Special Operations University (JSOU)

Joint Professional Military Education Phase II (JPME II) Certification or completion of the Joint Information Operations Planners Course (JIOPC) or similar military operations planning course

Nice If You Have:  

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Completion of other military planning courses similar to JIOPC

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you find yourself constantly looking for more and better information? Do you want a job where you can use your knowledge and research skills to improve national security? Never has the role of a SIGINT and FISINT Analyst been so meaningful. More connected devices, larger storage capacity, and faster connections have resulted in an explosion of available information. The problem facing the Department of Defense (DoD) is no longer how to get more data, it’s understanding how to turn the data they have into answers. That’s where you come in. With critical thinking and flexibility, you quickly seek out accurate data sources, intercept and analyze foreign electronic emissions, and turn raw data into valuable intelligence. If you have strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters and protect our national security. As a SIGINT and FISINT Analyst on our team, you’ll explore new data sources, create effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources to help your client understand their mission environment. You’ll learn how to validate the information and apply client tradecraft as you help build assessments for warfighters and capability developers.

This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in the application of new Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning analytic tools, and share your skills with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our warfighters.

As part of the space EWIR program, you will play a crucial role in integrating and updating electronic warfare systems to ensure they are up-to-date and capable of responding to evolving threats. You will conduct SIGINT analysis to intercept, analyze, and interpret foreign electronic emissions, providing strategic and tactical intelligence that supports the EWIR program's mission. Your expertise in SIGINT will be essential in transforming raw data into valuable intelligence, supporting operational plans, and ensuring national security.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

7+ years of experience with FISINT analysis

Knowledge of DoD and IC FISINT research and analysis methods, procedures, and documentation processes

Ability to interpret complex data and identify patterns

Ability to develop innovative methods to intercept and analyze signals

Ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams in high-pressure situations

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:

Possession of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor’s degree


Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Job Requisition: R0217833 Air and Missile Intelligence Analyst (Open)
Job Description:
Key Role: 
Leverage intelligence research experience and foreign conventional weapons knowledge to perform threat analysis and characterization. Analyze, characterize, and assess foreign threats based on all available information in the intelligence community (IC) record, including GEOINT, SIGINT, MASINT, HUMINT, and OSINT, threat characterization studies that extend beyond the intelligence record, and SME experience and judgment for a broad spectrum of foreign conventional weapons across terrestrial such as ground-mobile launch and long-range strike platforms, air-defense and over-the-horizon surveillance, and fire control systems, maritime such as surface and subsurface vessels equipped with long-range strike weapons, air such as next generation fighter aircraft, bombers, long-range air-to-air missiles, standard and hypersonic cruise missiles, and space such as long- range ballistic and maneuverable missiles, hypersonic glide vehicles, or fractional orbital bombardment systems domains. Provide assessments on system research and development activities, timelines, designs, configurations, capabilities, performance, operations, employment strategies, and signatures. Tailor assessments to inform client initiatives working to generate, evaluate, and recommend force designs for U.S. space-based systems, services, and architectures. Apply knowledge of weapon system architectures, networks, and technology along with experience using IC tools and databases to identify, extract, and analyze pertinent information and provide technical analysis to support protection initiatives. Engage IC partners to develop integrated analysis plans, solicit further insights, and collaborate on additional research. Identify information gaps and threat information needs to task IC entities via standard IC tasking processes and request for information tools to conduct additional collection and analysis. Author and coordinate threat assessment products on foreign missile programs combining intelligence information and Department of Defense (DoD) technical and operations analysis in collaboration with IC and DoD partners.

Basic Qualifications:

8+ years of experience with intelligence analysis and production in DoD or IC environments

3+ years of experience with all-source intelligence analysis and production n DoD or IC environments

3+ years of experience with operational weapon system intelligence analysis and production

Knowledge of foreign conventional weapons design and performance attributes and foreign military operations and dependencies

Knowledge of U.S. national and service-specific IC roles and responsibilities

Knowledge of IC reporting, sources, dissemination mechanisms, and tradecrafts

Knowledge of both U.S. service and national security space systems and architectures

Ability to work in a dynamic environment, focused on networking with other IC partners

Active TS/SCI clearance; willing to take a polygraph exam

HS diploma or GED


Additional Qualifications: 

Experience providing intelligence support to research and development efforts

Experience working in special access program and special access required environments

Knowledge of U.S. missile and missile warning operations planning process

Knowledge of current USSPACECOM and Component intelligence operations

Bachelor’s degree in Physical Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or an Intelligence field preferred; Master’s degree a plus

Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that there’s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need an experienced data engineer like you to help our clients find answers in their big data to impact important missions—from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence.   

As a big data engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll implement data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll deploy and develop pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful.  

Here, you’ll work with and guide a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll use your experience in analytical exploration and data examination while you manage the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients.  

Work with us to use big data for good. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:   

5+ years of experience in database design, architecture, data modeling, and engineering to include scaling, monitoring, and operating data platforms

5+ years of experience designing, developing, operationalizing, and maintaining complex data applications at enterprise scale 

3+ years of experience creating software for retrieving, parsing, and processing structured and unstructured data utilizing data lakes

3+ years of experience using Python and Advanced SQL to build scalable ETL/ELT workflows for reporting and analytics 

Experience with relational databases and working in a cloud environment, like AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud 

Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark and Databricks

Secret clearance 

Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering

CompTIA Security+ Certification

Linux+ or OS Certification  


Nice If You Have:   

Experience with UNIX/Linux, including basic commands and Shell scripting 

Experience conducting data architecture and ETL in or for an S&T mission-focused organization.

Experience breaking up existing stored procedures to create a multi-tiered architecture, including a robust data access layer

Experience with Machine Learning

Experience with Agile engineering practices

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As a data scientist, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data scientist at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors—from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence—we need you to help find the answers in the data. 

On our team, you’ll use your analytical skills and data science knowledge to create real-world impact. You’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop algorithms and systems and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to help clients make informed decisions. Ultimately, you’ll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used.  

Work with us as we use data science for good.  

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Experience using scientific methods to inform qualitative and quantitative analyses

Job Requisition: R0217808 Digital Network Exploitation Analyst, Senior (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Do you have strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset? Are you looking for an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation's leaders? As a network and access discovery analyst, you will use your specialized technical experience to enable cyber space operations and intelligence collection to enable the success of mission owners. 
  
As an analyst on our team, you will provide expert analytic support while working alongside the mission owners to tackle complex and challenging problems in computer network analysis, network exploitation, digital network intelligence, dataflow, access development, and target network analysis. Your duties will require you to leverage an understanding of ports, protocols, networking devices, and common exploitation frameworks. This will provide an opportunity to grow your expertise, develop new skills and tradecraft, use and share your methodologies and tool experience with other analysts, and most importantly, be a part of a team conducting offensive cyberspace operations that are crucial to national security. 
 
Join us. The world can't wait. 

You Have: 

6+ years of experience with network exploitation or signals intelligence analysis

Experience with encryption techniques, routing, and network infrastructure 

Experience with CNO processes and capabilities

Ability to leverage processes and tools for signals intelligence discovery analysis

Ability to assess network vulnerabilities and identify key network topology

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph 

HS diploma or GED

Nice If You Have: 

Experience with dataflow and signals intelligence architecture 

Experience with programming languages for scripting and automation, including Python or C++ 

Experience with penetration testing tools

Knowledge of ports, protocols, and common network configurations 

Knowledge of IT logging best practices 

Bachelor's degree

Network+, Security+, CEH, CCNA, or SANS Certification
