Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Research & Development (R&D) is the lifeblood of innovation and progress. Successfully transitioning R&D products from the controlled environment of the lab to dynamic field exercises is crucial for validating their real-world applicability and performance. This process helps our client ensure that groundbreaking technologies are not only theoretically sound but also practically viable, paving the way for their deployment on mission.

The Field Exercise System Engineer will support a small team to perform the planning and execution of field tests and mission exercises to evaluate Electronic Warfare (EW) and Cyber R&D products. This role will support integration of multiple EW and Cyber software and hardware systems to achieve the exercise objectives. Example tasks may include software API design and integration, security boundary definition, tactical network connection, data storage design, requirements derivation, and design of exercise scenarios that accurately reflect real-world conditions and operational challenges. During an exercise, example tasks may include field or exercise logistics, site survey, site preparation, equipment setup, participant coordination, and data analysis to provide feedback to R&D teams to refine and improve product performance.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience developing and maintaining system integration documentation including OV-1, sequence diagrams, or interface control documents

Experience performing software integration of mission planning and execution systems

Ability to travel up to 25% of the time

Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have: 

3+ years of experience supporting EW and Cyber missions or development activities

Experience developing Electronic Warfare (EW) or Cyber scenarios or Master Scenario Event Lists (MSELs) for DoD exercises

Experience managing field or exercise logistics

Experience with tactical communication networks

Experience with spectrum management and frequency request process

Knowledge of radio communication protocols

Knowledge of Radio Frequency (RF) propagation, amplifiers, and antennas

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree in Systems Engineering or a related field

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As a Maritime Analyst working at a combatant command, you use your specialized technical and functional experience and your attention to detail to develop reports and analytic assessments to give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to inform our nation’s leaders and to protect our national security.

As Maritime Analyst on our team, you’ll help your client understand their operational landscape and mission environment. Using your understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, develop effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources and various intelligence disciplines. You’ll validate information and apply client tradecraft as you build assessments for senior policymakers and US IC-wide products. As the authority on your topic, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure.

This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in intelligence analysis and partner nation engagement, and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools.

Work with us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our government.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

5+ years of experience with maritime capabilities or naval analysis  

5+ years of experience with researching and producing intelligence products on military capabilities or political analysis, fusing ELINT, GEOINT, OSINT, SIGINT, and HUMINT into all-source analysis

5+ years of experience with supporting a Combatant Command  

Experience with ICD-203 Analytic Standards

Ability to adhere to DIA tradecraft and writing standards, brief at the general officer level, and to produce foundational intelligence products and coordinate production across the IC

Ability to work flexible shift hours and support crisis operations

Ability to travel to support engagements 

TS/SCI clearance

Associate's degree and 7+ years of experience with intelligence analysis, Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of experience with intelligence analysis, or 10+ years of experience with intelligence analysis in lieu of a degree 


Nice If You Have: 

8+ years of experience conducting maritime analysis, including analyzing maritime domain awareness infrastructure, capabilities and limitations of naval platforms, naval communications systems, and naval operations and exercise

Experience with sea and maritime operations center

Experience with applying technology and innovation to analysis

Experience with partner nation engagements, including skills in briefing foreign military officers, participating in bilateral and multilateral intelligence exchanges, and working with FDO to coordinate release of intelligence IAW with relevant guidelines

Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills, including presentations

Job Description:
The Opportunity:As an expert in defense missions, your unique background inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to solve some of our clients’ most complex problems—and find solutions that keep our nation safe. 

As a Naval Integration Planner, you’ll bring your leadership, strategic, tactical, technical, and planning expertise to work alongside thought leaders in maritime operations, command and control (C2), operational planning, and cross-echelon analysis on projects for United States Naval Forces Europe and Africa. You’ll use your skills and expertise to support planning at theater, operational, and tactical levels with a focus on maritime support to Combatant Command contingency and operational plans.
Work with us to analyze complex systems, policies, and operations related to maritime support plans within the U.S. European Command (EUCOM) and U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM) areas of responsibility. Develop schedules, plans of action and milestones, and key products for planning, coordination, collaboration, and presentation. You’ll facilitate participation in exercises, experiments, and events to ensure the exploration, testing, and refinement of naval integration efforts. You will provide expertise and analysis for doctrine, tactics, techniques, and procedures, as well as after-action reports (AARs), and recommend courses of action for C2, supported-supporting relationships, authorities, and rules of engagement to enhance mission effectiveness. You’ll monitor Functional Component Commander actions such as apportionment of assets and tasking priorities to ensure alignment with strategic goals and analyze personnel and command and control requirements and capabilities to enable naval operations across the spectrum of conflict.

You served your country as an Officer in the Navy or Marine Corps—now, continue your mission with us. Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.
Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

Experience supporting military planning at theater, operational, or tactical levels

Experience leading joint planning teams, operational planning teams, and battle rhythm events

Experience planning large-scale planning events with military headquarters staff elements

Experience with the Joint Planning Process, Navy Planning Process, Maritime Operational Planning Process, or Military Decision-Making Process, including Adaptive Planning and Execution

Knowledge of U.S. Navy organization and structure, including Fleet Operations and emerging concepts

Knowledge of naval and joint doctrine

Ability to coordinate across staff functions and command echelons

Ability to brief senior-level customers, including flag officers

Top Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree 


Nice If You Have:  

Master’s degree

Completion of the Maritime Operational Planners Course

Completion of Joint Professional Military Education Phase 1 and 2, Joint Advanced Warfighting School, Maritime Advanced Warfighting School, School of Advanced Warfighting, School of Advanced Military Studies, NATO Comprehensive Operations Planning Course, or a similar course

Job Posting: Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor, Mid
Job Requisition: R0217845 Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor, Mid (Open)
Job Profile: Information Security Risk Specialist, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to government agencies and military organizations. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you. We need your knowledge as an information security risk specialist to help break down complex threats into manageable plans of action.    

You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure their mission-critical infrastructure. This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills.

As a Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor on our team, you will work with the DoD and other federal government organizations to discover their cyber risks, comprehend applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You will get technical, environmental, and personnel details from Security Professionals and Leaders, Systems Administrators, Network Administrators and Engineers, IAMs, and ISSOs to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you will help your team to guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, white papers, and milestones. You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure the client's information systems, assets, and enclaves possess the necessary security measures to ensure their availability, protection, integrity, authentication, confidentiality, and non-repudiation, including monitoring, detection, discovery, and reaction capabilities of internal and external adversaries and ensure a trained and effective IA workforce.

This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills in conducting reviews of enterprises, enclaves, networks, systems and applications, certification and accreditation support, independent evaluation based on national and DoD-level Cybersecurity and IA and Cybersecurity Service requirements, and the procedures and practices as they are implemented by the combatant commands and supporting organizations and agencies, to ensure their adequacy to provide a measurement and training tool to determine the defending force’s readiness and provide a basis for planning and programming needed improvements. Join us as we protect our military’s communications systems and our nation’s cyber infrastructure.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience with network devices, appliances, firewalls, routers, and various versions of UNIX or LINUX operating systems on information systems (IS), including workstations, servers, laptops, and network devices

Knowledge of DoD STIGs and RMF assessment tools

Ability to consolidate, create, and brief findings based on analysis

Ability to travel up to 85% of the time

Ability to work at CONUS and OCONUS locations

Top Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED

DoD 8570 IAT Level II Certification


Nice If You Have: 

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree

Completion of Security Scanning Courses, including Walk-through Training, Onsite Shadowing, Checkride, or eMASS Course

DoD 8570 IAT Level III Certification

Assessor Program (ACP), UNIX, or Network Vulnerability Assessments Certification


Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.
Job Profile Skills:
Assessment & Authorization (A&A)

Continuous Monitoring

Cybersecurity Risk Management

Disaster Recovery (DR)

Enterprise Information Security Architecture

FISMA Compliance

Information Assurance

Information Security Auditing

Information Security Management

Information Security Operations

Information System Security

Network Security

Risk Management

Security Control Assessment (SCA)

Supervisory Organization: Supervisory Organization (Stevie Nicole Boole | Nicole Boole (622754))
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a United States Marine Corps (USMC) Program Office Liaison, you’ll bring your technical and operational USMC expertise as you support projects for our Navy and USMC clients. You’ll provide engineering support to development and integration capabilities on behalf of the USMC.

You’ll be a trusted advisor to the USMC Deputy Program Manager on a wide range of interactions between the Marine Corps and Navy, and will provide engineering and integration consultation to the Navy on behalf of the USMC. You will initiate or participate in technical exchanges and joint development efforts to strengthen partnerships, mitigate service risk within the program, and advance related initiatives.

You will provide informed recommendations about the program’s strategic objectives, processes, storage, and analytic capabilities, providing insight and synchronization with USMC objectives and requirements. You will provide expert coordination with users and stakeholders to deliver innovative insights regarding the development and testing capabilities to meet USMC objectives.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
Experience with USMC strategic, operational, tactical, or technical objectives
Experience with intelligence, space, overhead, or data integration programs, or on joint targeting and joint fires programs
Ability to integrate into a fast-paced, multi-partner team environment
Top Secret clearance
Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) field and 2+ years of experience with USMC program development, integration, engineering, or operations, or 5+ years of experience with USMC program development, integration, engineering, or operations in lieu of a degree

Nice If You Have:
Experience with SAP programs
Experience with the INDOPACOM AOR
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills
TS/SCI clearance

The Opportunity:
The Booz Allen Earned Value Management (EVM) Office is seeking an experienced, disciplined, and driven Project Scheduler to drive EVM program planning and scheduling operations to develop, update, maintain, and analyze the Integrated Master Schedule (IMS). As a Project Scheduler, you will collaborate directly with the Program Cost Analyst and work closely with a variety of project management personnel to ensure schedule alignment with project milestones and objectives, perform schedule analysis to identify and mitigate risks, instill appropriate change management and control, and prepare EVM metrics and status reports. You will also conduct regular schedule reviews, validate schedule data integration, contribute to ongoing process improvement initiatives, and ensure compliance with industry standards for project scheduling. Your efforts will span from supporting program startup and planning activities to facilitating the monthly Business Rhythm throughout the execution lifecycle.

The Opportunity:
As a project management specialist, you know the complexities of supporting a project from concept to completion. Many programs require a significant investment of limited resources, and it’s imperative to keep the project on a productive path. That’s why we need you, a project management specialist who can help ensure success through careful analysis and effective communication.

On our team, you’ll implement and maintain organizational programs in support of victim service programs in American Indian and Alaska Native communities. Your role will involve developing tools, templates, program guidance documents or resources to support program operations. You’ll regularly interact with clients, American Indian or Alaska Native victim service providers and community members, and other subject matter experts.

The real impact of project management comes from communication to ensure the program achieves its goals and meets our quality standards. At Booz Allen, we recognize that we must continuously grow as a team to bring the best support to our clients, so here you’ll have all the resources to succeed. This is a chance to influence a meaningful mission while learning how to develop and maintain program strategy. 

Work with us and help make sure our client and stakeholders accomplish their most pressing goals as we improve victim services in American Indian or Alaska Native communities. This position will require the ability to travel to client site in Anchorage, AK.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

2+ years of experience working with or on behalf of American Indian or Alaska Native communities

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
On our team, you will serve as the Global Defense Sector Risk Officer across Booz Allen’s defense business. You will lead and oversee the global defense risk management function, responsible for the leadership, innovation, governance, and management necessary to identify, evaluate, mitigate, and monitor the sector’s technical, strategic and cybersecurity risk. This role is well-suited for a seasoned leader with a combination of technical vision, business acumen and strategic perspective. You will proactively partner with counterpart sector risk officers, senior Global Defense leaders, the Chief Technology Officer, Chief Information Security Officer and leaders across the company to develop strategies and provide guidance in protecting the company’s assets and reputation as it competes for and delivers world-class work. You will lead a team of experienced business information security professionals to ensure business decisions sufficiently consider risk potential and protect information security environments from critical cyber-protection gaps.

Booz Allen’s foundation is based on living our values every day to realize our purpose: to empower people to change the world. These values include Ferocious Integrity, Collective Ingenuity, Passionate Service, Champions Heart, and Unflinching Courage.
               
Join us. The world can't wait.

25+ years of experience in leadership roles in the defense industry managing large and complex programs
15+ years of experience evaluating risk posture on large programs
Experience leading teams of executives
Secret clearance
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering

CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $215,000 to $385,000 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

Job Profile: Systems Security & Network Security Engineer, Associate
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to share your experience in network security, network scanning, and cloud security architecture to support our country's most important dynamic missions? As a systems security and network security engineer, you can identify the key security needs of a network, assess vulnerabilities, and recommend the best solution and security strategy. We need your experience to lead the development and implementation of security solutions that will enable a cutting-edge U.S. government client that is at the forefront of cyber operations.

On our team, you’ll troubleshoot and analyze complex challenges for customers using your knowledge of network scanning tools, cybersecurity best practices, security control frameworks, and cybersecurity in containerized environments. You’ll use your curiosity for technology and market trends to further research and develop security solutions. Using your knowledge and experience in containerization, cybersecurity principles, Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, and other cloud methodologies, you’ll assess security threats and implement infrastructure controls.  

In this role, you’ll closely impact a government client with a high operational tempo by supporting network security and cybersecurity hygiene and enabling our national security through your expertise. With mentoring, challenging hands-on problem-solving, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers.  

Work with us as we secure and protect our country's most important networks.

Develop relationships quickly and easily with other teams, communicating the complexities of security with a wide variety of audiences, including senior management. 

Implement infrastructure and cybersecurity controls, including enhanced detection and vulnerability capabilities and improved event correlation in large enterprises.  

Perform risk and vulnerability assessments in network, system, and application areas.

Leverage big data analytics and traditional security event types to identify advanced threats or indicators of compromise. 


Join us. The world can’t wait.

5+ years of experience with network Security Control Frameworks to support accreditation and cybersecurity standards

Analyze Political, Military, Economic, Social Information, and Infrastructure (PMESII) factors influencing military and political strategy, the planning and execution of military operations, and the impact of domestic and foreign policy on space domain integration within the Area of Responsibility. Coordinate, support, and integrate space effects or capabilities into the development of Operational Plans (OPLANs), Execution Orders (EXORDs), and crisis action planning orders documentation, as well as Operational Planning Team (OPT) participation and Concept Plan (CONPLAN) edits. Provide joint military decision-making process (JMDMP) planning and operations support for the development, planning, coordination, management, and execution of space operations to meet theater objectives. Provide operational, exercise, engagement planning, and subject matter expert (SME) support to identify and integrate space into all domain operations. Provide SME support to U.S. Space Forces. Work to provide support integrating space equities into core Combatant Command (CCMD) planning documents such as OPLANs, CONPLANs, and others that support campaign and contingency plans. Assist in increasing European Command (EUCOM) staff’s overall understanding of space domain and effects employment.

10+ years of experience in military planning at the headquarters level or higher such as Joint Staff, Combatant Command, Field Commands, or Space Operations Command

5+ years of experience with Space

Experience with Security Cooperation Programs and applicability

Knowledge of national security strategy and military doctrine

Bachelor’s degree

You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused engineering solution.

As a systems engineer on our team, you’ll have the chance to support the design and implementation of space-based systems to deliver resilient, affordable, and sustainable space capabilities. Your technical expertise will be vital as you evaluate and modernize Global Positioning Systems (GPS). You’ll develop your skills in developing and acquiring space systems while gaining experience with delivering sustained, reliable GPS capabilities to America’s warfighters, our allies, and civil users. Job Requisition: R0218063 Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst, Mid (Open)
Job Profile: Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity: As a cyber threat intel analyst, you know the key to detecting and deterring malicious activity is quality risk-based intel that maps to a tactical behavior. At Booz Allen, you can apply your expertise to investigate the most pressing cyber threats impacting U.S. critical infrastructure. This is your chance to take on the adversary’s perspective, identify their motivations, and recommend ways to harden systems, reduce their attack surface, and thwart malicious actors.     As a Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst on our team, you’ll oversee the collection, documentation, assessment, and analysis of raw cyber threat information using tools and technologies like MISP, ThreatQ, FireEye, LookingGlass, MITRE Attack Framework, Linux, UNIX, or tcpdump to enrich intelligence. You’ll conduct strategic assessments on systems and networks and provide tactical analyses and influential recommendations for network operation. You’ll be the key to discovering and correlating timely threat intel and deciphering what represents a real risk, and you’ll play a lead role in incident analysis, adversarial research, and finished intelligence products to inform policy makers, cyber operators, and mission area leadership. Cyber threats are evolving. Booz Allen is committed to creating an environment where you not only keep pace with the industry but propel it forward. With access to academic programs, certifications, and opportunities to use expert tradecraft, we’ll continuously invest in you so you can create the career you want as you grow.  Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have:  

Experience with intelligence analysis principles or cyber threat intelligence principles

Experience in a consulting environment, communicating technical subjects to clients

Knowledge of information security and IT threats, attacks, and vulnerabilities

Knowledge of cybersecurity concepts

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

TS/SCI clearance

HS diploma or GED and 12+ years of experience with cybersecurity, Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of experience with cybersecurity, or Master’s degree and 6+ years of experience with cybersecurity


Nice If You Have:  

Experience with computer network protocols and operations

Experience with the IC and its products, procedures, and computer networks

Experience with East Asia actors

Knowledge of Advanced Persistent Threats

Knowledge of analytic threat models, including ATT&CK, Pyramid of Pain, and Diamond Model

Ability to perform queries on indicators and characteristics, including Message-Digest Algorithm 5, Secure Hash Algorithm 1, IP Addresses, file size, file name, and file paths

Ability to conduct classified and unclassified research using research tools

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem-solving skills, and analytical skills

Net+, Security+, CEH, CCNA, or SANS Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Critical decisions are made every day in our government. With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers.  As a signals intelligence analyst, you will be responsible for examining information and data to understand adversary capabilities. You will use advanced and unique signal processing tools and techniques to collect, interpret, and analyze data, providing critical and timely insights into potential threats and strategic developments.
You will conduct thorough analyses of signal data to identify anomalies, and convey findings to stakeholders, and recommend follow-on action. You will work closely with an interdisciplinary team of intelligence professionals and subject matter experts to share information and derive new conclusion from challenging data sources. You will help to develop, test, and refine new solutions for complex signals analysis and acquisition problems. Using your comprehensive understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, develop effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources. You’ll validate information and develop tradecraft as you build assessments. As an authority on your topic, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure.

This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills, and share your insights with other technical specialists. You can interact with collection managers, collection operators, and analysts on new analytic methods, technologies, and collection strategies, and collaborate with national and tactical collection and operations elements to advance target development efforts, recommend collection strategies, and support strategic and operational requirements.
We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of the intelligence community (IC).

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
8+ years of experience with COMINT, PROFORMA, or Foreign Instrumentation Signals Intelligence (FISINT) collection and signals analysis
Ability to work across disparate teams to drive insights at the tactical and strategic level
Ability to perform, collaborate, and build solid relationships in a large, operational working environment
Ability to support 24/7 operations as needed by staffing shortages or client direction
Ability to report technical characteristics of signals and maintain knowledge bases
Ability to obtain timely medical and psychological clearance
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
HS diploma or GED

Nice If You Have:
Experience using tasking, collection, exploitation, analysis, or processing tools
Experience working in a joint environment
Experience testing and evaluating developmental tools
Experience with local site personnel, processes, and procedures
Knowledge of SIGINT requirements and intelligence oversight policies
Knowledge of the data and tools used in multiple intelligence disciplines
Ability to evaluate system inaccuracies and identify improvements
Bachelor’s degree in EE or AE preferred
Graduate of a Military Intelligence School, such as 451 or 452, or a relevant national agency equivalent training

At Booz Allen, we recognize that we must continuously grow as a team to bring the best support to our clients, so here you’ll have all the resources to succeed. You’ll use your findings to create a path forward that meets design requirements and ensures functionality. Your experience with complex integrated systems and understanding of material specifications is essential to ensuring quality when designing mission-critical solutions.

In this role, you’ll use your engineering logistics and materials expertise to contribute to the safety of the warfighter. You’ll partner with senior team members and apply your skills in root-cause analysis and process improvement resolution.

Use your curiosity and solution-oriented mindset to lead mission-critical engineering logistics for the Air Force.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

As a product manager at Booz Allen, you will have the unique opportunity to enhance the day-to-day experience of thousands of employees by ensuring the seamless operation of our SAP Concur Travel and Expense system. You will be the face of a system that is vitally important to both our employees and the business operations of the company. This role allows you to make strategic decisions, collaborate with functional and technical teams, and drive impactful changes that optimize our travel and expense processes.

Your primary responsibilities will center around leading the operational delivery and strategic enhancement of our SAP Concur Travel and Expense system. You will ensure its availability, functionality, performance, and security for over 37,000 employees. Additionally, you will oversee the day-to-day operations of the system, working with internal technical teams, functional teams, and industry vendors to resolve any issues and maintain its functionality. Job Description:

Define, communicate, and implement cybersecurity architecture and administration processes for cloud environments across multiple network domains. Collaborate across our cloud infrastructure delivery team and with stakeholders using an Agile process to ensure design, implementation, verification, and continuous monitoring of cloud solutions across multiple domains. Develop Risk Management Framework (RMF) Body of Evidence artifacts, including system security plans and cybersecurity concept of operations documents for Amazon Web Services (AWS) operating within Cloud environments in alignment with existing RMF packages. Support assessment and authorization activities to achieve and maintain Authority to Operate (ATO) on multiple networks. Evaluate enhancements to Cloud environments against RMF controls and DoD Security Technical Implementation Guidance (STIG) requirements. Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an analytics professional, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. Do you want to use your analytical mindset and grow your technical skills while developing solutions to problems? Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data analyst at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors, we need you to help find the answers in the data.

On our team, you’ll use your communication skills and analytical expertise to create real-world impact. You will be working with a multi-disciplinary team of data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, electrical engineers, test engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment directly assisting Department of Defense clients, such as the U.S. Air Force, in the testing and certification of new or modified aircraft systems. You’ll work closely with clients to understand the requirements behind every effort, and then dig into their data and documentation to help find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll run analytical tools, clean and transform data, conduct research, draft, review, and edit analytical reports, and effectively communicate results to the client in support of their decisions. You’ll guide teammates and help lead analytical processes and the development of algorithms and systems. You’ll use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to advise your clients as they make informed decisions. Ultimately, you’ll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used.

Work with us as we use data for good.

What You'll Work On:

Use your technical knowledge and analytical mindset to support client and stakeholder relationships.

Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through collection, interpretation, design of experiments, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets.

Apply your skills and data analytics experience by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.

Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as SQL, R, and Python, and Microsoft Office Suite.

Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.

Apply data visualization through different formats such as graphs, tables, PowerPoint presentations, and Tableau Dashboards.

Grow your communication and technical skills by merging big data to create data-centric solutions across the testing and evaluation industry.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

2+ years of experience with data exploration, data cleaning, data analysis, data visualization, or data mining

2+ years of experience communicating analysis in both written and verbal form

Experience writing analytical and technical reports and developing data visualizations to deliver key insights

Experience with a scripting language such as SQL, R, or Python to extract data and perform analytics and visualizations

Experience communicating and presenting analyses

Knowledge of good data principles, including data cleaning, preprocessing, and wrangling

Ability to clearly convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders and provide writing samples

Ability to maintain accuracy while dealing with large data sets with a high attention to detail and quality

Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with inferential statistics, including hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, and design of experiments

Experience with DevOps principles and Agile methodologies such as Kanban and Scrum

Experience with version control systems such as Git

Experience with electrical engineering data such as sensor data, signal processing, and system logs

Experience with the 1553 bus system

Experience in Developmental or Operational Test and Evaluation

Knowledge of descriptive statistics, including measures of central tendency and dispersion

Knowledge of probability distributions, both discrete and continuous

Top Secret clearance

Whether it’s process improvement, performance measurement, or business management analysis, organizational knowledge management comes down to one thing: learning how an organization works and making it better. Thankfully, that’s what you do: improve the systems that move entire organizations forward. It’s why we’re looking an organizational transformation and change consultant like you who can help identify long-term goals and support the creation of the processes needed to achieve them.

Ensure personnel who require access to meet the security clearance level through verification in DISS. Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a contract manager, you use your sharp negotiation tactics and talent for organization to help manage critical documents. We need you to bring your advanced contract management expertise to our Other Transaction team, where you’ll be a trusted advisor and a valuable team member who finds creative solutions to complex problems for an advanced technology company. 

On our team, you’ll use your advanced contracting knowledge to capture, implement, and manage a range of proposals and contracts within various markets. In this role, you’ll touch every element of government acquisition, from beginning stages to completion. You’ll review and analyze solicitations for potential risks, guide suggested proposal strategies, and advise leadership on risk mitigation strategies.

As a trusted business partner, you’ll provide full lifecycle support with a focus on terms and conditions negotiation, white paper and proposal support, project execution, and risk mitigation for Other Transaction (OT) prototype and follow-on production contracts or agreements. You'll provide expert advice and counsel to account executives and their program leadership on contractual matters, including contract types, regulatory and corporate policy compliance requirements, organizational conflict of interest, risk management, mitigation, and intellectual property negotiations, and monitor operational performance. Additionally, you'll support complex contract activity that requires the development of specialized contract vehicles and techniques to accomplish business goals and objectives.

At Booz Allen, you’ll work with a collaborative team where you’ll leverage your acquisition knowledge and be empowered to succeed. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

8+ years of experience with contract administration

2+ years of experience executing Other Transactions, especially OTs for Prototypes and OTs transitioning into Production

Experience with the usage of Commercial Solutions Openings (CSO)

Experience in negotiations or proposal preparation supporting government or commercial

Knowledge of DoD Other Transaction Guide for Prototypes, contract concepts, and contract acquisition law and regulations

Ability to support complex contract activity that requires the development of specialized contract vehicles and techniques to accomplish business goals and objectives

Ability to draft non-routine contractual instruments and use independent judgment and creativity to resolve contractual issues

Ability to provide training to account teams on the unique characteristics of OTs and develop customer relationships with internal and external customers

Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree


Additional Qualifications:

Experience with DoD Software Acquisition Pathway

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Job Profile: Systems Security & Network Security Engineer, Associate
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to share your experience in building and maintaining devices and tools safeguarding our nation's most sensitive data? As a systems and network security engineer, you can identify the tools, systems, and applications needed to assess vulnerabilities and recommend the best solution and security strategy. We need your experience to lead the development and implementation of security solutions that will protect infrastructure which enables mission accomplishment.

On our team, you’ll troubleshoot and analyze complex challenges for customers using your knowledge of networks and security tools. You’ll use your curiosity for technology and market trends to further research and develop security solutions.

In this role, you’ll closely impact mission success, protecting data and networks from malicious payloads and actors. With mentoring, challenging hands-on problem-solving, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers.  

Work with us as we secure and protect our nation's most sensitive capabilities.

What You’ll Work On: 

Develop relationships quickly and easily with other teams, communicating the complexities of security with a wide variety of audiences, including senior management. 

Implement infrastructure and cybersecurity controls, including enhanced detection and vulnerability capabilities and improved event correlation in large enterprises.  

Perform risk and vulnerability assessments in network, system, and application areas, and leverage big data analytics and traditional security event types to identify advanced threats or indicators of compromise. 


Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:   

Experience architecting and designing IP networks, including developing and documenting network topologies

Experience troubleshooting and restoring network and system outages

Experience designing and implementing DoD enclaves, including compute storage, networking, routing, switching, firewalls, and end-user devices

Experience implementing Cisco ISE

Experience with STIGs

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

HS diploma or GED

DoD IAT Level II Certification


Nice If You Have:   

Experience deploying Gigamon Appliances and network taps

Experience with Cisco Spine and Leaf network architectures

Knowledge of CSfC Multi-Site Connectivity Capability Package

Knowledge of Cisco Secure Network Analytics or Cisco Nexus Dashboard Insights

Knowledge of building and maintaining SolarWinds NPM and IPAM

Ability to be a self-starter, work without considerable direction, and work with a team

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills, including for coordinating efforts and establishing customer relations

Bachelor's degree

CCNP Certification

Building a modern cloud platform is an exciting and challenging endeavor. It's more than accounts and infrastructure. For customer adoption to be prolific, software appliances need to be developed that onboard, manage, and give visibility to customer resources. That’s why we need you, an experienced modern application engineer who knows how to leverage the best of industry techniques to design and deliver the best possible application solutions.
As a modern application engineer, you’ll use your experience to work with database experts, DevOps engineers, cloud engineers, and other application engineers to help our clients make their existing products intelligent or help them develop brand-new, intelligent solutions. Job Description:
The Opportunity:
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find, interpret, and communicate the most mission-critical data to give their clients the right answers. With the critical decisions made by our military every day, we need an intelligence analyst like you to support our warfighters. As an analyst supporting the Navy, you will use your specialized technical experience and attention to detail to provide actionable intelligence analysis to support real-world operations. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to lead a team of fellow intelligence professionals to support our warfighters.

As an intelligence analyst on our team, you’ll help your client understand their operational landscape and mission environment. Using your comprehensive understanding of various collection platforms and intelligence disciplines, you’ll advise your client on new data sources and tradecraft as your team builds assessments for targeters, warfighters, policymakers, or the IC. Work with us as we provide the right information at the right time to our clients globally.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
4+ years of experience with all-source intelligence analysis, including developing collection plans, risk assessments, and creating all-source intelligence products or briefs
Experience as a component or supporting element to the targeting cycle
Experience with all-source intelligence processes, data evaluation, and analytical tools and databases, including Analyst Notebook, Palantir, RMT, TAC, NCTC, Online, TIDE, DX SIGINT Database, GAP Analytics, and MIST
Knowledge of the intelligence cycle, collection management cycle, targeting cycle, and intelligence analytical techniques, including trend pattern analysis, geospatial analysis, link analysis, and network or social network analysis
Knowledge of internet-based research, including Boolean logic, search engine and database resources, and internet sources such as social media, social networking tools, data exploitation, and commercial and industry-based databases
Ability to work independently with limited oversight, function effectively as part of a team in a joint working environment, and work flexible shifts if needed, including nights, weekends, and holidays
Ability to conduct independent analysis to support mission requirements and use enhanced search procedures and tools to support the use of PAI
TS/SCI clearance
HS diploma or GED

Nice If You Have:
2+ years of experience conducting network analysis in support of attack the network operations, including counter-facilitation
1+ years of experience providing analytical support to one or more SOF units or commands
Experience with advanced search techniques, information databases, data visualization, and related tools, and providing direct analytical support to operations and direct analytical and targeting support to deployed SOF elements
Knowledge of the Skope toolset or Voltron toolset
Knowledge of SIGINT, HUMINT, GEOINT, and geospatial intel tools such as ArcGIS and ISPY
Ability to conduct short-term deployments of less than 120 days, depending on the client’s operational tempo
Bachelor’s degree in International Affairs, Political Science, Foreign Area Studies, National Security Studies, Linguistics, or a related field
Completion of OS301 Basic Open-Source Intelligence Course or equivalent Course

Job Description:
Key Role: 
Provide critical support by leveraging available resources to independently review, draft, and revise contracting and acquisition documentation as well as provide analytical support in researching federal, DoD, and Navy pre-award and post-award contracting procedures and policies. Use interpersonal skills to make sound business judgments to handle multiple activities with a short turnaround time in a dynamic environment. Assist a government client with all aspects of the federal government contracting life cycle, including pre-award acquisition planning, source selection support, and post-award contract administration for complex Naval and DoD software and hardware-intensive systems. Provide advice and guidance on all matters of federal, DoD, and Navy pre- and post-award contracting procedures. Leverage expertise in the development of procurement request (PR) packages, including Acquisition Plans (APs), Acquisition Strategies (AS), Statements of Work (SOWs), Performance Work Statements (PWSs), Source Selection Plans (SSPs), Justification and Approvals (J&As), Determination and Finding (D&F), and the Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL), ensuring adequacy, consistency, and compliance with administrative, regulatory, and procedural requirements. Experience using Microsoft Office Suite tools, including Excel, PowerPoint, or Project 
Knowledge of FAR, DFARS, and DoD 5000 series regulations and laws, executive orders, statutes, policies, principles of acquisition planning, and requirements necessary to accomplish assigned duties
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree

Experience with the DoD and Navy
Experience with Navy contracting procedures and regulations
Experience preparing briefings and reports appropriate for senior government executives
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills, to effectively communicate complex procurement regulations, processes, and procedures

The Opportunity:
Do you have strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset? Are you looking for an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation's leaders? As a network and access discovery analyst, you will use your specialized technical experience to enable cyber space operations and intelligence collection to enable the success of mission owners.
 
As an analyst on our team, you will provide expert analytic support while working alongside the mission owners to tackle complex and challenging problems in computer network analysis, network exploitation, digital network intelligence, dataflow, access development, and target network analysis. Your duties will require you to leverage an understanding of ports, protocols, networking devices, and common exploitation frameworks. This will provide an opportunity to grow your expertise, develop new skills and tradecraft, use and share your methodologies and tool experience with other analysts, and most importantly, be a part of a team conducting offensive cyberspace operations that are crucial to national security.
 
Join us. The world can't wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
When a user tries new software, they expect it to be intuitive and run smoothly. Functionality, reliability, and user experience are key to successful software development—and that means rigorous testing. That’s why we need you, an experienced test engineer who knows how to thoroughly test software and work with developers to make sure our team releases the best software possible.   

As a test engineer on our team, you’ll use your experience to work with cross-functional teams and users to evaluate software developed for our law enforcement team. You’ll create test plans and test cases, based on user stories. Through a deliberate blend of functional and automation testing, you’ll generate data and implement the test cases to observe how the software performs, then document the results and communicate defects to the development team so they can start improving the tool.  

You’ll automate continuous security and performance testing and monitor the health of analytics applications, host platforms, and data. This is an opportunity to supercharge your skills by writing the code to test, creating libraries, and building ground-up frameworks. You’ll also broaden your experience in automation testing, cloud, and enterprise systems, and gain skills in new areas such as automation and cloud computing, while sharing your testing experience with your team.  

Work with us as we develop software solutions to protect our public and internal workforce.

Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have: 
Experience designing and executing test scripts, test plans, and procedures and documenting the expected and actual results

Experience creating and updating automated test cases or scripts

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Critical decisions are made every single day in our government. What if you could use your analytical skills to help support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation's leaders? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. You’ll use your specialized technical, language, regional, and functional experience and your attention to detail to provide your client with the actionable information they need to perform cyberspace operations.

As an analyst on our team, you’ll provide expert analytic support against high-value targets while working alongside your client to tackle complex and challenging problems in target development, social network and metadata analysis, and computer network analysis and exploitation. Using your understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, build effective queries, combine information from disparate sources, and develop strategies to gather more information. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills, share your methodologies with other analysts, and be a part of a team conducting cyberspace operations that are crucial to national security.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable warfighters to achieve their missions, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting and evolving the network systems requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, a network engineer who knows how to deliver satellite communications network needs. 

As a Network Engineer on our team, you’ll use your skills in network design and architecture, system interoperability, problem solving, routing, switching, IPSec or encryption, OS virtualization, and IPv4 and IPv6 networks interfacing SATCOM users to DoD networks and services. You’ll help support the nation’s defense and respond to evolving adversaries as a part of a team charged with developing, upgrading, and sustaining a worldwide satellite communications system and increase security, reliability, and availability for mission-critical network systems. 

You’ll apply your knowledge in routing and switching, network design and architecture as you join our team of problem-solvers to help the DoD evolve and deploy new capabilities and technologies. Your knowledge of network protocols, equipment, emerging technology, and configurations will come in handy as you help optimize client operations and modernization. Using your experience in Cisco, Juniper, and other COTS hardware and network performance management, and your technical curiosity and knowledge of industry standards, you’ll serve as a trusted advisor to clients on mission-critical projects and make an impact on national security missions.

Grow your career with us as we help the DoD field and sustain network satellite communications capabilities to provide data and voice solutions to tactical and strategic users of worldwide network of SATCOM Gateways and Teleports.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have: 

2+ years of experience with IP networking design and troubleshooting

Experience in designing, testing, and implementing network systems

Experience with Cisco switches, routers, and firewalls set up and configuration

Experience with network and firewall troubleshooting and problem-solving

Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs

Knowledge of QoS and Mobility

Knowledge of protocols including IPSec, BGP, 802.1q, IPv6, and Multicast

Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED

Ability to obtain Network+ or Cisco Certified Network Associate Certification (CCNA) within 6 months of hire date


Nice If You Have:

Experience with DoD networks, satellite communications, and radio systems, network design and enterprise security

Experience designing, testing and implementing complex network systems in a DoD environment preferred

Knowledge of SATCOM or IP Modems such as iDirect or Linkway preferred

Ability to initiate, manage, execute, and report tasks independently

Ability to communicate complex network principles and designs to clients

Possession of excellent time management and analytical skills

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Top Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree

Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As a Pricing Analyst, you know the complexities of developing comprehensive and defendable pricing solutions in that can be utilized in price negotiations. DoD acquisition programs require a rigorous assessment of proposed costs to properly evaluate stakeholder costs and necessary resources. That’s why we need you, an experienced pricing analyst who can ensure successful program execution through detailed analytics and effective articulation of pricing strategies to program leadership.

On our team, you’ll provide support to highly technical clients supporting critical U.S. Air Force mission requirements. You’ll collaborate with program stakeholders to develop accurate and defendable pricing strategies to negotiate effective cost solutions.  

The impact of pricing analysis is to ensure programs achieve fiscal responsibility by maintaining budgets and executing cost solutions that benefit the warfighter. At Booz Allen, we recognize that we must continuously grow as a team to bring the best support to our clients, so here you’ll have all the resources to succeed. This is a chance to influence a meaningful mission while expanding your career and skill set. 

Work with us and ensure the Air Force achieves its program mission set through effective pricing strategies that provide the necessary analysis and tools to execute successful contract price negotiations. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience developing and implementing detailed pricing models and strategies that align to client objectives

Experience with DoD contracting processes and regulations

Knowledge of labor and material pricing estimating practices to effectively evaluate cost methodologies and data sources

Knowledge of data analysis tools such as Excel

Ability to coordinate with program stakeholders to adequately develop solicitation documents

Ability to articulate pricing approaches to senior program management and other program stakeholders

Ability to manipulate and evaluate large data sets

Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED and 5+ years of experience in pricing analysis, or Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of experience in pricing analysis


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with data analytics software such as Tableau

Possession of excellent communication skills

Possession of excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

Job Profile: Systems Security & Network Security Engineer, Associate
Locations:
Annapolis Junction, MD

Fort Meade, MD
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to share your Cybersecurity experience to protect and defend critical communications networks? As a systems security and network security engineer, you can become an integral part of our team responsible for developing and implementing effective cybersecurity strategies to enable a vital national security system to operate in compliance with the Department of Defense and other requisite security requirements. We need your experience to lead a team of cybersecurity professionals responsible for securing a global communications network and facilitating its continuous, uninterrupted operation to transport and disseminate data to warfighters globally.  

Our team is seeking a highly skilled, experienced Senior Level Cybersecurity Engineer to join our team supporting an Enterprise-level program management office. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in cybersecurity, with the ability to develop and implement security solutions in alignment with the Department of Defense security strategy.

What You'll Work On:

Implementing security solutions compliant with Department of Defense (DoD), National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), and Risk Management Framework (RMF) directives.

Applying advanced skills and extensive technical expertise to solve complex cybersecurity challenges.

Assessing cybersecurity requirements, developing courses of action, POA&Ms, and proactively engaging clients and cybersecurity stakeholders to implement effective solutions.

Preparing reports to inform and advise senior technical staff and management both orally and in writing.

Consistently coalescing with the systems security engineering team to prioritize and align system hardening activities to mitigate system vulnerabilities.

Leading tasks including planning, execution, staff oversight, and status reporting for an enterprise-level program management office.

Utilizing strong leadership skills and the ability to work independently with minimal direction to work in a client-facing environment and mentor subordinate team members.

Engaging effectively with clients to understand their needs and provide viable cybersecurity solutions.


Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:   

10+ years of experience with information assurance or cybersecurity

Experience serving as an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) or Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM)

Experience with Cybersecurity Assessment and Authorization process to manage and administer authority to operate (ATO) to maintain compliance with DoD, NIST, RMF, and other requirements

Experience utilizing the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) to address security controls, create POA&Ms, and upload artifacts such as STIG checklists or ACAS scans

Experience reviewing vulnerability documentation and developing courses of action to remediate findings

Knowledge of NIST SP 800-53 rev 5 transition requirements and planning of implementation strategies

Ability to collaborate with program management office representatives

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree

CISSP Certification


Nice If You Have:   

Experience with cybersecurity assessments, security design engineering, and continuous threat monitoring

Knowledge of commercial off-the-shelf networking equipment used for satellite communications systems

Knowledge of current or emerging industry standards and best practices in cybersecurity

Ability to decipher system or network designs, protocols, and physical configurations

Ability to conduct onsite security assessments and work cross-functionally with various teams

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you have strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset? Are you looking for an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation's leaders? As a network and access discovery analyst, you will use your specialized technical experience to enable cyber space operations and intelligence collection to enable the success of mission owners.

As an analyst on our team, you will provide expert analytic support while working alongside the mission owners to tackle complex and challenging problems in computer network analysis, network exploitation, digital network intelligence, dataflow, access development, and target network analysis. Your duties will require you to leverage an understanding of ports, protocols, networking devices, and common exploitation frameworks. This will provide an opportunity to grow your expertise, develop new skills and tradecraft, use and share your methodologies and tool experience with other analysts, and most importantly, be a part of a team conducting offensive cyberspace operations that are crucial to national security.

Join us. The world can't wait.

Experience with CNO processes and capabilities
Ability to leverage processes and tools for signals intelligence discovery analysis
Ability to assess network vulnerabilities and identify key network topology
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Experience with programming languages for scripting and automation, including Python or C++

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an Asset Manager for a specialized section within the Command Post Modernization (CPMod) program, you will leverage your expertise to provide comprehensive oversight of the equipment ordering process for this critical initiative. You will manage the lifecycle of mission-critical assets from initial procurement through integration and deployment, ensuring operational readiness and maximum efficiency.

You will develop and maintain robust tracking systems that enhance visibility across your assigned section while serving as the subject matter expert (SME) on the equipment ordering process for all stakeholders. You'll facilitate equipment requests, monitor progress, and proactively resolve issues before they impact mission timelines. You'll coordinate closely with engineers, logisticians, financial analysts, and procurement teams to ensure seamless shipment and delivery of equipment, particularly for time-sensitive integration activities.

Your meticulous attention to detail will be essential as you maintain comprehensive documentation, including purchase orders, invoices, and delivery confirmations, to ensure audit readiness. You'll develop clear, actionable reports on equipment status for various audiences and ensure strict compliance with DoD policies, regulations, and directives. Through your collaborative approach with cross-functional teams, you'll continuously optimize the equipment ordering process to enhance operational efficiency and support the success of the CPMod program.

Join us. The world can't wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in the DoD? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to interpret current capabilities and translate them into measurable test criteria to ensure mission needs are met makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused engineering solution.

As an engineer on our team, you’ll work with Booz Allen colleagues and the U.S. Space Force to develop, rapidly deploy, and integrate the next generation of resilient space, ground, and user capabilities across the space enterprise. Your customer will trust you to not only test, analyze, evaluate, validate, and verify these systems, but also identify areas requiring urgent mitigation up front and early to develop this system with advanced technology solutions. Grow your skills by merging innovative engineering methodologies and cross-disciplinary coordination to create tomorrow’s solutions. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to help solve some of our clients’ most complex problems and find solutions that keep our nation safe. 
As a Domain Analyst, you’ll bring your strategic, tactical, technical, and high combatant command background to collaborate with thought leaders in cyber systems engineering on projects for mission area risk assessments. You’ll use your skills as you research, develop, analyze, assess, plan, and support.

Work with us to help assess an organization's key Cyber terrain, mission system C4 architectures, C4 vulnerability, and Cybersecurity posture information to develop comprehensive knowledge of impacts across the homeland defense mission. Coordinate with defensive Cyber operations analysts and internal and external partners, to analyze and evaluate complex and highly sensitive systems, policies, processes or instrumentation related to foreign threats or homeland defense or security. You will work to determine procedure for solving complex design, integration and analytical problems, and perform or direct scientific and technical intelligence analysis. Additionally, you will report on changes, trends and implications regarding design and integration of evolving systems and instrumentation.

Job Profile: Information Security Risk Specialist, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to government agencies and military organizations. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you. We need your knowledge as an information security risk specialist to help break down complex threats into manageable plans of action.    

You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure their mission-critical infrastructure. This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills.

As a Network and UNIX Cybersecurity Assessor on our team, you will work with the DoD and other federal government organizations to discover their cyber risks, comprehend applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You will get technical, environmental, and personnel details from Security Professionals and Leaders, Systems Administrators, Network Administrators and Engineers, IAMs, and ISSOs to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you will help your team to guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, white papers, and milestones. You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure the client's information systems, assets, and enclaves possess the necessary security measures to ensure their availability, protection, integrity, authentication, confidentiality, and non-repudiation, including monitoring, detection, discovery, and reaction capabilities of internal and external adversaries and ensure a trained and effective IA workforce.

This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills in conducting reviews of enterprises, enclaves, networks, systems and applications, certification and accreditation support, independent evaluation based on national and DoD-level Cybersecurity and IA and Cybersecurity Service requirements, and the procedures and practices as they are implemented by the combatant commands and supporting organizations and agencies, to ensure their adequacy to provide a measurement and training tool to determine the defending force’s readiness and provide a basis for planning and programming needed improvements. Join us as we protect our military’s communications systems and our nation’s cyber infrastructure.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 
Experience with network devices, appliances, firewalls, routers, and various versions of UNIX or LINUX operating systems on information systems (IS), including workstations, servers, laptops, and network devices
Knowledge of DoD STIGs and RMF assessment tools
Ability to consolidate, create, and brief findings based on analysis
Ability to travel up to 85% of the time to CONUS and OCONUS locations
Top Secret clearance
HS diploma or GED
DoD 8570 IAT Level II Certification

Nice If You Have: 
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree
Completion of Security Scanning Courses, including Walk-through Training, Onsite Shadowing, Checkride, or eMASS Course
DoD 8570 IAT Level III Certification
Assessor Program (ACP), UNIX, or Network Vulnerability Assessments Certification

A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable customers to achieve their missions, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network with the right equipment and software requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning.

As a network engineer on our team, you’ll apply your expertise in routing and switching, network design and architecture, system interoperability, IP engineering, network transport layers, multi-protocol label switching, gateway protocol, and virtual routing and forwarding as you join our team of problem-solvers.
  
Join us. The world can’t wait.

Knowledge of access controls, network security, and communication and routing protocols

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you want to use your creativity, problem-solving, and storytelling skills to improve organizational mission performance in the Air Force. You understand there is no single or easy solution to prepare for the unforeseen. By creating and testing real-world scenarios, you know how to help Air Force organizations make faster and smarter decisions based on data.

As an exercise planner on our team, you’ll develop, implement, and measure the effectiveness of plans and procedures for clients, creating rich content using Adobe, Microsoft Office, and other software applications to help you tell a realistic story. You’ll listen to client challenges and identify threats, gaps, or risks that need to be explored and provide a space for recommendations that will make lasting, real-world impact.

As a leader on the Operations Security (OPSEC) Team, you'll have the chance to work cross-functionally with wargame analysts, operations researchers, and senior leaders that are making an impact on critical missions. You’ll share your expertise and collaborate with the industry’s best trainers and coaches through our custom “Train the Trainer” programs like Modeling and Simulation, Wargame, Exercise Design, Military Deception, and Continuity of Operations.

Bring your skills to Booz Allen and discover solutions that will shape the future and help Air Force organizations thrive.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

5+ years of experience with OPSEC planning at the service or joint level in support of operations at Combatant Commands or Joint Task Forces  

5+ years of experience integrating OPSEC into contingency and operations plans and ensuring that OPSEC capabilities are considered in the deliberate and crisis action planning processes

3+ years of experience providing expert mission analysis

Experience reviewing, analyzing, and operationalizing tactical and operational-level OPSEC directives into joint, Air and Space force operations

Knowledge of joint, Air Force and Space Force functions and their relationships to CCMD and JTFs to coordinate OPSEC actions within appropriate channels

TS/SCI clearance  

Bachelor's degree  


Nice If You Have:  

Experience with all aspects of the OPSEC cycle as defined in National Security Presidential Memorandum (NSPM) 28 and The National OPSEC Program

Experience managing an OPSEC program and capability

Experience in developing and accessing tactical and operational level OPSEC plans and orders

Knowledge in joint operational planning process, military decision-making process, military campaign plan planning, targeting processes

Ability to evaluate a military organization’s application of the OPSEC cycle and determine how to improve efficient and effective OPSEC

Possession of analytical, problem-solving, and assessment skills
