Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a Test Engineer on our team, you’ll create comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts for Army systems, which are software used to perform network operations, management, and security tasks for the Army Tactical Network. You’ll support the development and maintenance of Test and Evaluation Master Plans (TEMPs) and Test and Evaluation Strategies (TESs) in accordance with Army test and evaluation guidance, policies, and templates. You'll contribute to government Test and Evaluation (T&E) strategy and master plans for testing communications systems in a laboratory and operationally relevant environment by assisting with the development of Critical Technical Parameters (CTPs), Critical Operational Issues (COI), or Critical Operational Issue Criteria (COICs) from the operational and capability requirements.

You’ll collaborate with Army stakeholders, including network engineers, operators, and cybersecurity specialists, to identify and prioritize testing requirements, and coordinate test resources, including equipment, personnel, and facilities, to support test events and ensure successful test execution. You’ll work with test organizations to support program integration plans and plan and conduct activities associated with members from the user community and the DoD community. Additionally, you’ll identify and maintain relevant metrics for assessing success of test and evaluation, and identify or assess recommended improvements or tools to improve test and evaluation efficiency and effectiveness.

To be successful in this role, you'll need to have a strong understanding of the Army's tactical network architecture and systems. You'll also need to be familiar with the Army's network modernization efforts. Your knowledge of the Army's tactical network will enable you to develop test plans and test cases that are tailored to the unique needs of the Army's network systems and to collaborate effectively with Army stakeholders and developers to ensure that our software meets their requirements.

This is an opportunity to share your skills with a team as they write the code to test. You’ll also broaden your experience in network operations and management, cybersecurity, and cloud-based technologies while exploring new areas such as automated testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery that will benefit you, your team, and your client.

Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have:

10+ years of experience with conducting test and evaluation activities and documenting results

Experience with hardware and software testing to Military Standards or Specifications 

Experience with software test planning and execution, including test design, and test case development covering both functional and non-functional requirements 

Experience with the preparation of strategy, studies, plans, and analyses in support of test outcomes

Experience with communications systems testing and with writing and supporting test plans and summary reports

Knowledge of Army Tactical Networks

Ability to lead root cause analysis and corrective action

Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:

Experience with developmental and operational test, production qualification test, reliability verification test, and waveform standard conformance test

Experience with Army PEO-C3T

Experience employing Agile Test Principles

Experience with Agile test methodologies and tools, including Jira, Eggplant, Scrum, Kanban, or other iterative development frameworks

Experience with network testing and validation tools, including Wireshark, NetFlow, and network simulation or emulation tools

Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or Perl, and with automation frameworks, such as Ansible or Puppet

Knowledge of test automation frameworks and tools

Knowledge of network protocols, architectures, and technologies, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and network routing and switching

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, or Mathematics

CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), ITIL Foundation, Certified Agile Tester (CAT), or similar Certifications

Job Profile: Identity and Access Management Specialist, Associate
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
You know that the user is the last frontier for cybersecurity. It’s where the perimeter is drawn, and securing identities is pivotal in the fight against cybercriminals. As an IAM specialist, you have the skills and experience to keep hackers from taking data and breaking processes. We’re looking for someone like you to help our clients meet their missions without disruption.

As an Identity and Access Management (IAM) specialist at Booz Allen, you’ll play a critical role in the world of IAM and zero trust. In this role, you’ll support large-scale IAM projects for our clients. You’ll interface with stakeholders and engineering teams to delve into the details and dependencies of critical processes and users’ roles within them.

You’ll analyze the identity lifecycle, articulating access requirements and defining enterprise identity records. You’ll use your experience in IAM to design, deploy, and support systems that verify appropriate user privileges and manage credentials for accessing our clients’ most valuable assets. From single sign-on to privileged access systems, you’ll have the chance to implement enterprise-class solutions and stop adversaries in their tracks.

Apply today to help us as we support our nation's security.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

5+ years of experience applying expertise in consultative project management in an IT or cybersecurity environment, including leading teams, schedule management, complex problem resolution, budget management, or performance management

Experience analyzing design documents, business processes, SOP documentation, or user guides to identify areas of improvement and efficiency

Job Profile: Cyber Strategic Planning & Policy Development, Associate
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
When our country’s cyber security is on the line, simply reacting is not enough—we need a plan. And when that plan needs to support cybersecurity for National Security, we need strategic policy development. That’s why we need you, a cyber risk management specialist with the expertise required to analyze the policies that determine our cyber resilience.

As a cyber strategic planning and policy development specialist on our team, you’ll lead the assessment of Intel clients' current cyber policies, the coverage of those policies, and areas of risks. You’ll evaluate how policies stack up to regulations, best practices, and industry standards. As you guide your client through understanding acceptable risk and availability, you’ll advance the development of a strategic cyber roadmap. You’ll work to ensure the client operates securely as they navigate an evolving IT environment. 

Work with us as we secure National Security through strategic cyber policy development. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience with the NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF)

Knowledge of cybersecurity policies and procedures at agency levels

Ability to coordinate with senior leadership and SMEs across the office to ensure cyber requirements, policies, and initiatives meet customer priorities

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:

Experience as an ISSM, ISSO, or ISSE supporting the NIST RMF

Knowledge of technical security requirements and cloud service providers

Ability to articulate technical solutions across wide audiences

Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity or IT

Security+ or CISSP Certification

Job Profile: Software Engineer - Full Stack, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
We're looking for a passionate, full-stack Software Engineer to work with a fast-paced, highly collaborative software development team building and launching capability for enterprise web-based systems in the cybersecurity field. You'll have the opportunity to work on building a web-based SaaS solution automating Cybersecurity Risk Management and Vulnerability or Configuration Monitoring.

You'll be responsible for breaking down use cases, designing, and implementing complex system modules, interfaces, and features. You'll leverage your technical expertise in web technologies, Cloud, and software engineering to modernize and re-factor traditional web application components. You'll develop robust, secure, and performant production-grade software. You’ll use your communication skills to work with a team to build, test, and operate system capabilities.

You should have expertise with full-stack web application development, experience with software design and implementation, and be able to learn new languages, technologies, and codebases quickly. You should be able to work independently while collaborating with a team to review code and solve problems.

Work with us as we build capabilities to change cybersecurity for the better.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have: 

2+ years of experience with object–oriented programming such as C# or Java

2+ years of experience with relational databases in production such as SQL Server or Postgres

2+ years of experience with web development languages, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with frameworks such as jQuery, Vue, or React

Experience with Cloud, such as AWS or Azure

Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree

Experience with RMF or ATO, FedRAMP, and CMMC frameworks

Experience with .NET Core, MVC, and LINQ or Entity Framework

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
Everyone knows security needs to be “baked in” to a system architecture—you actually know how to bake it in. You can identify and implement ways to harden systems and reduce their attack surface. What if you could use your cyber engineering skills to design and develop secure systems for the federal government? We’re looking for an engineer who can create solutions for the federal government that will withstand even the most advanced cyber threats.

As a cybersecurity engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll protect agencies from bad actors. You’ll coordinate work with in-house teams to identify the right mix of tools and techniques to translate your client’s IT needs and future goals into a plan that will enable secure and effective solutions. We need to come up with the best solutions, so you’ll investigate new techniques, break free from the legacy model, and go where the industry is going. You’ll lead the team through a critical approach to network design, providing alternatives and customizing solutions to maintain a balance of security and enterprise needs. 

This is a chance to make a difference in the security of large scale projects. Your technical expertise will be vital as you help customers overcome their most difficult challenges by integrating secure practices like identity and access management and advanced analytics.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

5+ years of experience with applying expertise in consultative project management in an IT environment, including leading teams across a wide variety of IT and non-IT environments, schedule management, complex problem resolution, or performance management

3+ years of experience in supporting enterprise CIAM products solution delivery with Okta, Auth0, Ping Identity, ForgeRock, or IBM

Experience with developing executive briefings on major initiatives, incorporating findings from industry research, and best practices

Experience in interfacing with business clients to understand business needs and requirements, and help develop and maintain the client relationship

Experience with documenting as-is and to-be business process workflows

Experience with functional aspects of the Identity Lifecycle, including Joiner, Mover, and Leaver

Experience with presenting material to senior division, program, and government officials

Experience with analyzing design documents, business processes, SOP documentation, or user guides to identify areas of improvement and efficiency

Public Trust

Bachelor's degree

Master's degree in Management

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. With the critical decisions made in our government every day, we need an intel analyst like you to do just that. As a Collection Requirements Manager, you use your specialized functional experience and your attention to detail to collaborate across the IC to understand intelligence gaps, prioritize information required to close them, and give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to inform our nation’s leaders. 

As an intelligence analyst on our team, you’ll prioritize, establish, and develop collection requirements. You'll be responsible for tracking and managing collection requirements and support collection assessment efforts. Your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure. 

This is a chance to grow your expertise and broaden your skillset into areas like intelligence disciplines and analytical requirements. You’ll share your expertise with other collection managers (CM) through leadership and mentoring. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources to learn new skills and tools.  

Work with us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our policymakers.   

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

3+ years of experience with supporting the IC

Experience with identifying CM access points and methods

Knowledge of CM requirements and intelligence disciplines, including SIGINT, HUMINT, GEOINT, MASINT, or OSINT

Knowledge of how to use available tools to search for trends or anomalies in data 

Ability to develop, plan, and coordinate the deployment of CM systems

Ability to validate, coordinate, issue, adjust, evaluate, and terminate CM programs and initiatives

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have: 

Experience as a multi-intelligence CRM

Experience with MatLab, SPSS, SAS, S-PLUS, or R

Ability to brief senior defense and government officials

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Completion of DoD or IC collection management course

Job Description:
Key Role:
Learn the principles of multiple construction disciplines, including Civil, Architectural, Mechanical, Electrical, and Electronic Engineering. Read and analyze designs and blueprints, recognize the architect’s intended use, and analyze designs and structural complexities intended to mask an ulterior purpose not wanted by the architect. Demonstrate knowledge of technical surveillance countermeasures and construction principles. Communicate in English, and write detailed reports and analyses of problems, findings, and security situations which require staff actions. TS/SCI clearance

Completion of Department of State Construction Surveillance Technician Course SE631

5+ years of experience in construction

Do you want to use your creativity, problem-solving, and storytelling skills to improve organizational mission performance in global defense? You understand there is no single or easy solution to prepare for the unforeseen. By creating and testing real-world scenarios, you know how to help government organizations make faster and smarter decisions based on data.

As an Exercise Planner on our team, you’ll develop, implement, and measure the effectiveness of plans and procedures for clients. You’ll listen to client challenges, identify threats, gaps, or risks that need to be explored, and provide a safe space for recommendations that will make a lasting, real-world impact.

As a leader in the company’s Global Defense, you’ll have the chance to work cross-functionally with wargame analysts, operations researchers, and senior leadership on projects that are making an impact on critical missions. Job Description:
The Opportunity:As an expert in defense missions, your unique background inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to solve some of our clients’ most complex problems—and find solutions that keep our nation safe. 

You'll participate as a military security subject matter expert in the establishment of institutional structures, doctrine, and operational practices for U.S. international Partner Nations to manage U.S. origin-sensitive technology and classified information securely. This includes non-resident advising on security programs that align with U.S. and NATO standards, facilitating organizational design, policy analysis, and workforce training through workshops, formal education, and individualized mentoring. These security programs include information security, industrial security, personnel security, and physical security.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Contract: Defense Security Cooperation University Task Order

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable our partner nations to achieve their missions, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and software, requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, an experienced network engineer who knows how to develop the exact network our partner nations need. 

As a network engineer on our team, you’ll use your experience in network design and architecture, system interoperability, OSI model, network transport layers, multi-protocol label switching, gateway protocol, virtual routing and forwarding to support the nation’s defense and respond to evolving adversaries. You’ll upgrade enterprise-wide infrastructure, troubleshoot and resolve complex network issues, analyze current working infrastructures, and increase security, reliability, and availability for mission-critical network systems.  

You’ll apply your expertise in routing and switching, integration of encryption gear, network design and architecture, system interoperability, IP engineering, network transport layers, multi-protocol label switching, gateway protocol, virtual routing, and forwarding as you join our team of problem-solvers to help our partner nations.

Your knowledge of network protocols, equipment, emerging technology, and configurations will come in handy as you optimize client operations and modernization. Using your experience in Cryptographic equipment, cryptography, key management, software and hardware firewalls, Cisco hardware, Palo Alto firewalls, cloud migration, optical infrastructure networking, virtual routing and forwarding, you’ll serve as a trusted advisor to clients on mission-critical projects. Using your technical curiosity and knowledge of industry standards, you’ll make an impact on national security missions.  

Further your career with us as we help the DoD's mission of Security Cooperation 
 
Join us. The world can’t wait. 
  
You Have: 

5+ years of experience with Network Engineering in the Navy or DoD

3+ years of experience in network design and operations 

2+ years of experience with Network management tools

Experience working OCONUS in security cooperation efforts 

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree in an Engineering or Computer Science field 

CompTIA NetWork+ or CompTIA Security+ Certification

 
Nice If You Have: 

3+ years of experience as an engineer supporting C4I systems

3+ years of experience with NAVWAR mission products

Experience interacting with US and foreign senior military or government officials

Master's degree in an Engineering field

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a defense mission professional, you ask questions others don’t. You understand the nuances of complex situations. You use your skills to think bigger and push further, solving complex problems. We’re looking for someone like you to help create solutions for missions that keep our nation safe. 

As a Naval Unmanned Systems Training Specialist, you will bring your naval training background and expertise to work on fleet introduction and training acquisition projects for the Department of the Navy. You’ll help coordinate the delivery of new systems to the fleet, including installation of training capability to our Navy schoolhouses. You will research and assess the naval environment and apply that expertise to support the delivery of naval unmanned systems capabilities into the U.S. Navy, focusing on coordinating training events that enable Sailors to operate and maintain the systems properly. You will be a trusted advisor to our clients and will help identify, analyze, and evaluate complex systems, policies, and processes to ensure the clients have the best readiness in the unmanned systems assigned missions. You will be a key team member shaping the vision for unmanned systems training delivery to the fleet, developing inputs on training policy. You will prepare regular reports for incorporation into the Program Office and fleet leadership briefings.

You’ll impact the work we do for the Navy and the solutions we deliver for military missions. Your critical thinking will deliver the best training capability for our fleet. Help us ensure fleet readiness delivers across the forefront of weapon and sensor system evolution to meet the ever-changing operational needs of the US Navy's missions. This position is located in San Diego, CA.

You served as an Unmanned Systems professional - Grow your career with us as you help solve complex design, integration, and analytical problems on mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  
7+ years of experience in Navy leadership such as a Navy Chief Petty Officer or Navy Officer, or in leadership in the Defense industry as a Government Civilian or contractor
2+ years of experience in unmanned systems training, planning, administration, or managing employment
Ability to travel to CONUS and OCONUS locations up to 25% of the time
Secret clearance
HS diploma or GED

Experience with the launch and recovery of U.S. Navy small boats and associated safety requirements

Job Profile: Information Security Risk Specialist, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to the global enterprise, and government agencies. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you. We need your knowledge as an information security risk specialist to help break down complex threats into manageable plans of action. 

As an information security risk specialist on our team, you’ll work with specific enterprises, and military leaders to discover their cyber risks, understand applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You’ll get technical, environmental, and personnel details from SMEs, and engineers to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you’ll help your team guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, white papers, and milestones. 

You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure their intellectual property, critical infrastructure, and mission-critical systems. This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills in DoD Cybersecurity.

Work with us as we protect our military’s communications systems.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 
4+ years of experience with Navy RMF, following both NAO and FAO requirements
Experience as an Information Systems Security Manager, Information Systems Security Engineer, Information Systems Security Officer, RMF Support Analyst, or Information Security Risk Specialist
Experience assisting with the development of supporting artifacts for DoD authorization packages, including Categorization Forms, HW/SW Lists, Authorization Boundary Diagrams, and developing test answers for controls
Experience with the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS), and eMASSTER
Experience in utilizing STIG Viewer to check .ckl files and reading Nessus vulnerability reports
Experience creating and managing POA&Ms and running Navy compliance reports. 
Secret clearance
Bachelor’s degree 
CGRC/CAP, CASP+, CCSP, Cloud+, SSCP, or Security+ certification

Nice If You Have: 
Experience in setting up and running ACAS
Master’s degree
Active Navy Qualified Validator Certification

Supervisory Organization: Supervisory Organization (Jennifer Edmonds | Jennifer Walsh Edmonds (506033))
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to Department of Defense (DoD) agencies and related components. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) like you who will break down complex threats into manageable plans of action. 

As an ISSO on our team, you will use your experience to work with government stakeholders and a cloud-based application and platform development team to identify cyber risks, understand applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You’ll review technical, environmental, and personnel details from security engineers, platform and application developers, and enterprise architects to assess the entire threat landscape. You will coordinate with product delivery teams to ensure their products meet DoD cybersecurity standards and support a larger cyber team to collectively guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, documentation, and milestones.

You will work with your client to translate security concepts, so they can make the best decisions to secure cloud infrastructure, artificial intelligence (AI) solutions, containerized applications, CI/CD application pipelines, and sensitive data repositories. You will conduct risk assessments, considering data confidentiality, integrity, and availability. You will be involved in organized Incident Response actions, such as guiding and reporting back to key stakeholders. You will support the team in meeting authorization timelines and coordinating communications with external entities in support of that objective.

This is your opportunity to act as an information security subject matter expert while broadening your skills in AWS, AI or ML, containerization, CI/CD, Agile development, DevSecOps, risk management, and data security. Work with us as we protect the DoD's critical analytic capabilities.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

5+ years of experience implementing risk management methodologies contained in best practice documentation such as NIST SP 800-30, SP 800-53, SP 800-128, SP 800-160, SP 800-171, or CIS benchmarks, in support of system security configurations, practices, and oversight

3+ years of experience providing cybersecurity leadership in an ISSO capacity, interfacing with internal and external SMEs, such as PMs, Cyber Assessors, and AOs

Experience with control implementations associated with RMF, FedRAMP, ICD 503, and DoD Information Levels, including applying them to the design and implementation of IT solutions to achieve system authorizations

Experience implementing and maintaining security controls within AWS cloud, containerized, CI/CD pipeline, and Agile development environments

Experience developing and reviewing ATO authorization packages in Xacta or eMASS

Experience analyzing compliance and vulnerability scan results and implementing appropriate mitigations

Experience performing audit log reviews to detect anomalous behavior in information systems and networks, and overseeing continuous monitoring activities

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

Bachelor’s degree

CGRC/CAP, CASP+, CCSP, Cloud+, SSCP, Security+, or GSEC certification


Nice If You Have: 

Experience with DoD security technical implementation guides (STIGs), checklists, and testing tools, including STIG Viewer, SCAP, and ACAS scanning tools

Experience with cyber related tools such as Ansible, Terraform, Splunk, or STIG Viewer

Ability to work through challenging security requirements to maintain compliance

Possession of excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills

Possession of excellent organizational skills

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor’s degree in IT, Cybersecurity, Data Science, Information Systems, or CS

DoD 8570 IAT III or IAM III level Certification such as CISSP Certification

AWS Solutions Architect or Certified Security - Specialty Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an expert in operational planning, your unique skill set inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to help solve some of our clients’ most complex problems—and find solutions that keep our nation safe.

As a Special Operations Forces (SOF) Operational Planner, you’ll bring your expertise on emergent SOF capabilities and training and force modernization background to collaborate with thought leaders in the Force Protection community on the integration of urgent and emergent capabilities into Army formations to include Counter Small Unmanned Aircraft System, Electronic Warfare and Cyber solutions. You’ll use your skills as you ensure urgent and emergent equities are represented in command level briefings, documents, and guidance, and perform internal and external coordination on SOF issues. Assist a U.S. Army client with analyzing and understanding capability gaps from UAS threats. Prepare recommendations to the client regarding materiel and non-materiel solutions to close gaps. Engage in the development of documents that address C-UAS capabilities and emergent sUAS threats. Assist with integrating theater-specific training requirements and coordinate with operational commands, force providers and partner nations regarding C-sUAS, EW and Cyber training, equipment and resourcing. Produce reports, information papers, briefings and other products for command leadership on sUAS threats, C-UAS, EW and Force Modernization to include materiel and non-materiel solutions. Your ability to navigate Army Staff functions and unit training plans while coordinating with internal and external training stakeholders will enhance Force Protection and Readiness of Soldiers and units. Work with us to help the command to protect United States Servicemembers, their families, and our partners and allies.

You served your country as a Service Member—now, continue your mission with us. Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

8+ years of experience working with the U.S. military as a senior NCO or Officer

Experience working and briefing in a two- or three-star staff billet

Experience providing mission and business recommendations on operational and headquarters functions

Experience providing policy recommendations using scientific research and technical analysis

Secret clearance

Bachelor’s degree 

Graduate of a Senior NCO course, Captain’s Career Course, or higher-level military education  


Nice If You Have:  

6+ years experience in United States Special Operations Forces

Experience working on Cyber, Electronic Warfare, Force Modernization or C-UAS programs or activities

Master’s degree

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
The leader in this role will define, establish, and lead Go-To-Market (GTM) execution for Booz Allen’s leading edge product innovation. You bring experience and passion for understanding technology product-market fit to create and execute GTM programs across marketing, sales, and ecosystem partnerships. As the functional leader, you will get to work end-to-end to activate the company’s existing operations internally as well as sales and partnership channels externally.  In this role, you will define and drive GTM strategy and execution across product marketing, sales, and ecosystem partnerships while ensuring successful market entry, adoption, and revenue growth. You will identify gaps and facilitate enablement plans and engage with leadership to assess strengths, capabilities, and market positioning, tailor GTM ensuring alignment with business objectives, and develop an execution plan aimed at driving revenue. This role is responsible for translating market opportunity into action by owning product launch planning, enablement programs, and ongoing funnel optimization. You’ll use data to guide decisions, surface insights, and continuously refine GTM strategy to maximize business impact. Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required.

Ready to build the future of shared delivery for the better?

How You’ll Contribute:

Define and lead the end-to-end GTM strategy for new and existing product lines, including product market segmentation, positioning, launch planning, and execution. 

Drive cross company sector alignment across sales, product, marketing, and customer success to ensure consistent messaging and operational efficiency.

Build and execute GTM plans that support sector pipeline development, accelerate time-to-revenue, and drive customer acquisition.

Develop and maintain customer segmentation, ICPs, and competitive positioning frameworks.

Collaborate with sectors to influence roadmap and ensure market-fit through feedback loops. 

Partner with marketing to craft compelling messaging and enable multi-channel campaigns.

Identify, build, and manage key technology and channel partnerships.

Own key GTM metrics and reporting, including pipeline growth, funnel conversion, win or loss insights, and partner-influenced revenue.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

10+ years of experience driving Go-To-Market strategy and execution across technology product technical sales, business development, or product marketing

Experience in successfully growing business to business (B2B) technology product sales in a late-stage startup or mid-size or large enterprise environment

Experience working across CxO to product team levels internally and with customers  

Experience building and driving technology and channel partnerships

Experience using data-driven techniques for technology go-to-market

Bachelor's degree in a Marketing, Computer Science, or Business field 


Nice If You Have:

Experience with sales operations, including incentive compensation, quota, and discounts 

Experience owning complex product launches and go-to-market execution across multiple customer segments 

Experience working with U.S. government mission customers 

Possession of excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills

As a Joint Operation Planner, you’ll bring your military planning expertise to work on projects supporting national defense and military capability development and employment. Washington, DC
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to share your experience in designing, developing, and implementing innovative network security solutions to support our country and protect our nation? As a systems security and network security engineer, you will be responsible for the enterprise deployment of the Gigamon Deep Observability Pipeline and GigaVUE Fabric Manager. We need your experience to oversee the development and implementation of Gigamon and network security solutions to deliver deep observability into all network traffic and improve the enterprise security posture.

On our team, you’ll supervise a team as they troubleshoot and analyze complex challenges for customers using your knowledge of GigaVUE HC-3 and GigaVUE T-10 packet broker solutions and GigaVUE HD series for large-scale network monitoring. You’ll manage the research of new technologies and market trends to further develop and refine security solutions.

In this role, you'll closely impact mission success, protecting data and networks from malicious payloads and actors. With mentoring, challenging hands-on problem-solving, and opportunities to learn new tools and skills, we focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers.

Work with us as we secure and protect our nation's most sensitive capabilities.

What You’ll Work On: 

Develop relationships quickly and easily with other teams, communicating the complexities of security with a wide variety of audiences, including senior management. 

Manage infrastructure and cybersecurity controls, including enhanced detection and vulnerability capabilities and improved event correlation in large enterprises.  

Lead risk and vulnerability assessments in network, system, and application areas, and leverage big data analytics and traditional security event types to identify advanced threats or indicators of compromise. 


Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:

Experience architecting and designing IP networks, including developing and documenting network topologies

Experience troubleshooting and restoring network and system outages

Experience designing and implementing DoD enclaves, including compute storage, networking, routing, switching, firewalls, and end-user devices

Experience deploying Gigamon appliances and network taps

Knowledge of multi-domain architectures, including data center, WAN, and LAN in virtualized architectures

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

HS diploma or GED and 12+ years of experience supporting IT projects and activities, Associate’s degree and 10+ years of experience supporting IT projects and activities, Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of experience supporting IT projects and activities, or Master’s degree and 6+ years of experience supporting IT projects and activities

DoD 8570 IAT Level II Certification, including Security+ CE, CCNA-Security, GSEC, SSCP, CySA+, GICSP, or CND Certification

Ability to obtain a DoD 8570 Cybersecurity Service Provider - Infrastructure Support Certification, including CEH, CySA+, GICSP, SSCP, CHFI, CFR, Cloud+, or CND Certification, within 30 days of start date

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a fighter aircraft depot analyst, you know that effective depot-level maintenance and activation depend on clear communication, streamlined processes, and proactive decision-making. In this role, you’ll identify and exploit commercial best practices and digital technologies to streamline depot maintenance activation and execution. You’ll leverage opportunities for depot-level process improvements by identifying gaps and developing associated improvement plans. 
 
On our team, you’ll conduct technical research and analysis and provide recommendations on required facilities, equipment, materials, processes, technologies, training, and personnel to perform fighter aircraft and systems component depot-level maintenance and support depot activations. You’ll also support facility and infrastructure surveys and assessments, perform gap analyses, and support design reviews associated with facility modification or new construction projects. You’ll process, coordinate, and enable the execution of scheduled work packages, maintenance requests, pre- and post-docks, and certificates of incorporation and completion. You’ll facilitate a knowledge exchange of opportunities, challenges, successes, and lessons learned for global depot facilities. 

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:

Experience analyzing, reviewing, and generating clear and concise programmatic documentation, briefings, and communications

Experience with process improvement methodologies and tools

Experience working with Microsoft (MS) Office Suite

Knowledge of aircraft maintenance data, statistics, scheduling techniques, and supply chain analysis

Ability to work collaboratively across multiple functional areas

Ability to ensure all outputs meet quality standards, integrating technical inputs, as necessary

Ability to travel CONUS and OCONUS up to 25% of the time

Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED and 10+ years of experience with program management or life cycle logistics, or Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Business Administration, Mathematics, or Engineering, and 5+ years of experience with program management or life cycle logistics

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. With the critical decisions made in our government every day, we need an intel analyst like you to do just that. As a Collection Requirements Manager (CRM), you use your specialized functional experience and your attention to detail to collaborate across the IC to understand intelligence gaps, prioritize information required to close them, and give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to lead efforts to inform our nation’s leaders. 

Using your comprehensive understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll prioritize, establish, and develop collection requirements. You'll be responsible for tracking and managing collection requirements, and support collection assessment efforts. Your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure.  

This is a chance to broaden your skillset into areas like intelligence disciplines and analytic requirements. You’ll share your expertise with other collection managers through leadership and mentoring. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to help your clients meet their toughest analytic challenges.  

Work with us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our policymakers.   

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

Experience with identifying appropriate CM access points and methods

Knowledge of CM requirements and intelligence disciplines, including SIGINT, HUMINT, GEOINT, MASINT, or OSINT

Knowledge of how to use available tools to search for trends or anomalies in data

Ability to develop, plan, and coordinate the deployment of CM systems

Ability to validate, coordinate, issue, adjust, evaluate and terminate CM programs and initiatives

Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam

The Opportunity:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced senior Identity Systems Engineer to join our team. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining identity and access management (IAM) systems across our organization with a focus on secure military environments and cloud capabilities.

What You’ll Work On: 

Design, implement, and maintain identity and access management (IAM) systems, including authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) protocols.

Implement identity management strategies and policies to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices, including those related to secure military environments and cloud computing.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy IAM solutions that meet business requirements and security standards, including those related to classified networks and systems.

Conduct risk assessments and vulnerability testing to identify and mitigate potential security threats to identity systems.

Develop and maintain documentation for IAM systems, including system architecture, configuration, and troubleshooting guides.

Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in the IAM space and make recommendations for future system enhancements and upgrades.

Collaborate with security teams to ensure that IAM systems are aligned with organizational security policies and procedures, including those related to secure military environments and cloud computing.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Critical decisions are made every single day in our government. What if you could use your skills to help them make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As a Sanctions Economics Analyst, you use your specialized technical and functional expertise, and your attention to detail to develop insights, understanding, recommendations, and reports to give your client the actionable information and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to protect our national security and inform our nation's leaders.
 
As a Sanctions Economics Analyst on our team, you will leverage your understanding of international money laundering, threat finance, sanctions evasion, corruption, kleptocracy, and other illicit finance typologies to guide our clients’ assessment of the impact and effectiveness of economic sanctions programs. You will evaluate proposed strategies, develop economic impact assessment and data analysis processes, and contribute to assessments to communicate the potential impacts of financial and trade sanctions to senior policymakers. To provide valuable economic impact insights, you will build economic models, identify appropriate government and non-government datasets, run statistical analyses, and serve as a subject matter expert on the economic impacts of financial and trade sanctions. You will also engage with government and private sector stakeholders, collaborate with Federal agencies, and work alongside fellow economists, Federal government attorneys, and senior client leadership to understand unique perspectives and communicate your specialized expertise. 
 
As the authority in your area of expertise, your client will look to you for critical expertise in critical areas impacting the safety and stability of the U.S. financial system. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in data analytics, research and analysis, analytical writing, briefing senior decision makers, share your methodologies with peers, and work throughout the interagency environment to address illicit finance risks to the United States. 
 
We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you will have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our nation’s leaders and policymakers.
 
Join us. The world can't wait.
 
You Have:

4+ years of experience with economic analysis, sanctions assessment, or illicit finance policy

Experience conducting economic and financial analysis of the implications of potential financial or trade sanctions

Experience in the areas of policy modeling and applied economic statistics

Knowledge of sanctions and economic foreign policy

Knowledge of economics and policy analysis

Knowledge of the fields of economics, including regulatory economics, financial institutions, and financial markets

Ability to analyze and interpret complex information from various data sources

Ability to conceive, develop, and oversee the production of a variety of sensitive, high-quality written products, including guidelines and comments on proposed policies, programs, regulations, issues, and analyses

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor’s degree


Nice If You Have:

Experience with financial data, analytical, statistical, or data visualization software, such as Bloomberg Professional Services, Hayer Analytics, Microsoft Excel VBA, Tableau, SAS, Stata, R, or Python

Experience with producing written analytical papers, legal briefs, or regulation and rulemaking drafts

Experience with sanctions or financial regulatory investigations, implementation, or policy

Experience with working in an interagency environment

Experience with the financial services industry, including compliance, asset and wealth management, securities, or banking operations

Knowledge of cryptocurrency and blockchain policy issues, including functions of blockchain transactions, and intersections of cryptocurrency and financial crime

Ability to work as a high-performing individual in a supportive team environment

Ability to manage multiple, complex projects with minimal need for supervision

Master’s degree

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
To achieve an organization’s mission, leaders need strong team members who can create processes, leverage scientific expertise, communicate requirements, and evaluate innovative R&D throughout the execution of the mission. Whether using computational modeling to identify a solution, leveraging knowledge of AI/ML, or flexing to support an immerging requirement, our clients need someone who can help advise clients on R&D related to biological immunology. That is why we need you, an experienced Systems Immunology Technical Expert who can analyze every aspect of your customer's operations and provide high-quality support.

As part of our team, you'll serve as a Systems Immunology Technical Expert to the Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health (ARPA-H), helping conceptualize, create, and execute advanced government-funded research and development programs to accelerate better health outcomes for everyone. Work with world-class scientists and engineers to support the development of high-impact solutions to society's most challenging health problems. Leverage technical expertise to provide strategic assessments of new technologies in support to senior ARPA-H decision makers. Maintain responsibility for producing and presenting findings and recommendations to a team of colleagues and clients on the feasibility and potential impact of future research programs, assisting with the management of current programs, and facilitating commercialization of successfully developed technologies. 

You'll serve as a Systems Immunology Technical Expert helping clients to understand R&D, develop stakeholder management strategies, establish new business processes, and complete research and analysis to determine viable solutions. You will be responsible for managing incoming requirements and leveraging advanced scientific expertise to drive large-scale biological R&D. Your attention to detail, flexibility, communication skills, understanding of the client's mission, and problem-solving will enable the mission's success.

What You’ll Work On:

Provide subject matter expertise on the state of systems immunology concepts and technologies

Provide insights on conceptual and technical soundness of programmatic goals in the context of assessment and modulation of the immune and inflammatory response

Assist with setting goals, expectations, and budgets for projects involving area of expertise

Help in review and oversight of performance of funded projects in area of expertise

Assist with briefing materials and documents

Interact with clients, government officials, and other executives in various sectors


This position is a Hybrid role with Booz Allen. Candidate is expected to work on-site at a Booz Allen or Client Facility 20-50% of your time, as needed.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience working in a professional environment

Experience in systems immunology

Experience in computational modeling, or ML and AI

Experience with budgeting and program management

Experience interacting and communicating with senior-level executives, including SES or GS-15

Experience using Microsoft Office, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

Ability to operate independently within a fast-paced start-up environment

Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or Suitability/Fitness determination based on client requirements

Doctorate degree in Biology, Computational Biology, Immunology, or a Science field


Nice If You Have:

Experience in a deadline-driven environment, such as ARPA, preferred

Experience with U.S. government health organizations

Ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities

Ability to manage multiple short- and long-term projects effectively

Ability to pay strict attention to details and diligent adherence to deadlines and deliverables

Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Critical decisions are made every single day in our government. What if you could use your analytical skills to help them make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As an intelligence analyst, you’ll use your specialized technical, language, regional, functional, or military experience and attention to detail to develop analytic assessments to give your clients the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters and protect our national security.

As an All- Source Intelligence Analyst on our team, you’ll help your client understand their mission and various topics of interest. Using your understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, build effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources, including SIGINT, GEOINT, OSINT, and others. You’ll validate information and apply client tradecraft as you build assessments for IC-wide intelligence products. As the authority on your topic, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in intelligence analysis, and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our warfighters. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

3+ years of experience with intelligence analysis

Experience with analyzing data from multiple intelligence sources

TS/SCI clearance

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:

1+ year of experience writing long-form finished intelligence products

Experience with open-source intelligence tools and resources

Knowledge of acquisition or supply chain analysis

Knowledge of link analysis, analyst notebook, or related program

Knowledge of adversary air threat systems

Knowledge of PACOM Area of Responsibility

​Bachelor's degree

Job Posting: AWS, Cloud DevOps, and Infrastructure Engineer
Job Requisition: R0219111 AWS, Cloud DevOps, and Infrastructure Engineer (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:As a DevOps engineer, you know how to set up cloud environments and provision computer networking, storage, and virtual networks—ultimately, how to “harness the cloud.” We’re looking for an experienced DevOps infrastructure engineer like you to support our clients as they modernize their IT infrastructures and meet their most challenging missions. 

As a DevOps infrastructure engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll work closely with cloud architects and engineers to manage server configuration for modern cloud solutions. You’ll apply your skills within a DevOps framework to establish or provision virtual machines or networks and use cloud service providers to further your clients’ meaningful missions. 

With access to our internal innovative labs, there’s no better place to further your skills and explore different ways of solving our clients’ challenges. Whether helping to develop, deploy, or manage IT infrastructures for crucial server and network components, here, you’ll have the latest tech and brightest teammates at your fingertips.

Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have:

5+ years of experience in the development of tools and processes to drive DevOps or DevSecOps maturity by automating builds, regression testing, monitoring, and pushing releases across environments

1+ years of experience troubleshooting, triaging, and resolving issues related to CI/CD pipeline failures or slowness 

Experience developing enterprise cloud-native solutions 

Experience provisioning computer networking and storage and setting up servers that the platform is on, including virtual machines or networks

Experience creating solutions to complex problems within a collaborative team environment

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of experience in DevOps, or 8+ years of experience in DevOps in lieu of a degree


Nice If You Have:

Experience developing enterprise cloud-native solutions involving Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Jenkins, or Azure

Experience writing scripts using tools such as Python, Bash, or Boto3

Experience with automated testing frameworks

Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code

Experience creating and improving continuous automation across multiple technical stacks

Experience triaging and resolving issues related to both open source and commercial tools in public cloud environments

Security Engineering or Cyber Engineering Certification

AWS, Azure, or GCP Certification


Clearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Everyone is trying to “harness the cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a DevOps engineer, you’re eager to develop, manage, and secure a container platform that meets your client’s needs and takes advantage of cloud capabilities. We need you to develop container management software to solve some of our clients’ toughest challenges.  As a senior platform DevOps engineer at Booz Allen, you can use your technical skills to affect mission-forward change. On our team, you’ll hone your skills using the latest cloud technologies as you look for ways to improve your client’s environment with current container software to ensure seamless orchestration. Using your DevOps platform experience, you’ll support your team as you inform strategy and design while ensuring standards are met throughout the containerization process.

You’ll recommend resources that will help your client manage and securely adopt containers. Additionally, you’ll continue to strengthen your DevOps skills while supporting the development of critical cloud platforms.   

Work with us to use cloud platform technology for good.

Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have:

5+ years of experience with supporting operations and maintenance for secure DoD information management systems

3+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure

Experience with infrastructure as code using Bicep and Terraform

Experience with Windows and Linux Operating Systems

Experience with scripting languages, including Powershell, Bash, and managing code using repositories or processes such as Azure DevOps, GitOps, GitLab, or GitHub

Experience hardening government systems following STIG requirements

Experience with the Windows Active Directory and Entra

Secret clearance 

HS diploma or GED

Ability to obtain DoD 8570 or 8140 IAT Level II Baseline Certification within 30 days of start date

You know that true progress is made at the intersection of business and tech, and as an Change Manager and Requirements Analyst, you can develop your skills in both. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with an Agile team as they develop digital products to support your clients’ most pressing missions. We’re looking for someone like you to help propel change management and business processes forward, as well as delve into technology trends to deliver user-friendly client experiences.  

As an Change Manager and Requirements Analyst, you’ll work to develop change management assets. Working with your team of engineers and testers, alongside user experience specialists, you’ll identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories. You’ll understand the overall direction and nuanced user needs clearly, and you’ll guide your team as they fulfill these needs by creating deployable features. Together, you’ll deliver high business value products to the DoD.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As a professional in shared services, you have the experience and skills to ensure our Delivery Hub operations are effective, efficient, timely, and valuable for internal and external clients. You know how to interface with internal and external customers and leadership to understand needs and gain insight on shared services performance.  

You will be providing support for escalated Help Desk tickets from employees and vendors within the response service level agreement, updates tickets daily with complete notes, and ensures tickets are resolved to the customer’s satisfaction before it is closed. Educate and provide policy guidance on all inquiries. Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required.

How You’ll Contribute: 

Provide front-line customer service and support to employees and managers, troubleshooting to analyze, isolate, and solve problems and issues.   

Perform administrative and transactional activities, including processing life-cycle transactions like employee data changes, status changes, compensation, and separations. 

Utilize key customer care technologies, such as telephony and case management, to accurately capture and resolve employee and manager inquiries or determine if escalated support is required. 

Answers vendor questions in support of the work required to be accomplished. 

Educate inquiring employees about tools, policies and processes for the organization, so that they are better informed on how to handle their inquiry more independently. 

Ensure sensitive information remains confidential and protects personal information when processing all transactions and addressing employee inquiries, in line with the organization's data privacy requirements. 

Ensure compliance with departmental practices and applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations. 

Utilize a knowledge base to answer questions, resolve issues, and complete transactions.  

Update and correct knowledge articles as appropriate. 


Ready to build the future of shared delivery for the better?  

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

2+ years of experience in customer service

Experience with using Microsoft Office programs, including Word, Excel, and Outlook

Ability to work independently and multitask through to completion

Ability to build strong relationships with COE partners as well as the business sectors to improve delivery

HS diploma or GED

Job Profile: Cyber Strategic Planning & Policy Development, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
When our country’s cybersecurity is on the line, simply reacting is not enough—we need a plan. And when that plan needs to protect the DoD's enterprise, we need strategic development. That’s why we need you, a data specialist with the skills to analyze the policies that determine our cyber resilience.

As a cyber strategic planning and development specialist on our team, you’ll assess DoD CIO's current cyber policies, the coverage of those policies, and areas of risks. You’ll evaluate how policies stack up to regulations, best practices, and industry standards. As you guide your client through understanding acceptable risk and availability, you’ll work on the development of a strategic cyber roadmap. You’ll work with the client to help them operate securely as they navigate an evolving IT environment. 

Work with us as we protect the client’s IT enterprise through strategic cyber policy. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Experience with data and metrics analysis

Knowledge of the Department of Defense and its components

The Opportunity: 
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable our clients to achieve their missions, but how can an organization make sure its network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and software, requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, a network engineer who knows how to develop the exact network the DoD needs.

As a network engineer on our team, you’ll use your skills to help support the nation’s defense and respond to evolving adversaries. You’ll upgrade or develop enterprise-wide infrastructure, troubleshoot and resolve complex network issues, analyze current working infrastructures, or increase security, reliability, and availability for mission-critical network systems. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

3+ years of experience providing comprehensive systems and network engineering and architectural planning services

3+ years of experience establishing portal or web services with design of medium to large enterprise farms, geographical replication, interfacing with external data sources, and integration of third-party add-ons

3+ years of experience providing data storage with SANs, NAS technologies, iSCSI, and DAS

Knowledge of enterprise data, voice, and video networks

Ability to perform disaster recovery, backup and restore, monitor PKI or certificate authority, and provide CRM

Ability to support efforts for cybersecurity technology, risk identification, and risk mitigation strategies related to cybersecurity, and A&A support documentation in accordance with DoD and IC directives

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelors degree

Job Requisition: R0219137 Oracle EPM Cloud Team Lead (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced senior Oracle EPM Cloud Team Lead to join our team supporting critical financial systems. The ideal candidate will bring deep technical expertise in Oracle EPM Cloud solutions, including Planning, FCCS, or ARCS, strong leadership experience, and a proven track record of successful delivery within federal or defense environments.

This is a strategic leadership role that requires not only technical excellence, but also the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, lead cross-functional teams, and ensure solutions are compliant with government regulations and business objectives. Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required.

What You’ll Work On:

Lead the design, development, and deployment of Oracle EPM Cloud applications such as Planning, Financial Consolidation and Close, or Account Reconciliation.

Manage a team of developers, analysts, and consultants through full project lifecycles, including scoping, design, configuration, testing, deployment, and support.

Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to translate complex financial requirements into scalable EPM solutions.

Provide expert-level guidance on data integration, metadata management, and automation strategies.

Ensure compliance with government standards such as FAR or CAS, security protocols, and audit requirements.

Drive process improvements and recommend EPM best practices to enhance financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting capabilities.

Support change management and user training activities for successful adoption of new systems and processes.


Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:   

8+ years of experience in Oracle EPM or Hyperion implementations

3+ years of experience in a leadership or team lead role

Experience delivering solutions in federal or defense environments

Experience with Oracle EPM Cloud modules, including Planning, FCCS, or ARCS

Experience with Smart View, Data Management, and EPM Automate

Knowledge of financial planning and analysis (FP&A), forecasting, and close or reporting processes

Knowledge of federal financial compliance requirements, indirect rate structures, and project accounting

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Information Systems


Nice If You Have:   

Experience with Agile methodologies

Experience with tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or other BI platforms

Experience with Databricks or similar Datalake technologies

Experience with Deltek Costpoint or similar ERP systems

Possession of excellent communication, stakeholder management, and team leadership skills

Master’s degree

Oracle EPM Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity: As an expert in defense missions, your unique background inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to solve some of our clients’ most complex problems—and find solutions that keep our nation safe. 

As a Partner Naval Capabilities Planner, you will be responsible for optimizing and assessing naval capabilities development in collaboration with foreign naval partners. This role requires a deep understanding of naval operations, advanced planning techniques, and the integration of cutting-edge technologies to enhance joint operational effectiveness.

What You’ll Work On:

Develop and implement comprehensive naval capability development plans, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and operational requirements.

Conduct detailed analysis of current and emerging naval capabilities, identifying gaps and opportunities for enhancement.

Lead the integration of advanced naval systems, including warheads, sensors, and communication technologies, to ensure seamless interoperability with partner nations' naval forces.

Evaluate and incorporate technological advancements to enhance joint operational capabilities.

Conduct rigorous assessments of partner nations' naval capabilities utilizing advanced modeling and simulation tools and provide recommendations for capability improvements and strategic investments to enhance joint force lethality and operational readiness.

Collaborate with partner nations' naval planners to coordinate and execute joint exercises and training programs.

Develop detailed exercise plans, including event-specific schedules, assessment criteria, and post-event analysis to identify lessons learned and areas for improvement.

Produce high-quality technical documentation, including capability development roadmaps, technical guides, and assessment reports, and ensure all documentation is accurate, comprehensive, and aligned with operational standards.

Engage with key stakeholders, including senior military leaders, technical experts, and partner nation representatives, to ensure effective communication and collaboration.

Present technical findings and recommendations to broad audiences, including high-level decision-makers.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

8+ years of experience as a U.S. Navy officer with tactical and operational planning

Knowledge of naval systems and technologies, including warheads, sensors, and communication systems

Knowledge of emerging operating concepts and capabilities, as well as multiple mission areas

Knowledge of using advanced modeling and simulation tools for capability assessment

Ability to conduct detailed technical assessments and produce high-quality written products

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have:  

Experience serving on a numbered fleet, major staff, or in a Warfighting Development Center

Experience in Maritime Domain Awareness, Surface Warfare, Joint Fires, or Mining Operations

Knowledge of USINDOPACOM policy and strategy, including TCP and TCO, GCPs, OPLANs, CONPLANs, and Theater Security Cooperation Plans, including linkages to parallel national interests

Knowledge of Eastern Asian culture

Ability to communicate in an Eastern Asian language

Possession of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance

Master's degree

Joint Professional Military Education (JPME) Certification

Warfare Tactics Instructor (WTI) Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
Security threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to our clients. In today's world, how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is a Program Protection Specialist like you who will break down complex threats into manageable plans of action. 

As a Program Protection Specialist on our team, you’ll use your experience to work with operational and security SMEs to discover their risks, understand policies, and draft program protection plan artifacts. You’ll review technical, environmental, and personnel details from SMEs to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you’ll guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, whitepapers, and written deliverables.

You’ll work with your client to translate security concepts, so they can make the best decisions to secure the security of their programs. This is your opportunity to act as a program security subject matter expert while broadening your skills in information technology and telecommunications. 

Work with us as we protect the most sophisticated global enterprises for our clients. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Critical decisions are made every single day in our government. What if you could use your analytical skills to help them make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As an intelligence analyst, you’ll use your specialized technical, language, regional, functional, or military experience and attention to detail to develop analytic assessments to give your clients the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters and protect our national security.

As an All- Source Intelligence Analyst on our team, you’ll help your client understand their mission and various topics of interest. Using your understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, build effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources, including SIGINT, GEOINT, OSINT, and others. You’ll validate information and apply client tradecraft as you build assessments for IC-wide intelligence products. As the authority on your topic, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in intelligence analysis, and share your methodologies with other analysts. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our warfighters. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

3+ years of experience with intelligence analysis, including in the space area

Experience with analyzing data from multiple intelligence sources

TS/SCI clearance

HS diploma or GED

As a Strategic Communications Lead on our team, you’ll develop creative solutions to complex problems.
