Job Description:
The Opportunity:
A well-designed voice network is critical to move information, connect decision-makers, and enable the Air Force to achieve its missions. But how can an organization make sure its voice communications will meet current and future mission needs? Crafting the right VoIP solution with the right equipment and software requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, an experienced VoIP engineer who knows how to design, secure, and optimize the voice systems the Air Force depends on.

As a VoIP Engineer on our team, you’ll use your experience with the implementation of VoIP services, STEP or Teleport SATCOM operations, configuration of Palo Alto Firewalls, and implementation and functionality of security devices, switches, and routers of different vendors. You will be working as part of a team across three sites to configure, design, document, administer, and troubleshoot all aspects of classified and unclassified VoIP services, including troubleshooting network issues, configuring Palo Alto Firewalls, working with SATCOM systems, and providing cybersecurity support. You’ll upgrade and modernize enterprise voice infrastructures, troubleshoot and resolve complex VoIP issues, analyze existing systems for performance and security gaps, and increase the reliability, resiliency, and availability of mission-critical communications.

Your knowledge of VoIP systems, call signaling protocols, cybersecurity for voice services, emerging telecommunication technologies, and network configurations will be vital as you drive modernization and operational excellence. As a trusted advisor, you will be responsible for architecting and implementing the VoIP infrastructure, as well as ongoing management of it, in-depth knowledge of Cisco Call Manager or Cisco Technologies, understanding of LAN, WAN, or SATCOM networking and how VoIP relies on it, Cisco Call Manager (CUCM), Cisco Voice Gateways, SIP Trunking, expert knowledge of Cisco IP telephony solutions, designing or maintaining VoIP architecture, installing VoIP hardware, and troubleshooting voice issues. With your technical acumen, problem-solving mindset, and passion for innovation, you’ll help ensure resilient, secure, and seamless communications that directly impact national security missions.

This role requires shift work to provide 24/7 operations spread across three sites to support the tactical user including configuring SIP trunks and firewalls for tactical user access as outlined by the SAR or GAR process.

You will be responsible for the installation and configuration of network and VoIP equipment consisting of Call Managers, Palo Alto Firewalls, switches and routers, and the installation of software, including CUCM, vSphere, and others, as required. You will monitor mission operations to ensure there are no voice issues with the tactical user. When required, you will troubleshoot hardware or software malfunctions on routers, switches, firewalls, and servers. You will deploy and support the hosted resources on the deployed system, including virtualized compute (VMs). You’ll install Operating System firmware, software, patches, and upgrades and provide Systems Administrator (SA) support to VoIP system operational databases, software configuration control, and system interface for the VoIP system. You’ll develop and implement a change management process to handle system updates, modifications, and enhancements and maintain a detailed configuration management database (CMDB) to track all assets, changes, and configurations. You will perform security assessment reports and risk mitigation plans, as well as documentation of applied security patches and updates.

Further your career with us as we help the Air Force provide mission critical tactical voice services.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

Experience implementing secure solutions

Experience working with vSphere and call manager operating systems

Knowledge of security best practices, including security protocols, authentication, and authorization

Knowledge of operating systems, including Windows and Linux

Knowledge of networking concepts, including routing, switching, and network security

Ability to design a VoIP network, install the VoIP network, configure the VoIP network, and operate and maintain the VoIP network

Ability to configure Palo Alto Firewalls

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree and 2+ years of experience with VoIP, or 5+ years of experience with VoIP in lieu of a degree

DoD 8570 IAT Level II Certification such as Security+ with CE or CCNA Voice Certification


Nice If You Have:

Experience interpreting detailed installation instructions and supporting documentation to facilitate VoIP equipment implementation

Experience working with tactical users interfacing a DoD STEP or TELEPORT facility

Experience developing and implementing change management processes

Ability to validate, update, and maintain accurate records

Ability to interface at multiple levels and successfully present technical information

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Possession of excellent attention to detail and adherence to rigid guidelines and processes

CCNP Collaboration Certification

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
Doing DevSecOps well means development and automation. Making tasks repeatable and efficient across multiple environments requires infrastructure as code, scripting, and sometimes writing applications. Our cloud service broker team is looking for a Developer with a good understanding of Microsoft Azure cloud infrastructure, containerization, and networking to make new cloud capabilities available in secure environments.

In this role, you’ll make a mission-forward impact as you further your skill set and career. Work with us as we shape the next generation of DoD systems.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

7+ years of experience building software solutions using Azure in a secure environment

1+ years of experience implementing Infrastructure as Code using Terraform

Experience designing and automating the provisioning of cloud resources and infrastructure as code tools

Experience with Platform as a Service technologies

Experience deploying and working with Azure Landing Zones

Experience in assisting with implementing and developing Azure policies

Knowledge of network technologies, including DNS, load balancing, and TLS

Top Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED and 8+ years of experience with software engineering, or Bachelor's degree and 4+ years of experience with software engineering

Ability to obtain a DoD 8570 or 8140 IAT Level II Certification within 30 days of hire date


Nice If You Have:  

Experience with disaster recovery services and concepts

Experience with AWS

Experience with Azure Sentinel, Microsoft security, and Azure services Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, and Cloud Networking

Experience with containerization, including Kubernetes 

Experience deploying and managing Azure Virtual Desktop using Infrastructure as Code

Experience with RedHat Enterprise Linux and command-line interfaces, including Bash

Experience configuring Windows clients and servers, including Active Directory or Group Policies

Experience with Git and GitLab

TS/SCI clearance

Azure Architect Expert Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Critical decisions are made every single day in our government. What if you could use your analytical skills to help them make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As an intelligence professional, you’ll use your specialized experience and attention to detail to develop reports, analytic assessments, and briefing products to give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to provide critical intelligence support to inform key decisions that support our national security objectives.

As a Biothreats Technical Targeter on our team, you’ll help your client understand the complex biological threat capabilities of our adversaries. Using your comprehensive understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, build effective queries, develop target networks, and combine information from disparate sources to identify potential leads. As the authority on biological technologies and capabilities, your client will look to you for key intelligence insights, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise and broaden your skill set into areas like strategic intelligence production, biological developments, adversarial threat capabilities, and analytic methodologies. You’ll share your expertise with other analysts through leadership and mentoring. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources to learn new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our warfighters and national intelligence priorities.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

6+ years of experience with open-source intelligence research, collection management, HUMINT, SIGINT, or MASINT targeting

2+ years of experience with biological research topics, biothreat research, and analysis or research and analysis in life sciences

Knowledge of the intelligence cycle and tradecraft

Ability to comprehend complex biological research topics, create intelligence products, and brief findings to customers

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor’s degree


Nice If You Have: 

5+ years of experience with open-source intelligence or HUMINT targeting applied against life science topical areas

Experience with data science or quantitative analysis techniques

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph


Clearance: 
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As an expert in training integration, your unique skill set inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to help solve some of our clients’ most complex problems and find solutions that keep our nation safe.

As a Counter-Unmanned Aircraft Systems (C-UAS) Training Integrator, you’ll bring your expertise on emergent C-UAS capabilities, training, and force modernization to collaborate with thought leaders on the integration of urgent and emergent C-UAS capabilities into Army formations. You’ll use your skills as you assist with the planning and operation of Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UASs) in support of individual and collective training to counter the emergent threat presented by these platforms. You will play an integral role in developing training scenarios and UAS threat injects and assisting with the planning of these within the framework of Army Flight regulations. Your ability to navigate aviation requirements and unit training plans while coordinating with internal and external training stakeholders will enhance Force Protection and Readiness of soldiers and units.Work with us to help the command to protect United States service members, their families, and our partners and allies. You served your country as a service member, now continue your mission with us. Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:   

Experience in working with the U.S. military as an NCO or Officer

Experience as a military Group 1-3 Small UAS Operator

Experience with DoD Air Planning

Experience with C-UAS or Electromagnetic Warfare

Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:   

Experience with Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) UAS

Experience with UAS training integration at Corps and Division Echelons

Bachelor's degree

Completion of sUAS Master Trainer or Army Aviation Center of Excellence (ACoE) UAS Instructor Operator (IO) Course

Job Description:
The Opportunity: As a cyber professional, you know that understanding adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures is vital to producing the intel that enables the success of the DoD. At Booz Allen, you can apply your skills and knowledge to inform strategies and help mitigate the most pressing vulnerabilities. Here, you aren’t just deciphering reports. You’re telling the story to play a part in informing our nation’s most far-reaching cyber security decisions. 

As a cyber threat specialist on our team, you’ll be trusted to help customers solve problems using the latest software like Remedy, Splunk, and Office Automation. Using penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, risk assessments, and threat monitoring, you’ll work with multiple stakeholders to evaluate risk and make meaningful recommendations. You’ll help monitor security environments and identify security gaps through the eyes of an adversary. 

Booz Allen is committed to creating an environment where you can grow your cyber career through mentoring, the opportunity to leverage new resources, and the ability to gain in-demand certifications to sharpen your skill set. With opportunities supporting both the private and public sectors across multiple geographies, your career is only limited by your own appetite for exploration. 

Work with us to secure our systems, networks, and crucial infrastructures. 

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

3+ years of experience as a Cyber Threat Analyst in a Government Environment

Experience with Splunk, Remedy, and Office Automation tools

Ability to perform work independently in a fast-paced environment

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree in Cyber Security

IAT Level II Certification

CSSP Analyst or CSSP Incident Responder Certification


Nice If You Have:  

Masters degree

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As a data scientist, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data scientist at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors—from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence—we need you to help find the answers in the data. 

On our team, you’ll use your analytical skills and data science knowledge to create real-world impact. You’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop algorithms and systems and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to help clients make informed decisions. Ultimately, you’ll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used.  

Work with us as we use data science for good.  

Join us. The world can’t wait.  

You Have:   

2+ years of experience with data exploration, data cleaning, data analysis, data visualization, or data mining 

2+ years of experience with statistical and general-purpose programming languages for data analysis 

Experience with analyzing structured and unstructured data sources  

Experience with briefing senior DoD leadership on technical deliveries

Experience in working independently, including with the entire analytics development process

Knowledge of Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or Natural Language Processing  

Knowledge of Advana

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor’s degree 


Nice If You Have:   

2+ years of experience in the development of algorithms leveraging R, Python, or SQL and NoSQL 

2+ years of experience with Distributed data or computing tools, including MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, EMR, Kafka, Spark, Gurobi, or MySQL 

Experience with Palantir Products


Clearance: 
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Understanding networks at the enterprise level is key to enabling proper penetration testing and evaluation of said network. As a network engineer and analyst on our team, you’ll work closely with your mission partner to help them understand various types and layouts of enterprise networks, perform solutions analyses, and analyze the design of an enterprise migration and implementation plan for data centers, remote access connections, cross-domain solutions, network ports, protocols, and services configurations.

You’ll collaborate with SMEs in cybersecurity, penetration testing, and operations to help the mission partner with reaching their strategic goals and identifying operational needs that will shape mission partner success.

Join us. The world can't wait. 

You Have: 

6+ years of experience with the design, research, and development of network solutions 

Experience assessing network configuration faults and working with team members to remedy the problems 

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph 

Bachelor’s degree

Experience with SDN technologies and vendors, including SD-WAN, NSX-T, Cisco, Juniper, and open-source solutions 

Experience with AWS Cloud implementation, migration, and integration 

Master's degree

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
At a certain point, experience-based system design can start to look like clairvoyance. When you’ve developed so many systems that you can not only orchestrate the best solution for any technology-based challenge, but you can also anticipate and preempt future issues, you’re a solutions architect. You’ve evolved your skills into strategy through a long path of software development accomplishments and the curiosity to understand how all the pieces of an IT ecosystem fit together. Are you ready to use your combination of knowledge, skill, and experience to take on the toughest challenges in law enforcement?

As a solution architect on our team, you'll translate your customer’s IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting future state architecture. Through your leadership, we’ll help transform the way law enforcement uses technology including cloud migration, integrating advanced technology, and modernizing legacy systems. And, what do you do next in a career where you’ve reached this level? You mentor the next set of developers to help them grow into tomorrow’s solutions architects. As a technical leader, you’ll shape the digital solutions business and identify opportunities for growth. 

Work with us and build the future of technology in law enforcement for the better. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Requisition: R0219219 Governance and Working Group Coordinator (Open)
Job Profile: Cyber Strategic Planning & Policy Development, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
When our country’s cyber security is on the line, simply reacting is not enough—we need a plan. And when that plan needs to protect the DoD's enterprise information technology, we need strategic policy development. That’s why we need you, a Governance and Working Group Coordinator specialist with the skills to analyze the policies that determine our cyber resilience.

As a cyber strategic planning and policy specialist on our team, you’ll assist in evaluating DoD current cyber policies, the coverage of those policies, and areas of risks. You’ll evaluate how policies stack up to regulations, best practices, and industry standards. As you guide your client through understanding acceptable risk and availability, you’ll work on the development of a strategic cyber roadmap. You’ll work with the client to help them operate securely as they navigate an evolving IT environment. 

Work with us as we protect the DoD's information technology through strategic cyber policy development. 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

Experience in coordinating across cross functional groups and lead stakeholder meetings

Knowledge of the Department of Defense and its components

Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and best practices

Knowledge of threat and user activity monitoring practices and applications

Ability to translate technology, intelligence, or cybersecurity information into enterprise-level reports and strategy documents

TS/SCI clearance

Bachelor's degree and 10+ years of experience with cybersecurity or Information Technology matters, or 14+ years of experience with cybersecurity or Information Technology matters in lieu of a degree


Nice If You Have:

Experience within the DoD at a senior-level office or Joint Command

Experience in overseeing a cybersecurity focused-team, project, or work effort

Knowledge of Zero Trust principles and their applications

Knowledge of CATMS or a similar task management system to direct tasking across a broad organization

Ability to conduct required research and coordination to represent leadership intent and interests

Possession of excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills to communicate with executives and C-suite equivalence

Job Posting: Human Spaceflight Test and Verification Engineer
Job Requisition: R0219233 Human Spaceflight Test and Verification Engineer (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in human spaceflight? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer focused engineering solution.
 
As a test and verification or systems engineer on our team, you have the chance to shape systems by contributing to test and verification activities across multiple system and sub-system teams throughout development. On our team, you’ll be able to grow your skills by merging spaceflight system knowledge and systems test engineering to create solutions to some of the most complex engineering and integration challenges in human spaceflight. 
 
Our current opportunity is providing surge support as a Test and Verification Engineer. In this role, you use your knowledge of test and verification activities to flesh out details of test cases and events, incorporating input from requirement owners and subsystem leads. You will elevate issues that require input from Senior Leadership to resolve. After the surge support, we anticipate the role to extend, permanently transitioning into integrating the test cases and events further through the T&V lifecycle, ultimately participating in the testing itself. You will create the future of human spaceflight.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:

3+ years of experience with either systems or test engineering

Experience with test and verification activities on complex engineering systems, including writing or running test cases or events

Ability to communicate effectively with Subject Matter Experts and incorporate their feedback into test and verification documents

Ability to work collaboratively and resolve issues with multiple customers and stakeholders

Bachelor's degree in Systems Engineering or Engineering field


Nice If You Have:

Experience with commercial human space flight programs

Knowledge of common Space Vehicle Systems, including Extra Vehicular Activity, Environmental and Life Support, Thermal Systems, Structures, Avionics, and Power Systems

Job Posting: Information Security and System Authorization Specialist
Job Requisition: R0219201 Information Security and System Authorization Specialist (Open)
Job Profile: Information Security Risk Specialist, Lead Associate
Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
Cyber threats are everywhere, and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to Department of Defense organizations. In all of this “cyber noise,” how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you, a lead information security risk specialist who can break down complex threats into manageable plans of action. 

As an information security risk specialist on our team, you’ll advise military leaders and Air Force system teams, leading the discovery of their cyber risks, understanding applicable policies, and developing a mitigation plan. You’ll oversee the analysis of technical, environmental, and personnel details from cybersecurity professionals, cloud engineers, governance teams, and subject matter experts as your team reviews the entire threat landscape. Then, you’ll guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, white papers, and milestones. 

Your client will rely on you to translate security concepts so they can make the best decisions to secure their mission critical systems. This is your opportunity to take a leadership role in information security while sharing your skills in cloud security, system authorization, and system modernization with both your clients and your team. 

Work with us as we protect our critical Air Force systems. 

Join us. The world can't wait.
 
You Have: 

10+ years of experience supporting cyber assessment and authorization determination for Air Force systems

8+ years of experience supporting the implementation of RMF in a DoD environment, including assessments and recommendations

Experience evaluating security controls for cloud environments, including AWS 

Experience working with Air Force cybersecurity management tools, including eMASS

Knowledge of DoD portfolio management tools, including ITIPS

Ability to provide subject matter expertise for system and portfolio modernization evaluations

Top Secret clearance

Master's degree in Technology, Computer Science, or Cyber Security

 
Nice If You Have: 

Experience working with data analytics tools, including Python

Experience utilizing requirements management tools, including Jira

Experience supporting Air Force technical evaluations and analysis for alternative assessments

Experience providing data security subject matter expertise 

 
Clearance: 
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Warnings about cyber threats are everywhere and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to government agencies and law enforcement. In all of this “cyber noise”, how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you–build your knowledge as an Information Security Risk Specialist who knows how to break down complex threats into manageable plans of action.

As an Information Security Risk Specialist on our team, you’ll work with engineering and cybersecurity specialists as well as client leadership to discover their cyber risks, understand applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You’ll get technical, environmental, and personnel details from SMEs and engineers to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you’ll help your team guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, whitepapers, and milestones. You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure their mission-critical systems, what tools to use, and how to improve the security of the SOC. This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills by being immersed in the technical aspects of securing the network. Join us as we protect this client’s cybersecurity enterprise environment.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience in a cybersecurity role

Experience with providing operational security guidance and information system validation using the National Institute of Standards and Technology Risk Management Framework and local security policies for application infrastructure

Experience with Authority to Operate package development

Knowledge of Cloud-based infrastructure and DevSecOps principles and practices

Ability to operate security tools, including Tenable Nessus, SecurityCenter, IBM Guardium, HP WebInspect, or Network Mapper

Top Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED and 11+ years of experience with Information Technology, or Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of experience with Information Technology


Nice If You Have:

Knowledge of security controls and monitoring in container-based environments

Knowledge of Cloud-based networking

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you have strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset? Are you looking for an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our nation's leaders? As a Network Exploitation Analyst, you will use your specialized technical experience to support cyberspace operations and intelligence collection to enable the success of mission owners.

As a Network Exploitation Analyst on our team, you will provide expert analytic support while working alongside the mission owners to tackle complex and challenging problems in computer network analysis, network exploitation, digital network intelligence, dataflow, access development, and target network analysis. Your duties will require you to leverage an understanding of ports, protocols, networking devices, and common exploitation frameworks. This will provide an opportunity to grow your expertise, develop new skills and tradecraft, use and share your methodologies and tool experience with other analysts, and most importantly, be a part of a team conducting offensive cyberspace operations that are crucial to national security.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:

Experience with encryption techniques, routing, and network infrastructure

Experience with CNO processes and capabilities

Ability to leverage processes and tools for signals intelligence discovery analysis

Job Profile: User Support and Operations Specialist, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
Key Role:
Performs a variety of services in support of End Users or Missions for the various components and commands residing at the locations assigned and as directed by leadership. Manages and provides day-to-day support for End User Devices that provide local or remote access, whether using wired or wireless connectivity. Provides troubleshooting and resolving technical issues. Conducts application and data migration necessary as a result of a hardware or software IMAC or re-installation. Troubleshoots and repairs software and network connectivity issues. Build, configure, and test IT equipment in accordance with applicable standard hardware configurations, software images, procedures, and specific requirements. Plan, engineer, coordinate, install, or manage equipment installations. Recommend upgrades to and replacements in accordance with policies and procedures. Integrate, test, and verify VDI client hardware and software.

Basic Qualifications:
3+ years of experience troubleshooting IT hardware, software, and VDI client hardware and software
Experience using Remedy for receiving, documenting, and closing tickets
Knowledge of SCCM, McAfee, InTune, Forescout, Tiviolo, or Hypori
Ability to oversee and guide junior technicians in day-to-day duties
TS/SCI clearance
HS diploma or GED and 8+ years of experience as a PC Technician, or Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) field and 3+ years of experience as a PC Technician
DoD IAT Level II Certification

Additional Qualifications:
Experience working in a government environment
Possession of excellent customer service skills

Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Your combination of people skills and system administrator knowledge makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. What if you could use those skills to improve the technology supporting our client? We’re looking for a system administrator who has a background in analyzing, troubleshooting, and resolving system issues to help us maintain system continuity with our client.

As a system administrator on our team, you’ll ensure the current infrastructure is functional and available. You’ll help clients overcome tough challenges through monitoring and performance management. Your knowledge will be vital as you identify problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission-critical network. Your communication skills will come in handy as you turn metrics into information and articulate their meaning.  

This is an opportunity to gain experience in operations and maintenance of systems. We focus on growing as a team, so we’ll share techniques, work through challenges, and develop new methodologies together. Work with us and resolve daily challenges as we improve warfighter communications.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

1+ years of experience with system administration

1+ years of experience with analyzing, troubleshooting, and resolving system hardware, software, and networking issues

Experience performing system backups and recovery

Job Requisition: R0219178 Web Applications Automated Test Engineer (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
When a user tries new software, they expect it to be intuitive and run smoothly. Functionality, reliability, and user experience are key to successful software development—and that means rigorous testing. That’s why we need you, a knowledgeable Test Engineer who knows how to thoroughly test software and work with developers to make sure our team releases the best software possible.

As a Test Engineer on our team, you’ll work with testers, developers, analysts, and CMs to evaluate software developed for the client. You’ll work on creating a test plan with test cases based on user stories. Using both automated and manual processes, you’ll generate data and implement the test cases to observe how the software performs, then document the results and communicate defects to the development team so they can start improving the tool. You’ll automate continuous security and performance testing and monitor the health of the client’s system.

This is an opportunity to leverage your skills by writing the code to test. You’ll also further your experience in cloud-based platforms and explore new areas as we migrate the client’s program.

Work with us as we develop brand new features and capabilities.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

3+ years of experience with writing software tests and conducting testing in a professional work environment

1+ year of experience testing web UIs with support from an automated test framework, including Cypress

Knowledge of evaluating, testing, and validating of assigned applications, and the development of solutions to resolve problems

Ability to review application documentation for correctness, adhere to the design concept and user standards, track problems and provide updates to designated management, and prepare milestone status reports

TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:

Experience with software development using common programming languages and frameworks, including Node.js, Angular, Java, and Python

Experience with developing performance test scripts and scenarios using industry tools, including JMeter

Ability to manage discrepancies identified during testing and collaborate with the software development team to resolve software bugs 

Ability to set testing schedules and provide progress or status to project management and client stakeholders 

  
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI  clearance with polygraph is required.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
With all the information available today, it takes a skilled intelligence analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. With the critical decisions made in the military every day, we need an intel analyst like you to do just that. As an All-Source Fusion Analyst, you use your specialized technical experience and your attention to detail to develop reports and give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters. 

As an All-Source Fusion Analyst on our team, you’ll help your client provide Ground Domain Multi-INT Certified Fusion analysis and production to improve pattern-of-life analysis, identify intelligence gaps, and increase accuracy, speed, and synchronization of targeting efforts. You'll manage Ground Domain operations focused on a future space, air, maritime, and threat environment. You will produce, coordinate, review, validate, and support fused intelligence using designated systems to support Priority Intelligence Requirements (PIRs) and Requests for Information (RFIs). Using your understanding of various collection platforms, you’ll explore new data sources, build effective queries, and combine information from disparate sources, including SIGINT, GEOINT, OSINT, and open source. You’ll validate information and apply client tradecraft as you build assessments for warfighters. As the authority on your topic, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure.

This is a chance to grow your expertise and broaden your skill set into areas like warfighting, databases, AI, and military. You’ll share your expertise with other analysts through leadership and mentoring. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources to learn new skills and tools. 

Work with us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our warfighters.    

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 

5+ years of experience with intelligence analysis, U.S. government all-source analytic production, or specialized intelligence analysis training as an Army 35F or branch equivalent at a Service Component Command, Combatant Command, or national-level intelligence agency

Experience with intelligence writing and ICD 203 analytic tradecraft standards

Experience with INDOPACOM intelligence problem sets, including working with Asian nations order of battle and ground domain awareness

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and deadlines

Ability to work effectively in a team environment

Ability to provide shift work support

TS/SCI clearance

HS diploma or GED and 11+ years of experience in a professional work environment, Associate’s degree and 9+ years of experience in a professional work environment, or Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of experience in a professional work environment


Nice If You Have: 

Experience working in or coordinating with operational intelligence centers

Experience with Ground Domain Multi-INT Fusion products in support of pattern-of-life analysis, identify intelligence gaps, or targeting

Experience with intelligence software, including Palantir, Analyst's Notebook, or related tools

Experience working with multiple intelligence disciplines, including HUMINT, IMINT, GEOINT, SIGINT, or OSINT, and the data and tools these disciplines use

Possession of excellent organizational skills, including updating tracking mechanisms, compiling analytic reports, and responding to tasks, and attention to detail with a focus on accuracy and precision in analytical products

Possession of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills

Possession of excellent creative and critical-thinking skills

The Opportunity:
As an acquisition management professional, you’re eager to support both sides of the acquisition and contracts lifecycle in your clients’ missions. We’re looking for someone like you to be a liaison to the government. Bring your passion to support pre- and post-award federal contracts and improve the processes that defend our nation. 

As a Business Operations Lead at Booz Allen, you’ll work with our defense clients in support of the warfighter, aiding in the acquisition of all they need for optimal end strength and ensuring that their mission is our mission. You’ll grow your acquisition expertise regarding all statutory, regulatory, and policy updates impacting each project’s success. Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your technical skills with big picture thinking to make an impact in human spaceflight? You understand your customer’s environment and how to develop the right systems for their mission. Your ability to translate real-world needs into technical specifications makes you an integral part of delivering a customer focused engineering solution.

As a test and verification or systems engineer on our team, you have the chance to shape systems by contributing to test and verification activities across multiple system and sub-system teams throughout development. On our team, you’ll be able to grow your skills by merging spaceflight system knowledge and systems test engineering to create solutions to some of the most complex engineering and integration challenges in human spaceflight.

Our current opportunity is providing surge support as a Test and Verification Engineer. In this role, you use your knowledge of test and verification activities to flesh out details of test cases and events, incorporating input from requirement owners and subsystem leads. You will elevate issues that require input from Senior Leadership to resolve. After the surge support, we anticipate the role to extend, permanently transitioning into integrating the test cases and events further through the T&V lifecycle, ultimately participating in the testing itself. You will create the future of human spaceflight.

Join us. The world can't wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Do you want to design tools that help decision-makers act faster and smarter? As a UI/UX Developer on our team, you’ll create intuitive, mission-focused interfaces and dashboards that bring data to life. You’ll combine your understanding of user needs, data visualization, and digital workflows to design experiences that are both impactful and easy to use.

You’ll work closely with intelligence analysts, developers, and mission stakeholders to prototype, test, and refine visualizations and applications that support real-world decision-making. Whether you’re wireframing new interfaces, building dashboards in ESRI or Tableau, or styling pages with CSS, your design thinking and technical skills will ensure users can focus on insight—not on navigating clunky systems.

You’ll be part of a cross-functional team committed to delivering meaningful digital products that support national security. Sound like you? Let’s build something better, together.

Join us. The world can't wait.

5+ years of experience designing intuitive user interfaces, workflows, or data visualizations to support mission operations or decision-making

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable the Navy to achieve its missions, but how can an organization make sure its network will fit its current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and software, requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That’s why we need you, an experienced network engineer who knows how to develop the exact network the Navy needs.
 
As a network engineer on our team, you’ll use your F5 network engineering experience to support the nation’s defense and respond to evolving adversaries. You’ll operate and maintain the F5 BIG-IP platform and increase security, reliability, and availability for mission-critical network systems.  
 
You’ll apply your F5 network expertise as you join our team of problem-solvers to perform TMOS version management, patching, vulnerability remediation, and bug fix implementation. Continuously evaluated performance and delivered recommendations to support lifecycle strategy, stability, and capacity planning.
 
Your knowledge of BIG-IP platforms will come in handy as you optimize client operations and modernization. Using your Network Engineering experience, you’ll serve as a trusted advisor to clients on mission-critical projects. Using your technical curiosity and knowledge of industry standards, you’ll make an impact on national security missions.  
   
Join us. The world can’t wait. 
  
You Have: 

Experience with F5 application delivery and Cisco Technologies

Knowledge of network design and engineering

Ability to translate business requirements into F5-based technical solutions

Secret clearance 

Associate's degree

Security+ Certification

 
Nice If You Have: 

Experience with LAN and WAN administration 

Knowledge of network incident response, troubleshooting, and life cycle replacement 

Ability to work with vendors, service providers, internal teams, and mission partners to expedite complex troubleshooting processes

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a Fire Protection Engineer, you’ll serve as a subject matter expert on fire protection and life safety issues affecting government facilities. You’ll review design and other technical documents for construction activities and operations to ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards. You’ll identify optimal fire protection solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity. You’ll conduct inspections of construction to validate compliance of fire protection and life safety aspects.

What You’ll Work On: 

Review planning, programming, architectural, and engineering design documents and other technical documents for proposed construction activities.

Review and conduct comprehensive fire safety audits, inspections, and investigations of company operations to ensure compliance with fire protections codes and standards.

Conduct inspections of new construction and renovations to validate compliance of fire protection and life safety aspects.

Witness acceptance testing and commissioning of fire protection systems and equipment to validate functional compliance.

Assist with corporate fire protection governance and policy, standard operating procedures, and facility design standards.

Attend professional meetings within the government to benchmark how industry and other government agencies are addressing similar issues. 

Prepare internal briefings, fact sheets, newsletter articles, and other communications of fire protection and life safety topics and support data collection and metrics development.

Contribute to the company records and knowledge management activities.


Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have: 

3+ years of experience in the fire protection field

Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Bachelor’s degree in Fire Protection Engineering

Ability to obtain a Professional Engineer (PE) License before start date


Nice If You Have: 

Experience in the fire protection aspects of facility design, construction, and commissioning, including egress, passive fire protection, fire alarm, and fire suppression systems

Experience with the Unified Facilities Criteria, the International Building Code, and the NFPA Codes and Standards, including NFPA 1, 13, 70, 72, 75, and 10

Experience in architectural, civil, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering disciplines to evaluate and critique coordinated integration of fire protection concepts into large facilities projects

Ability to travel to domestic and international locations

Possession of excellent customer service skills

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Graduate of a Fire Protection Engineering (ABET-EAC) Program

Completion of the fire protection engineering written examination administered by the National Council of Examiners for Engineering and Surveying (NCEES)

Registered PE License

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Do you want to use your analysis skills to help the Navy get the most out of its funding? When it comes to considering the costs of building and maintaining systems, you know there is more to it than parts and labor. That's why we need you, a cost analyst who can turn requirements into a complete financial understanding for the Navy.

As a cost analyst on our team, you'll translate requirements into cost through data collection, model building, and cost and risk analyses. You'll help to develop recommendations that will impact how hundreds of millions of dollars are invested throughout the project's life cycle. You'll help identify cost data to be collected, develop data collection plans, and review draft work breakdown structures (WBSs) and cost reporting plans. You will extract data about the technology and performance of submarine communications systems and undersea integration systems through discussions with SMEs, engineers, and project managers. You'll derive meaning from raw numbers using a variety of data science techniques, like normalizing data, performing statistical regression, and using learning curve analysis. From modeling with dynamic formulas in Microsoft Excel to quantifying cost uncertainty with Monte Carlo discrete event simulation, you'll use your experience in analytics and data visualization to interpret and convey meaning. By developing total ownership cost estimates, you'll help program managers, senior leadership, and your client to plan and field systems on time. This is your chance to gain skills in naval systems while continuing to build your cost analysis experience. Join us as we help fuel our country's Navy with the funding they need.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:   

2+ years of experience with cost estimating or data analytics

Experience with data collection and analysis

Experience with DoD acquisition and supporting major milestones

Knowledge of core competencies, including life cycle cost model development and Work Breakdown Structures (WBS)

Secret clearance

Bachelor's degree

Experience with the manufacturing process flow

Experience with management and business development

Ability to multitask and work under minimal supervision

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, or Economics

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Do you want to use your financial, analytical, and statistical skills to help the Navy and military clients get the most out of their funding to protect our national security? As an operations research analyst, you will review complex financial and cost data, build cost analysis models, perform cost benefit and cost savings analyses, and design leadership presentations and dashboards. You will work as part of a cross-functional team with clients to translate program requirements into cost estimates by using your knowledge and skills to gather data, document assumptions, and develop program office estimates and independent government cost estimates. You’ll build dashboards with modern visualization tools, develop cost and risk analyses using Monte Carlo simulation software such as Crystal Ball, and use data science to provide meaningful insight into the data.  

You will help introduce and recommend new ideas and solutions to clients that deliver visible insights with tangible results while being part of a supportive team that always helps you and roots you on. If you are ready for an opportunity to apply and grow your data analysis skills, then there is a place for you at Booz Allen.    

What You’ll Do: 
As an operations research analyst on our team, you’ll: 

Work on complex financial and cost models extending throughout a program lifecycle for major government clients. 

Present data to leadership through interactive dashboards using data visualization techniques such as Tableau or Power BI, to bring data to the forefront for real-time decision-making.

Build, manage, and improve complex financial and cost models, including program office estimates, independent government cost estimates, and cost and ad hoc models. 

Conduct advanced statistical analysis using scripting languages, including Python or R.

Analyze spend plans and budget inputs, develop program briefs and acquisition documentation, perform what-if and economic analyses, and participate in a variety of programmatic meetings. 

Develop defensible estimates to help your client successfully navigate various reviews, approvals, and program planning processes. 


Bring your analytical mindset and passion for change to help transform the military! 

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Requisition: R0219405 Naval Satellite Communications Instructor, Mid (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a defense mission professional, you ask questions others don’t. You understand the nuances of complex situations. You use your skills to think bigger and push further, solving complex problems. We’re looking for someone like you to help create solutions for missions that keep our nation safe.

You will familiarize the client with the best tools, processes, and training to impact U.S. Navy operations. You will deliver an interactive course that teaches critical tradecraft which requires a real passion for understanding the needs of your customer. We have an opportunity for an instructor and system operator who is committed to solving some of the toughest challenges in national security by crafting and delivering effective training focused on the problems encountered with Electromagnetic Interference (EMI).

On our team, you will work with Subject Matter Experts who are fellow instructors to identify and address your customer’s training needs by recommending learning solutions to help them accomplish their training objectives. You will leverage your subject matter expertise in Satellite Communications (SATCOM), Space-Based Operations, SATCOM Technical capabilities, Electronic Warfare, and the EMI Resolution Process which includes naturally occurring and man-made interference and SATCOM signal characterization tools. You will support the customer as a member of ashore and afloat mobile training and SATCOM EMI transmission teams providing training directly to U.S. Navy sailors. Putting the learner at the center of the training experience, you will design and deliver classroom and on-the-job training. You will facilitate virtual and in-person classroom training, including practice scenarios and hands-on training. You will also design, develop, implement, and evaluate new and existing courseware in preparation for deployment readiness exercises. To ensure your solution is hitting the mark, you’ll collect and analyze results using evaluation methodologies such as the Kirkpatrick Model and collaborate with U.S. Navy customers and fellow instructors to fine tune training for maximum impact. We focus on growing as a team to make the best solutions for our customers, so you’ll learn new tools and skills to develop a creative learning experience that will engage students. This position is located in Colorado Springs, CO.

Join us. The world can’t wait. 

You Have:  
2+ years of experience with technical and operational SATCOM
Experience with live classroom training
Knowledge of SATCOM and GPS fundamentals
Knowledge of published SATCOM or EMI policy and doctrine
Ability to interact, instruct, and mentor junior personnel on SATCOM operations
Ability to present and instruct material in a classroom and a hands-on environment
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time, including aboard Navy ships
TS/SCI clearance

Job Description:
Key Role: 
Advise and assist the geospatial intelligence client in executing its GEOINT Training and Professional Standards enterprise management duties as prescribed in DoDI 3305.10. Support the government lead in scheduling or facilitating meetings to provide a forum for GEOINT training collaboration in areas such as policy, standards, responsibilities, emerging GEOINT training requirements, and other related topics, as necessary. Conduct focused analysis and assessments at the direction of leadership. Target partnerships and relationships with internal and external entities to advocate, promote, or further the client’s corporate goals and equities. Assist with developing and recommending long-term organizational strategies, interoperability strategies, and strategic policies. Develop and recommend visions and goals for the organization that contribute to visions and goals. Identify future requirements based on projected technology advances and long-term objectives. Develop and recommend organizational performance metrics to measure and report progress against strategic intent and plans. Develop, facilitate, implement, and document initiatives that support long-term geospatial intelligence training and professionalization strategies, interoperability, and strategic policies, that include baselining GEOINT training, mapping GEOINT competencies, establishing, assessing, and mapping community GEOINT training standards, developing and maintaining common GEOINT course catalog and GEOINT portal, and implementing standard and repeatable GEOINT requirements processes. Support the development and assessment of program and annual plans. Develop, communicate, and implement standardized organizational planning templates or plans, including annual operating plans, project management plans, concepts of operation, standard operating procedures, and plans of action. Support discussions at internal and external meetings and participate in targeted issue or theme-specific activities related to strategic initiatives, strategic transformation activities, strategic communication, or representation. Participate in office-level leadership offsites to provide insights into ongoing activities or issues such as stakeholder engagement meetings. Participate in conferences or other related venues as directed. Coordinate and facilitate meetings, facilitate leadership offsites, and meet and coordinate with training organizations to exchanges ideas, issues, and concepts. Support the client with providing policy input and required reporting. Serve as a strategic and long-range planner and consultant responsible for developing the client’s view of the future and recommend detailed strategic policy, plans, initiatives, and concepts related to GEOINT training, internal relations, and selected other activities for the organization. Synchronize corporate and business activities to develop measurable strategic timetables, goals, objectives, and milestones implementing instructions, local plans, policies, and programs. Review agency or external planning documents such as strategy, campaign plans, and defense planning guidance, and ensure the organization’s strategic plan remain synchronized with current topics, future initiatives, and higher-level planning documents. Coordinate with customers, registrars, and coordinators to support GEOINT training requirements and enrollments.

1+ years of experience compiling and delivering decision briefs to seniors and their staffs
1+ years of experience assisting with formulating, analyzing, and resolving plans, policy, and business issues
Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph exam 
Bachelor's degree and 7+ years of experience supporting the DoD or IC with strategic and business planning, or 15+ years of experience supporting the DoD or IC with strategic and business planning in lieu of degree

Do you find yourself constantly looking for more and better information? Do you want a job where you can use your knowledge and research skills to improve national security? The problem facing the intelligence community is no longer how to get more data, it’s understanding how to turn the data they have into answers. That’s where you come in. With critical thinking and flexibility, you quickly seek out the accurate data sources, sift through the raw data, and turn it into valuable intelligence. Job Requisition: R0219428 Enterprise Cybersecurity Threat Hunt Lead (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Cyber threats are evolving, and perimeter security and automated protection aren’t enough—it’s time to go threat hunting. We need your help in detecting advanced cyber threats. Instead of letting the attackers come to us, let’s go find them.

We’re looking for an expert who can think like a cyber attacker to figure out how to circumvent security measures. You’ll use your network defense experience and analytical skills to rapidly prototype and build scripts to create haystacks and sift through the false positives to find patterns and indicators. Guide your team of cybersecurity experts or cyber threat hunter experts to find the adversary in the blind spot and advise the client on ways to close the gaps and harden their network. 

As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build technical solutions to help your customers meet their toughest challenges. This is a chance to think differently about cyber defense, use completely new tools and approaches, and develop the next generation of security analytics. 

We're looking for a seasoned leader with a deep understanding of cyber threats and the ability to use cutting-edge technology to thwart sophisticated attacks. As the Threat Hunt Lead, you’ll leverage your extensive experience and analytical skills to guide your team in querying vast datasets to pinpoint anomalies and uncover attack methods. You will collaborate closely with our detection engineers to review intelligence and hunt for signs of emerging threats, develop innovative hunt analytics, and identify visibility gaps while recommending strategic improvements to the organization's security posture. With your technical prowess, you’ll direct the team of threat hunters toward inventive solutions to strengthen the organization's defenses against cyber threats. You will also regularly and proactively interface with teams across the company to ensure a robust cybersecurity posture to support incident response, provide contextual insights and best practices, and improve defenses. This is an opportunity to revolutionize cyber defense, embrace state-of-the-art tools and methodologies, and propel security analytics into the future.  

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

10+ years of experience in cybersecurity, including threat hunting and detection engineering 

5+ years of experience in a leadership role guiding cybersecurity teams 

Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) 

Experience with cutting-edge technology, including artificial intelligence and machine learning, and developing and implementing advanced cyber defense strategies 

Experience applying detection frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK and SIGMA to a comprehensive threat detection program 

Knowledge of the unique challenges posed by on-prem environments and the cloud computing environments offered by Amazon, Google, and Microsoft

Knowledge of the strategic importance of threat detection and threat hunting within “blue team” and “purple team” methodologies 

Ability to clearly and concisely communicate the team’s technical work to business leaders and quickly adjust and prioritize tasks  

Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED


Nice If You Have:

Experience in threat hunting using Azure event logs 

Experience in threat hunting in AWS and GCP 

Experience utilizing data sources and artifacts from various platforms and technologies across networks, endpoints, and applications for threat hunting and detection purposes, including Carbon Black

Knowledge of the current threat landscape, including tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) of advanced threat actors

Ability to analyze logs and develop advanced queries in Splunk SPL, KQL, or Arcsight

Job Posting: Foreign Military Sales Logistics Analyst, Mid
Job Requisition: R0219421 Foreign Military Sales Logistics Analyst, Mid (Open)
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Are you searching for a position where you can use your program analysis skills to make a difference? A program requires a significant investment of limited resources across multiple projects. With that level of complexity, you need a skilled program analyst examining how those resources are used and keeping the program on the path to success. That’s why we need you, a logistics analyst who can ensure success through careful analysis and effective communication.

We have an opportunity for a program analyst to join our team as we support the U.S. Navy’s international initiatives to acquire, deliver, and sustain fully capable, interoperable, and operationally dominant partner nation combat systems. You’ll work with program leadership to monitor cost, schedule, and performance of multiple projects, using tools like Defense Security Assistance Management System (DSAMS), Management Information System for International Logistics (MISIL), Security Cooperation Information Portal (SCIP), and Case Execution Performance Tool (CEPT) and regular interactions with clients. The real power of program analysis comes from communication, so you’ll create Letters of Offer and Acceptance, Modifications, Amendments, status presentations, etc., and make recommendations for improvement to program leadership. We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. This is a chance to directly impact DoD Security Cooperation initiatives while learning how to develop program strategy and eliminate risks across projects. Join us and help make sure our program stays on-time and within budget as we improve the capability and interoperability of partner nation combat systems. You’ll work with program leadership to support Lifecycle Logistics elements and products by maintaining ship configuration data, technical documentation, material staging, material packaging handling storage and transportation (PHS&T).

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:
2+ years of experience with DoD FMS logistics or acquisition
Experience with coordinating with ILS Manager, logistics performers and activities, and review of ILS TPSs
Experience in assisting with identifying and tracking New Ship Construction major ILS program milestones including Logistics Program Plans, Installation Support Material (ISM), Installation and Checkout (INCO) spares material, Technical Documentation, Coordinated Shipboard Allowance List (COSAL), Publication and Outfitting spares or Consolidated Shore-based Material Allowance List (COSMAL), Allowance File and Shore-based Outfitting Spares or AEGIS Weapon System (AWS), and Tool Boxes or Maintenance Assistance Modules (MAMs)
Experience in drafting Cargo Offer letters for FMS case supported equipment, and coordinating shipment cargo offers based on country-specific In-Yard Need Dates (IYND)
Experience with supporting ILS Support requests and assisting in planning and preparing agendas and presentations for ILS Interface Working Groups (IWGs), Logistics Readiness Reviews (LRR), and key ILS engagements
Knowledge of Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products, performance-based logistics, configuration management, government-furnished material management, and FMS policies and processes
Knowledge of Foreign Military Sales management and financial systems, including DSAMS, MISIL, SCIP, and CEPT
Knowledge of DoD procedures and programs associated with FMS cases, as specified in the Security Assistance Management Manual (SAMM), including FMS case Letters of Offer and Acceptance (LOA) and the processes for LOA, modification, and amendment development
Secret clearance
Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:
Ability to self-start and multitask in a fast-paced environment and prioritize multiple tasks with minimal supervision
Defense Security Cooperation University (DSCU) Basic or Intermediate Certification in SC Planning, Oversight, and Execution Management, SC Case Life Cycle Management, SC Execution Support Management, or SC Acquisition Management

Job Profile: Geospatial and Remote Sensing Analyst, Senior Consultant
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
Critical decisions are made every single day to support our national security. What if you could use your analytical skills to help your client make informed decisions? With all the information available today, it takes a skilled analyst to know how to find and interpret the best data to give their clients the right answers. As a Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) Source Strategies Analyst (SSA), you use your specialized technical, regional, and functional experience and your attention to detail to develop geospatial information needs that give your client the actionable intelligence and context they need. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity to use those skills to support our warfighters, protect our national security, and inform our client and national leadership.

As a GEOINT collection manager on our team, you’ll help your client understand and implement the most efficient strategies to acquire the data they require. Using your understanding of various collection platform capabilities and applications, you will help your client develop effective collection strategies that combine information from disparate sources, including SIGINT, ELINT, MASINT, and open source, to enable automated tipping and queueing models. You’ll validate the information and apply collection analysis tradecraft as you work to refine further collection strategies against existing and emerging problem sets for warfighters, senior policymakers, internal clients, and U.S. Intelligence Community (IC) wide stakeholders. As the authority in your tradecraft, your client will look to you for time-critical recommendations, often under pressure. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills in Automated Tipping and Queueing software modeling tools, and share your methodologies with other analysts.

We focus on growing as a team to deliver the best support to our customers, so you’ll have resources for mentoring and learning new skills and tools. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our clients, warfighters, national leaders, and policymakers.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:

Experience with GEOINT collection management information systems

Knowledge of GEOINT tasking and collection processes and protocols

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Warnings about cyber threats are everywhere and the constantly evolving nature of these threats can make understanding them seem overwhelming to government agencies and law enforcement. In all of this “cyber noise”, how can these organizations understand their risks and how to mitigate them? The answer is you–build your knowledge as an Information Security Risk Specialist who knows how to break down complex threats into manageable plans of action.

As an Information Security Risk Specialist on our team, you’ll work with engineering and cybersecurity specialists as well as client leadership to discover their cyber risks, understand applicable policies, and develop a mitigation plan. You’ll get technical, environmental, and personnel details from SMEs and engineers to assess the entire threat landscape. Then, you’ll help your team guide your client through a plan of action with presentations, whitepapers, and milestones. You’ll work on translating security concepts for your client so they can make the best decisions to secure their mission-critical systems, what tools to use, and how to improve the security of the SOC. This is your opportunity to take an active role in information security while growing your skills by being immersed in the technical aspects of securing the network. Join us as we protect this client’s cybersecurity enterprise environment.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
5+ years of experience in a cybersecurity role
Experience providing operational security guidance and information system validation using the National Institute of Standards and Technology Risk Management Framework and local security policies for application infrastructure
Experience with Authority to Operate package development
Knowledge of Cloud-based infrastructure and DevSecOps principles and practices
Ability to use and operate security tools, including Tenable Nessus, SecurityCenter, IBM Guardium, HP WebInspect, or Network Mapper
Top Secret clearance
HS diploma or GED and 11+ years of experience with Information Technology, or Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of experience with Information Technology

Nice If You Have:
Knowledge of security controls and monitoring in container-based environments
Knowledge of Cloud-based networking
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics

Your combination of people skills and system administrator expertise makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. We’re looking for a Linux system administrator who specializes in Infrastructure as a Service, with a background in various flavors of Linux, such as Red Hat Enterprise Linux and Solaris to help us maintain and secure government IAAS solutions.

Your system administrator expertise will be vital as you identify problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission-critical network. You’ll help your team better understand the network by turning metrics into information and explaining their meaning.  

This is an opportunity to broaden your skillset into areas like IAAS. We focus on growing as a team, so you’ll share your expertise through leadership and mentoring as you help the team work through challenges and develop new methodologies. As a system administrator leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to modernize the network so your clients achieve their goals. Work with us and resolve daily challenges as we improve cloud solutions.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a defense mission professional, you ask questions others don’t. You understand the nuances of complex situations. You use your skills to think bigger and push further, solving complex problems. We’re looking for an expert like you to create solutions for missions that keep our nation safe.

As an experiment planner, you’ll bring your expertise to work alongside thought leaders on projects for future employment of emerging capabilities, weapons systems, or operating concepts. You’ll contribute your skills and expertise to conduct research, plan, execute, analyze, and report on the findings of high-priority fleet experimentation efforts.

You served your country as a Naval Officer, now continue your mission with us. Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 
8+ years of experience as a U.S. Military officer
Experience serving on a numbered fleet or major staff, or in a Warfighting Development Center
Experience as a tactical or operational planner, including fleet exercises
Knowledge of emerging operating concepts and capabilities
Knowledge of multiple mission areas
Ability to compile input from multiple authors, research discrepancies, analyze results, and produce a high-quality written product
Ability to embark on Navy ships, submarines, and aircraft
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time
TS/SCI clearance 
Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have: 
8+ years of experience as a U.S. Navy officer
Experience writing or developing tactics, techniques, and procedures
Knowledge of military requirements or acquisition processes
Master’s degree
Joint Professional Military Education (JPME) Certification
Warfare Tactics Instructor (WTI) Certification

Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
Join our acquisitions team supporting research and development (R&D) efforts within the intelligence community. Using your acquisitions knowledge and business management expertise, you will collaborate with Contracting Officer's Technical Representatives (COTRs) and provide the acquisitions and business acumen to effectively execute R&D programs.

As an Acquisitions Business Analyst, you will work with the agency’s business units, including plans, budget, and execution, contracts and interagency agreements, security, IT, and records and property management. Your extensive knowledge of the acquisition lifecycle will allow you to assist in the preparation and coordination of contracting materials such as Statement of Works (SOWs), Performance Work Statements (PWS), Determination and Findings Memorandums (D&Fs), acquisition plans, and proposal evaluation criteria. In your role, you will develop and maintain ongoing working relationships and expectations with internal and external stakeholders throughout the program life cycle. Job Description:
The Opportunity: 
As a low-code/no-code solution engineer, you know how to harness the latest technologies by developing low-code platforms and creating user-friendly solutions for your clients. We’re looking for a solution engineer like you to support the management of low-code development platforms from vision to production-ready, solving our clients’ most complex challenges.

You’ll lead the design, development, testing, and maintenance of business intelligence applications and provide end-user support for the implementation and usage of business intelligence systems. You’ll also apply specific functional knowledge and working or general industry knowledge, and develop or contribute to solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity.

As a low-code/no-code solution engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll broaden your skills in programming languages and databases, using little to no code to help us identify new techniques and improve the digital environment. You’ll use the latest cloud tools as you look for ways to support your team and develop creative solutions. Using your technical knowledge and your appetite to learn, you’ll work cross-collaboratively to help automate and accelerate cloud modernization and reduce system maintenance and development costs. 

You’ll be a trusted advisor to your clients as you help translate their IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting architectural patterns, design standards, and implementation best practices. 

Use your software support skills for good.

Job Description:
The Opportunity:  
As a data scientist, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data scientist at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors—from fraud detection to cancer research to national intelligence—we need you to help find the answers in the data. 

On our team, you’ll use your analytical skills and data science knowledge to create real-world impact. You’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop algorithms and systems and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to help clients make informed decisions. Ultimately, you’ll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used.  

Work with us as we use data science for good.  

Join us. The world can’t wait.
